h_content_comment: NA
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The location is very convenient for chilling around. The facility, the room are good. The breakfast is delicious. Especially, the staff is super nice and helpful. If have a chance, I will be back to this hotel again.

In our opinion, this is the good hotel, but not is the best. With this Price (20 usd) we feel happy with our staying. The room was not big with basic equipment and facilities, cozy and fresh. The staff was friendly and helpful! Lovely!

Having stayed at a sister hotel in Hanoi we had high hopes for this hotel. Some things are good. Mainly the staff who are super friendly and helpful. The position of the Hotel a short walk from the bars and restaurants but not noisy. Now the bad bits. It is very dated. I can only liken the feel of it to when I used to travel around the former soviet states in the early days and you took your own bath plugs. The room we had was large (needlessly so). It had a jacuzzi bath with a hand held shower. I am suspicious of jacuzzi baths as if not regularly cleaned they become pretty putrid. Having run the pump for 20 seconds the stench was unmistakable. Probably not cleaned for months. The hand held shower was stupidly powerful. I mean painfully so. It had no where to hang it on

I appreciated the nice welcome with fruit juice and fresh fruits. The hotel is centrally located. The room features a large comfy bed but they don't have a king size duvet and instead, they had two single duvets. It still works... The bathroom was large, clean and functional with all kinds of amenities. No view but it was very quiet at least. Very good breakfast with Ã  la carte and a buffet. Very friendly staff!!! The only negative point: it smelt like mildew. Was it from the filters of the AC???
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The rooms were a good size and very clean. The breakfast was sparse but did the job for a quick bite. The people were very courteous and pleasant to the guests. Not much of a view but were only there to sleep.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Everything in this hotel is extremely dated. I donâ€™t know how a hotel with black mold around the tub can have five stars. What does grout cost, 30 cents? I would have marked it terrible based on the room. However the staff were very friendly and helpful. Also, the food in the restaurant was quite good. The location is great. And, we only stayed for two nights, but they mopped the floors in our room when they cleaned, which I was impressed by.

Clean room, excellent staff, tasty breakfast. We enjoyed every moment of our stay and we we would definitely go back there. The hotel staff offered helpful recommendations for our stay in Hue and for our transportation. And we had an excellent journey from Da Nang airport to the hotel with the car provided by the hotel. Thank you!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: I was booked to stay at this hotel by Viet Vision Travel. Hotel staff initially were very friendly and soon after I was settled in my room I had lunch in the Hotel dining room. The food was excellent and staff very courteous and friendly. In the afternoon I had a shower and found the both towels stunk of stale vomit. The smell was so bad on both towels that by the time I finished drying myself my body smell of stale vomit. I complained to the front desk and they provided new towels. I asked the bell boy to smell both towels and confirm my complaint. Just providing new towels is not sufficient. I had wiped my whole body with these towel, including my face! This was a health issue that was not taken seriously enough and I argued with my Tour Company to find another Hotel for me.

We initially had a bit of a hickup on the first night because of guests being very noisy in the hallway at a very early hour of the night (4:00AM). It wasn't of course the hotel's fault even if I would have liked some support from the front office to manage the issue. Anyways, in the end it was an exceptional mishap as the night auditor had to step out urgently and wasn't present on my call for complaint. I always say that a good hotel is also assessed by how it handles these unfortunate matters. On my way to breakfast after I communicated what had happened, I was immediately given a string of apologies and Mary, the manager was excellent in handling the matter. She was genuinely concerned and took action on offering complimentary things. We declined even though it was so nice
h_title_comment: Very nice peaceful hotel with excellent smiling & effective service
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Have stayed at the Serene Palace Hotel four times and it never disappoints. Everything is perfect for us. The rooms are large and very comfortable. All amenities work well. The staff are an absolute asset to the hotel and really go out of their way to make sure your stay is enjoyable. The restaurant is the only place I eat at when I'm in Hue. They have a very extensive menu and everything is very well priced. I had a cocktail, a prawn cocktail and shared the chicken and cashews and it cost me $13.50. They have a lot of outside customers who eat at the restaurant as well.

We booked this hotel very last minute, around 2 minutes before we walked into reception.

Hotel let us check in straight away, always a plus.

Girl at reception helped me every day - booked us a full day tour of Hue and also booked us a bus transfer to Hoi Ann plus our accommodation in Hoi Ann - this took her around 5 minutes which was very helpful.

Can't remember her name or what she looked like as she was wearing a face mask but she went above and beyond to make our stay an enjoyable one.

The restaurant is also of a very high standard. (Number 1 on tripadvisor at the time of writing)
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Recently stayed for five nights and pleased that we chose this hotel. Lengthy health questionnaire to complete on arrival and given juice/fruit etc.

Room was functional but clean. Bars on the window in our 3rd floor room for security purposes as it backed on to nearby roofs. Housekeeping very eager to get into room of a morning so could have done with Do Not Disturb sign being provided.

Breakfast was fine although maybe could have done with some additional cold meats/cheeses being offered. Ate in the restaurant one night and that was again good.

Location was excellent with all sorts of bars/restaurants within walking distance.

All the reception staff were very friendly and professional in sorting trips / laundry etc.

Special mention to the lovely Sally in the restaurant who went out of her way to talk to us everyday and made us feel very welcome.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed in Serene Palace Hotel for 2 nights. It exceeded my expectations. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Their restaurant is also great. The only thing I did not like there, my room was above the kitchen. So I was not able to open the window. But their was an air conditioner in the room so it was not a big problem
h_title_comment: High class hotel for a good price
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The best thing with the hotel is the staff!Very friendly, helpful and serviceminded.
Superior room is clean. Bed is quite hard and pillows way to high (but helpful staff found a little lower one for me). Small window towards backyard so room a bit dark.
Price is cheap though, so overall its good.
Superior room 700.000 VDN/night (30 USD/night).
Complimentary water bottles and tea, different bathroom amenities like toothbrushes, cotton swabs, hair dryer etc.
Safety box in room. TV with different channels.
Breakfast small but satisfying. Different egg dishes made by order.
We would stay at Serene Palace again.
h_title_comment: Best thing is the staff and good value for price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Hue Serene Palace rooms are spacious, beds are comfy with ample pillows. Good selection for breakfast especially the hot entrees, fruit juices and fresh fruit. Towels could be whiter in colour and shower curtain and bathtub area smells of mildew. You can rent a motorbike from the hotel for a full day or half a day if you want to take a spin around the city or rent one from the place across the street.
There can be heard echoes and noises from the hallway or the floor above you at all hours due to the hard surfaces used, which can be annoying. Elevator is very handy for luggage and I appreciated the 2 free bottles of water per day (previous hotel provided 2 bottles on the first day only). Thereâ€™s also an intimidating, scowling old white dude in shorts thatâ€™s there almost all the time (maybe heâ€™s the owner) who needs to learn how to smile. This ancient and special city is home to thousands of little hotels! Thereâ€™s so much choice. Iâ€™m not sure I would stay here again.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: There were 3 of us in the room which had a queen and twin that were comfortable. The meals were delicious in the on site restaurant. The breakfast was included and was generous, good and very handy. The front desk arranged several tours for us that worked beautifully and Julia was very informative and made sure we understood what we were agreeing to. The location was ideal, it helped that there was a 31 flavored kem (ice cream) place pretty close to end the day...or start it. We were able to walk around town and get a feel for the town. All of the staff were wonderful and helpful.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcomed by giving us a drink and fruit upon arrival, then seeing to it that we had all information needed for any tours we wanted to do.
The room was large and clean.
The breakfast was amazing... lots of variety and the servers were very friendly and efficient. We would definitely stay here again!
h_title_comment: Best Hotel on our 3 week trip through Vietnam!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable and the room had lots of natural light, a beautiful balcony and all the facilities one could possibly need or want while travelling. The staff was most helpful and always pleasant and polite. They organized tours and transportation for us which was superb in each situation. The breakfast was amazing with lots of options and a wide variety of meal choices!
h_title_comment: A lovely boutique hotel close to the action but just secluded enough to be a quiet and relaxing place to stay.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Very nice small hotel in the heart off the old town .very good breakfast . Room clean everything you need .only downside view from the bedroom window did not exist make sure you request high floor . Short walk to all areas of interest 20 minutes to Imperial palace which is amazing .when leaving staff had packed us fresh fruit for thr journey very helpful friendly staff .
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This property is in a central location but far enough off the strip that you're away from the city noise. We had a suite on the top floor with a spacious room and a large balcony with a city view. The staff here was exceptional and communicated perfectly in english setting us up with a scooter multiple times .Would recommend renting a scooter through the hotel for the hai van pass as they can transfer you bags!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We stayed 3 nights in room 701 which is a top floor room with both a balcony with 2 chairs and a table and a spa bath. The room is well decorated and equipped. There were a great number of TV channels with a number in English - both news and movies.

The hotel fronts on an alley. Consequently, the room was very quiet and the A/C blocked out any remaining noise.

Both breakfast and dinner we're good.

The real distinction here was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. And, it was excellent value for money
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: What a pity that this place is so noisy! Friendly staff, good breakfast and good location but the way the hotel was build and allows guest at almost the last floor, to hear all guests at the reception. The elevators are noisy and the beds also so make sure you stay in the last level.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Super helpful staff with booking tours and drivers. Nice room. Be aware that it is near the lively bar and restaurant scene, good for party seekers, not ideal for those looking for quiet. The staff is very attentive and spotless clean.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We stayed for 4 nights at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. We stayed in a suite which I would have been happy with double the price I paid. The free breakfast (at the #1 rated restaurant on trip advisor) was excellent with many choices. The room was large with a comfortable bed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The entrance to the Hotel is down a thin alley but is easy to find and a short walk to all the action. Would definitely book again if returning to Hue.

Bill
Vancouver, Canada
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here in January 2020 and wood recommend that every Hotel send their staff here for training. The rooms were spacious and spotless. The breakfast was top-class and the staff were out of this world. If you are anywhere around Hue, don't even bother to research any other Hotel, this is the place to stay!!!.
Thank you so much for a magnificent experience
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We recently stayed at this hotel for one night and were really impressed by the service, restaurant and location - a very affordable holiday destination. Further, the staff we informative and kind - ensuring the best information for a great stay.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
This was a cheaper hotel than most of our others on our tour and great value.We had a great room on the 8th floor with a balcony.

It was in a sidestreet in a lively but not noisy area with lots of eating options close by. Service was great with really good advice on activities.

Breakfast was included and ok,
h_title_comment: Great value stay with very good service
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This is a very conveniently located and lovely little hotel. The rooms were bigger than expected, the beds comfortable and clean. The breakfast was substantial and a good start to the day and the staff were friendly.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
This hotel performs way better than I expected. The spread of the breakfast especially the ala carte order was a pleasant surprise . Bed was comfortable and overall it was value for money.
Receptionists was polite and took time to confirm my reservation and was surprised by the welcome drink too. Nice job team in the hotel. Thank you
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Excellent staff who were very helpful in planning our visits.located in a small street next to the main area of bars and restaurants the hotel had large rooms and a great restaurant. The breakfast was a buffet with cooked to order options
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Excellent situation, great and quiet room. Super breakfast. Staff very nice and location close to the sea. we went by bike on the historic HUE it was great. We enjoyed a lot our stay and for sure if we come back to this place, we'll stay here again!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Hotel has very reasonable prices. We booked a serene double room which was on the 7th floor so had great views from our balcony. The room was utilitarian but was spacious and clean with a complementary half bottle of wine. Breakfast was very good. Staff were friendly and helpful and worked hard to get us in our room as soon as possible despite our morning arrival. This hotel was very good value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My friend and I had an amazing time at the serene Palace Hotel. Even though we only stayed one night we wish we could have stayed more. Everyone was so nice and hospitable from the front desk when we checked in to the wait staff in the dining room to the housekeepers upstairs. We were greeted with a welcome drink and plate of fruit since we arrived in the morning and we were even able to check into our room early. We also really enjoyed our lunch there and could not believe how amazing the service was And how great the food tasting. As we were leaving the girls in the dining room even sent us off with a little to go box of fruit since they knew we had a long journey ahead of us. The rooms were very clean and everything you needed was provided for. The beds were super comfortable and we really enjoyed our stay. We will definitely be staying here next time weâ€™re in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Biggest highlight is the smiling and attentive staff! Thanks a lot for your support and flexibility, Mary and team, with making our stay and our travels such wonderful experience. Rooms are quiet, spacious, clean and breakfast offers a lot of choice.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Our stay at the Serene Palace Hue was wonderful. We had great Hotel and tour services. The wait and tour staff are five star. It was a most enjoyable stay. We will return to this hotel on our next visit to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Our stay in this hotel surpassed all of our expectations. It was very well maintained and clean, rooms are spacious and comfortable and location is near a lot of great restaurants but the best thing of all was the staff.
We were welcomed with fresh fruit and juice and everyone is so pleasant and helpful, they even packed us some fruit on our last day because they knew we had a long bus ride ahead of us, just lovely.
The breakfast is also top notch! If youâ€™re ever in Hue, donâ€™t hesitate to stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: By far the best value hotel I have stayed so far in Vietnam!!!! I was kinda skeptical when I was walking the Lil narrow road where is located but woa it did surprise me!!!!!!!! The lobby, the room and the restaurant were really good!!!!! I am sad I only stayed one night ðŸ˜¢I was on my way to hoi an ðŸ¤¦â€â™‚ï¸ the service was great!!!! My favorite part was the breakfast so yummy!!!! Good job guy!!! Ahh and there is a motorbike rent place just in front very convenient ðŸ™ðŸ™ðŸ™ðŸ™ðŸ™
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This is a hotel I would recommend to anyone, including my enemy if I have any. The room is clean, spacious, new, and well furnished. Staff is superb. Lien greeted us on our arrival, with warmth and advices. The free breakfast is yummy and sumptuous, with a big variety of fresh tropical fruits and items to order free from a menu. Donâ€™t take my words for granted. Give this hotel a shot. You wonâ€™t be regretted.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: My partner and I stayed two nights in Hue at the Hue Serene Palace. The reception team were lovely and friendly and always on hand to help with any questions we had during our stay. Julia was lovely when we first arrived with helping us organise our trips to the tomb and abandoned waterpark as well as a boat trip up to the Pagoda. The breakfast and restaurant within the hotel were superb. Highly recommend staying at the hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The redeeming quality of this hotel is the staff service. We were greeted upon arrival and promptly given some fruit juice and fresh fruit. We arrived early but did not have to wait long until a room was ready for us. We were escorted by a bellman and he showed the various features of the room. The two waitresses in the restaurant at dinner were also very pleasant and delivered prompt service.

The location wasn't ideal. It was tucked away in a back alley - a mile away from the Citadel. We don't mind walking it but for some, it might be a little too far out. The bathroom wasn't the best - the lighting is pretty dim and the caulking in the tub area was terrible. Therefore, it did not feel completely clean. We checked out around 6am and when we walked into the lobby, the overnight shift (bellman and night auditor) were literally sleeping on the couch in the lobby and a thin mattress on the floor. We had to wait for them to wake up and put on their shoes. I understand that this is an independent hotel, but as a traveler who works in the hotel industry, this was disappointing and honestly, a little irritating, especially since we had to be somewhere at a certain time. It is an overnight shift, but that's your shift to be on duty and to be attentive to any and all guest needs.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We spent two nights at this hotel in beautiful Hue and the service was impeccable. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful, always greeted us with a smile and went out of their way to make us comfortable. The ladies at the front desk were beyond helpful, making phone calls to set up transport for us and giving us good tips for site seeing. Their restaurant, the Serene Restaurant, has some of the best, if not the best food in Hue. You must have their Bun Bo Hue or the Banana Flower salad, so good! Their restaurant staff is also super friendly and made us feel right at home. The rooms are modern, comfortable, clean and quiet. If your into shopping and nightlife this hotel is only a couple of blocks from the hustle and bustle of Vo Thi Sau street.
We used the hotels car service to get from Da Nang to Hue and back to the Da Nang airport. Our drivers, Minh and Hai were both excellent, safe drivers. They were both kind and accommodating. I would definitely recommend using the hotels car service as they are safe, professional and use late model cars. Our first driver Minh was great, driving us from DAD to My Son, Hoi An, Hi Van Pass over look and always asking to make sure we were comfortable and if we want to stop for pictures. Our driver taking us back to Da Nang, Hai, was very friendly as well and funny. Hai made a two and a half hour ride fun and feel short. He was nice enough to stop and buy us some water and some sweet snacks for the ride. To me itâ€™s the little things that count to make for an excellent experience and these driver definitely did that for us. If you donâ€™t use this car service youâ€™re missing out.

Overall, Hue has become our favorite city. The city has wonderful cultural attributes, and some of the kindest and friendliest people we met while in Vietnam. Thatâ€™s saying a lot since most everyone in Vietnam is friendly!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I have been around, living in hotels in many countries and Vietnam, this is the hotel I would stay always, despite being tucked away in a tiny lane and in my opinion, consider this hotel amongst the top I have stayed in. The hotel location is neither urban nor rural because if you sit on the balcony you can hear the frogs sing after a rainy day and the cockerel crowing in the morning, with new buildings sprouting up in the surrounding landscape. (My concern is that Hue might develop too fast and lose the feel of a slightly laid back town to become just another modern town of coffee houses and restaurants and shopping centres.) I often sit at the balcony to meditate as the moon sets and watch the sunrise illuminating the growth progress of the city listening to the sounds of a country side setting.

The hotel ambience is one of a family hotel with a restaurant serving the best food in Hue. The staff here are always very helpful and what is important about hotel customer service, like a 6 star premium hotel, is that they remember customer preferences. They don't use a computer database here, just warm loyal staff who know the guest well.

Even if there are newer and modern hotels in Hue, my choice will always be this hotel. Never have I seen so many loyal guest who would stay for weeks or months. The staff seriously makes the difference and the boss and management of the group should really bear this in mind.

Another great thing about this hotel is the english language fluency of most of the staff , you get what you want when you ask the staff in english. I note that there are front desk staff like Alan who speaks basic Mandarin and I think I overheard him speak a European language, these are the people who would help bridge the communication gaps existing in many Vietnamese hotels. In developing countries, management normally encourage staff with a passion to communicate in another language like this by sponsoring them for language course as it is definitely a competitive advantage for the hotel to have such staff in the growing competition.
h_title_comment: A hotel away from home with high standards of customer service.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Loved this hotel.
Tucked away in what I as a "European" would call a side street.
BUT this is not a side street in Vietnamese terms, it is in an excellent location for everything. No noise.
The Staff on all levels are excellent and worth a good pat on the back from their managemnent team.
The room staff are great,lovely smiles everytime you meet them.
Breakfast staff are the same. Love to please.
I asked one day for a single poached egg with no bacon, girl on service said" Too small breakfast, eat more"
What can you say.

Within the "side" street there are a few good restaurants of various types,Japanese as well as local and international tastes.
Local family stores - bargain for prices.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We stayed 2 nights in Hue serene Palace Hotel. The room was excellent very large and clean, the hotel was tucked away in a quiet street. The staff very friendly and helpful and gave us fruit to take away for our train journey. In addition the restaurant provided a good breakfast and dinner was delicious.
It was the best value for money hotel we stayed in during our Vietnam tour and just as good as more expensive hotels.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The Serene Palace is a small hotel which is showing itâ€™s age. The staff are lovely and helpful but it was off putting when we were pushed to have dinner at the hotel by the staff as we are breakfast!

Beds were very comfortable so we were well rested and bathrooms were good too. Breakfast limited but enough to set you up for a day of sightseeing.
h_title_comment: Tucked away up a side street which is off putting
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This hotel is in a lovely location with some good eateries in the area and close to the town centre for good bars and restaurants. Our room was pleasant and the breakfast great. Staff as always in Vietnam, were fantastic.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Really nice clean hotel right near the centre of Hue. Great, polite, helpful staff and fantastic breakfast. Just a couple of minutes walk to the main bars and restaurants. Rooms are spacious and very quiet.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I had a mixed experience during my stay with Hue Serene Palace Hotel.
Pros: restaurant staff
Cons: driver booked through hotel, WiFi, showerhead

The woman who checked us in was very pushy about having us book a driver through them when we had only just walked in the door. This was after we were mobbed by men as soon as we got off the train to hire them as drivers but we were already warned to only take the white and green taxis in Hue. We had to tell the Serene Palace reception lady more than twice that we needed some time to think about it and she finally backed off. Please chill out and let us enjoy our welcome drinks and fruit without trying to up-sell as soon as we walk in the door. The WiFi was not working while we waited in the lobby and I was told they had some issues with the WiFi but it would work in the room. I was trying to make arrangements while waiting for the room to be ready and when we were allowed in the room the WiFi on the floor did not work. I called the front desk and it eventually worked.

We had a special occasion to celebrate and the staff kindly made swans from towels on the bed and a mini bottle of Vietnamese wine which was very much appreciated. The showerhead didnâ€™t stay at the right angle which was difficult to use but a minor point.

We ate the set menu for dinner at the hotel and everything was delicious and the servers were very attentive. We also had breakfast and they even packed some fruit for us to take on the road. This was the highlight of our stay.

The low point of our experience was that we booked the Serene Palace driver (this is their driver and the car even had giant letters advertising the hotel) to take us to My Son sanctuary and then Hoi An. At $90 USD I thought it was a bit expensive for a driver (not a tour guide). But the hotel told us it was because of the tolls which add up to $15 USD alone. We trusted the hotel and told the driver we only wanted to go to My Son as we already came from Danang and didnâ€™t need to go anywhere else. He said he would only stop if we wanted to stop at places for photos but we told him more than once just go to My Son. At a couple points on the drive we asked how much longer as it was taking us quite a bit longer than expected and we realized he was driving us through Danang. We arrived at My Son not at the expected 2.5 hours, but it took us 4 hours! He ended up taking us on local roads and avoiding some of the toll roads.

No one likes to feel taken advantage of and so I advise caution before booking a driver through Hue Serene Palace Hotel. I am not sure if the driver did this on his own to pocket the extra money but ultimately the hotel needs to stand behind their employeesâ€™ behavior.

So one star for the driver, 5 stars for the restaurant, 3 stars for the front desk hustle and I give an average of 2-3 stars for the Hue (Not-so) Serene Palace Hotel.
h_title_comment: Great restaurant staff, needs some improvement
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We enjoyed this hotel. I didn't find the location out of the way like some other reviewers but then again, my husband and I do like to walk a lot. The breakfast is great and it was convenient having a full restaurant in house. Staff are extremely helpful and really nice. The hotel is not a luxury accommodation but it is clean enough with good service and a really great price.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This hotel was really nice, and the staff was helpful and accommodating. The location was a little out of the way, but it was still near a lot of great restaurants and bars. Also, the restaurant in the hotel was great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and I canâ€™t say enough good things about the hotel and staff. The hotel was in good walking distance to everything and the room and facilities were excellent! The staff was super friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. The breakfast was cooked to your order, lots of choices and delicious. I thoroughly recommend this beautiful hotel in this beautiful city. Excellent value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very friendly staff and located in a quiet alley away from traffic. Charming restaurant in the ground floor that served traditional dishes and great breakfast. Laundry facilities near by. Also took advantage of their massage services in a sister hotel which was excellent.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Staff was supper friendly and helpful. you have to walk a bit to the hotel since the road is not allowed for vehicles. located in center of tourist area. But the hotel is supper, the room was big and comfy. supper clean and beautiful. The breakfast is delicious the restaurant staff is the best. simply worth for the money. highly recommended.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Good location for Hue, about 1km to 2km from the citadel. Tucked away in a quiet alley which is common for Hue. Very close to food, shopping and entertainment. Very friendly staff. Very courteous and professional, willing to go the extra mile to help you. Breakfast is very good too. Good value for money here and wonderful staff.
h_title_comment: Good value for money here and wonderful staff and good breakfast
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of September 2019 and could not have been more impressed. The staff here was THE BEST of any of my hotels throughout Vietnam on this 11 night tour of the country. For a extremely reasonable property costwise, this is absolutely THE BEST VALUE maybe in the whole country! Of course, I did not stay everywhere in the country, but clearly I was/am impressed. Beautifully kept up rooms, outstandingly clean and well-services daily, and the restaurant for both breakfast and dinner could not have been much better.
h_title_comment: Wow! What Value and Service in a 3-star Property
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The hotel is great. Very well situated for all the bars and restaurants in what becomes a walking district at night over the weekends. It is also close to the river and the boat station for trips out. The restaurant serves a very good breakfast and a very high quality and reasonably priced dinner. The room we had was spacious and very comfortable. As for the staff, they are all extremely welcoming, friendly and very helpful. If We come back to Hue we would gladly stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel fulfilled my needs from start to finish. They welcomed me with a cold drink and fresh fruit. My room was a great size, with a small seating area, desk, and closet (with small safe). Staff were friendly and happy to help with anything. Laundry was fast and cheap. They helped me get a taxi to the train station and printed my boarding pass. Breakfast was free, with long hours, made to order food, and fresh juice and fruits. And delicious Vietnamese coffee!

I booked my own activities (highly recommend the I Love Hue lady motorbike food tour), but they were happy to provide recommendations. Lots of things in walking distance, yet the location down a small alley made it quiet.

The ac unit was a little noisy, but it also helped with white noise. Mine did not have a timer like another review mentioned. I was right by the elevator but barely heard any noise. I would prefer a higher shower head (and Iâ€™m not tall). Itâ€™s one of the hand-held types that has a mounting on the wall. Also, they had shampoo but no conditioner.

Overall, this was great for my 3 night stay. I would return.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We had a lovely stay here. The breakfast was amazing, staff were super helpful and friendly (thanks to Lee for sorting out a driver for the afternoon and giving us some great tips on what to see), the room was great and we had a beautiful view of perfume river. Highly recommend!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
our room is good size.
breakfast is order to cook, and a lot of fruit and juice.
after booking, will receive email to help for pick up and train ticket.
helpful us booking train ticket and even arrange to pick up from Hoi an.
staff is efficient and good English.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We only Stayed one night at serene Palace and it was amazing! Very friendly staff. We could Check in early and Even got a room Upgrade! Also they Showed us Directly where to Go and what to See. We would recommend the Hotel to everyone.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great value for the money. Good location, 2 minute walk to the action. Hotel is very quiet, breakfast included which is really good. Hotel was clean and spacious. Only thing that was slightly annoying is the AC is on a timer so it automatically shuts off every couple hours so when youâ€™ll probably wake up once to turn it back on and it shuts off when youâ€™re out. There is a nice bar right next door that plays great music ( secret lounge ) FYI the lounge is really expensive but a great setting. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel. Photos on Hotels.com are accurate.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I booked one night at the Serene Palace Hotel and then decided to stay two more. Originally, I had a balcony room which was only slightly bigger than the room I took at the back of the building, which was about $20AUD cheaper.
The rooms were very clean, the bed comfortable, water & tea/coffee were complimentary.
The staff were, to a person, very helpful and friendly. The waitresses in the restaurant were exceptionally nice. No-one tried to sell me on tours etc, for which I was grateful.
The breakfast is a combination of buffet and a la carte. I helped myself to the buffet: cereal, milk, tea, coffee, 4 different kinds of juice, croissants, baguettes, fruit, yoghurt, toast, ham, tomato, cucumber & lettuce. It was all very fresh & tasty.

The hotel is a few streets back from all the bars & restaurants so fairly quiet. Some reviews have said the building is noisy. Apart from the occasional chair scraping and, once, children in the stairwell, I slept soundly and wasn't unduly disturbed.

I would recommend the Serene Palace Hotel as a good one to in which to base yourself for a short stay in Hue.
h_title_comment: Good location, good food, friendly staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The hotel was in a great location and the staff were super helpful and friendly, helping us to book onward travel, recommending good places to eat, and let us check in early after getting the awful sleeper train! Breakfast was good and plentiful. Absolutely no complaints.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Big rooms, comfy beds, friendly and helpful staff, and room service! Absolutely loved staying here. Kelly was great, helped us organise many trips around Hue. Also located close to lots of places to eat and drink. Thanks for having us!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed for 2 nights at the hotel and were immediately impressed with the friendly and professional service and comfortable rooms. The staff were helpful and shared good information about local attractions, and helped us set up various transfers and trips. The room was clean and super spacious, one of the biggest weâ€™ve seen!

The breakfast was also great, and free! Would stay here again if we come back to Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stumbled on this hotel on Wotif

What a wee delight. Ideally situated in a quiet lane a block or so back from the pretty lively Hue streets. ( Each weekend these streets have traffic banned, leading to a lively street atmosphere - children playing ball, restaurants and bars packed with the footpaths used as trading space, loud music competing with the hubbub of conversation and street bands .)

An easy walk to the action and an easy walk to a quiet retreat.

Modern hotel , great food and staff very keen to be helpful. Laundry service is very good value ( USD 1 per kilo at time of writing )

Large clean quiet rooms with comfortable beds ie less hard than the seeming Vietnam norm

If we return to Hue, weâ€d rebook here.

Really good value
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Hue Serene Palace Hotel arranged an air port pick up which I greatly appreciated, being my first trip (solo) to this part of the world. Upon check in, a tour of the city was organised for the next day. Wow for service!!

I was assigned a large (surprisingly) room on the seventh floor. The bed was very comfortable, the room fully air conditioned and the bathroom (for one person) was huge.

The hotel is ideally situated, close to restaurants as well as street food vendors. The staff were very friendly (hence reason for booking a tour at check in). I can not find anything to fault the hotel on.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The room is spacious. We went 4 adults with all our lugage and at no time we had the feeling of being pressed.
Breakfast is very varied and very good. Incredible juices, totally natural and the amount of fruit available.
The location scares a bit, because it is a very narrow street. A little away from the Citadele. But with a taxi (very cheap), in 5 minutes you're there.
I recommend upgrading the amenities. The amount of shower soap that they put for 4 people is fair. Maybe it's usual in Vietnam, because it has happened to us in other hotels.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We had an excellent stay in this small but very comfortable hotel. Especially the restaurant was a very good surprise! just in front you can rent some scooters. The staff is extremely friendly and helpfull.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We were greeted with a welcome drink & fresh fruit. All staff extremely friendly and helpful and provide you with a little map of the city and some recommendations. The room was nice and clean, comfy bed and great shower. Breakfast was good, lots of options. In a good location with restaurants and bars nearby. I would definitely recommend to eat at the restaurant just down the road called Rissotto, very good Italian.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We arrived at our hotel quite late in the evening but the staff were friendly and welcoming and had even arranged a cake and a bottle of wine in our room on arrival as a gift from friends back in the Netherlands for my birthday. The room was nice and the breakfast was good.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The staff at Hue Serene Palace Hotel were all so helpful and friendly. They were fantastic in helping us organise ourselves in sightseeing around Hue but without being in the least bit pushy. Kelly helped us the most but all the reception staff were great. The rooms are comfortable and extremely clean with a good sized bathroom. There is good air con. The breakfast is buffet style for cold food plus hot food is cooked to order by the absolutely lovely restaurant staff. The hotel is in a quiet side street (with a lovely bar two doors down) but 5 minutes around the corner is a bustling area full of restaurants and bars. I have no hesitation in recommending Hue Serene Palace.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We spent 2 nights in Serene Palace Hotel in Hue and this experience was beyond our expectations.
For a very reasonable price, you have a tasty restaurant, a very good SPA and a cosy bedroom with large beds. But the most important point was definately the friendliness of the professional staff who speaks fluently English and who was always ready to help us and gave us tips on what to do.
We strongly recommend this place, especially for couples !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Hue Serene Palace is not a 5 star hotel, but it is a very nice hotel quite worth the value and I must particularly recommend the staff here. They went way beyond helpful, exceedingly friendly, professional, and just super nice. The hotel has a very good Vietnamese restaurant as well.
h_title_comment: A wonder place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Greeted with a fruit bowl and a drink two and a half hours before check in time.Mary was a wonderful host/ receptionist they organised a scooter for hire at a good price.the room was great good balcony views of the area. Ate in the restraunts at night fantastic food and good price staff were welcoming and attentive would highly recommend. Breakfast was absolutely perfect for a big breakfast eater I rate Serene palace and there restraunt 5 stars without a doubt,enjoy you won't be dissapared.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The staff were exceptional; friendly, helpful and served delicious food. We had the set menu as recommended on trip advisor and werenâ€™t disappointed. The staff helped us arrange a private tour and a taxi to the airport. The rooms were clean and spacious, and in a quiet street in walking distance of the main attractions.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
The staff is very helpful and kindly provide us the information about the magnificent sights in Hue and also a comfortable private transportation for our experience .
The hotel location is great ,near to the Citadel and there are many restaurants and coffee shops around the hotel.
The room was spacious and clean!
Thank you Hue Serene Palace!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This accommodation was my favourite place to stay throughout our ten day trip in Vietnam. The unit was very nice, clean and well fitted out. Good air conditioning, food at attached restaurant was very nice and reasonable cost. The staff however made the place, they were wonderful, very welcoming and genuinely nice. Would definitely recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
1- The hotel is in the peaceful lane where has everything you need: grocery, restaurant, cafe, lounge, motorbike for rent, etc. It's also very convenient to go to Huong's river & Trang Tien bridge.
2- The room is very clean. Room 701 has a beautiful balcony & stunning view.
3- The staff is very friendly and hospitable.

However, there is only mirror in the bathroom. If there were a mirror in the room, it would be perfect.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Excellent staff. Recommended a very nice guide to us and helped us with all kinds of questions. Location is great, Ok breakfast, We stayed for only one night. Rooms have a nice size. We will be back . Recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Our time in Hue was short but so worth every minute! This hotel was beyond what we expected! Dedicated, kind and knowledgeable staff. We were always greeted with a big smile and asked about our needs. We got welcomed at the door with fruits and drinks and they even took the time to explain the map of Hue and how to get around. They also offered to buy our train tickets for us so we wouldn't have to go back to the train station. The room was a delight with a very comfortable bed. The spa in the hotel was also very great. We got full body treatments and facials and wow! Thank you again for an amazing time!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel offers very good value for money.

Huge room, big comfy bed, very quiet location (even though it is next door to a hostel!)

Very clean hotel and friendly staff.

Only fault with the stay was breakfast is not great, and the restaurant food is not as good as the local restaurants close by.
Would recommend to anyone travelling to hue:)
h_title_comment: Canâ€™t go wrong with this hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stayed in Superior Double room for 2 nights during visit to Hue. This hotel scores well on all fronts the moment you step into their lobby. The front desk team led by Ms Mary assist you with a warm smile & by the time your Check-in formalities are done, you are served a welcome drink with fresh cut fruits. The rooms are very spacious with elegant furnishings & classy interiors. Amenities include wall mounted wide LCD & AC, electric kettle, Minibar, Intercom, wardrobe & clothes rack, Sofa seats with Coffee Table & Desk, clean linen & very comfortable large sized bed, attached shower & premium toiletries. Overall, nothing less than a 5 Star property. Just 5-7 minutes walk to thye riverside promenade, 8-10 minutes walk to the Night market. The Forbidden City ( Citadel-Palace-Royal Antiques Museum) are about 2 Kms away while the 3 popular Emperor Tombs are 6-8 Kms away ( the total distance travelled for completing the Tomb tour is approx 25-30 Kms ). The Hotel lies in the touristy zone, most happening area of the city with lots of dining options. The bus station is little more than 1 Km away while the railway ( Train) station is about 3 Kms away from this hotel. We preferred the Bricks Cafe & Mr. Thinh's Fries nearby. The hotel's restaurant too serves relishing food. Indian cuisine too, is available just 5 minutes walk from the hotel at Shiva Shakti Restaurant, managed by the famous chain - Ganesh Indian Cuisine. The breakfast served by the hotel is awesome with lots of options to choose from. Motorvina located right opposite this hotel offers motorbikes for rent at very reasonable rates for local sightseeing & even for riding up to HoiAn & DaNang.
Overall, this is the best option for a comfortable stay while in Hue.
h_title_comment: Awesome amenities very reasonably priced with amazing location & relishing breakfast for a comfortable stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed for one night in Hue at Serene Hotel - a family room. Very big and very clean !!!

We booked via Hotels.com and for the first time ever we were contacted proactively if any further assistance about Hue and transportation were needed.

A very nice service and we booked a transfer directly with the hotel hassle free.

We can only recommend Serene Hotel !!!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The staff at Serene Palace are amazing. I know we get excellent service in Vietnam as a whole, but this staff really stands out above the rest. Not only do they help out with the usual things like tours and flights, but they really seem to take a special interest in each guest. They are very personable.

The rooms were very clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable. If you like having outdoor space, I recommend you upgrade to a balcony room. There is no other outdoor space. The front of the hotel is on an alley with no space for chairs to sit. There is space to sit inside the lobby though.

The restaurant in the hotel is fabulous. It is currently ranked the #1 restaurant in Hue. (At the time of my visit, July, 2019.). It was so good, I didnâ€™t eat anywhere else while in Hue. They have a Hue specialty menu, which I worked my way through, and everything was delicious. I especially liked the item that comes with about 6 little dishes. I canâ€™t remember the name but will attach the picture. Donâ€™t miss this!

In the restaurant, all the staff were super friendly. However, Sally is something special. I caught a cold just before arriving to the hotel, and she made me a special ginger tea with fresh cut ginger, lime and honey. Not only did she do this for me once, but she did it every meal for the 3 days I was there. By the time I left the cold was gone. She takes a special interest in her customers and makes you feel like a friend. In my 3 weeks of travel to over 8 hotels and many more restaurants, Sally stands out above the rest for customer service. The restaurant has its own Trip Advisor page and I will paste this review there as well.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Great location if travelling from airport on the bus. Short walk from most things.
Itâ€™s about a mile or two from the Forbidden city and itâ€™s a nice leisurely scenic walk. Area has great bars and restaurants with good prices.
Hotel was great. Lovely and accommodating staff who were always welcoming.
Bedroom was a good size and comfortable. Noisy from kitchen in the morning due to bedroom location. Breakfast fresh and nice.
All in all great stay.
h_title_comment: Near Forbidden City and great food nearby
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel is easily one of the best I've stayed at anywhere in the world at this price point. The staff were all friendly and helpful and my room was spacious and very clean. It felt like staying in a Sheraton or Marriott at a fraction of the price.

I would also recommend trying their onsite restaurant. The prices are higher than what you'll pay elsewhere, but the food was quite good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Our stay at Serene Palace Hotel Hue was absolutely fantastic. Upon arriving, we were greeted with a welcome drink and fruit, the lovely staff explained the city comprehensively and helped us arrange an excellent tour of the main historical attractions. The room was beautiful and well-equipped.

We also had the pleasure of enjoying the spa packages at their sister hotel nearby and the delicious local food at the Serene Cuisine Restaurant. The hotel is conveniently located in the main dining and tourist district, and just a short walk to the beautiful perfume river.
h_title_comment: A wonderful experience in the heart of Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
3 stars like 5 stars!! Room was clean and front desk spoke English well, they react very quickly and nice by mail, calls. Breakfast was good. Restaurant are very prepared and kind enough preparing some fruit when I left.
I strongly recommend this Hotel.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Very spacious corridor and comfortable room. The room comes with a computer that you can use to surf the internet. There are CNN, National Geography, entertainment English channels. There is also an in-house restaurant that serves nice local, western cuisine for breakfast, lunch and dinner
h_title_comment: Spacious room with computer, English TV program and an in house restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch & dinner
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The first time we stayed in hotel but there make me feel comfortable and enjoyable during the trip. The room was awesome. The staffs were friendly and helped us. Great location nearby waking street and many restaurants coffee shop with great locals food( Bun Bo, Chao Bo, Bun Hen...). I think Hue cuisine is best in Vietnam!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene Palace is an awesome hotel with friendly and helpful staff. This was my second stay with them and it was just as great as the first time. The hotel is off a quiet alley but close to everything. They can arrange everything from tours to laundry for you so you can enjoy visiting Hue. The breakfast is awesome and room service is fast. The views from the rooms are greta for pictures too. The really best part of this hotel is the staff - everyone is friendly and genuine - they are a great asset to the hotel but even a better example of how sweet and awesome Hue is.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I was in Hue for a few days after first visiting Hanoi. First thing I noticed, how incredibly kind and helpful the staff was. Smiles and welcoming upon every moment of engagement. The space? Beautifully arranged, clean clean clean, and so spacious. The breakfast was amazing! Delicious spread of local and traditional western breakfast. Being a foodie and indulging on street food throughout my travels, i was most impressed with the daily variety of fruit provided. Also, the hotel staff assisted with arranging massages as well bike rentals to visit local towns with directions and connecting us with a personal tour guide who was an all star! All in all,.. I loved everything about Serene Palace and Hue Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The hotel is located very close to the center, in a narrow street and in a quiet location, no noise from the street.
In the room all was working correctly, was very clean and comfortable.
The staff was polite and helpful.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: My stay here was a wonderful even though short, I wish I could have stayed longer, clean, modern room with great amenities, friendly staff and delicious breakfast. Would highly recommend this hotel and if I come back to Hue would stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: My family just spent 10 nights in Vietnam while visiting North, Central, and South. Our 3 nights at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel (Central Vietnam) were our best ones. The experience was exceptionally good from arrival to departure. The hotel ensured transportation from the airport. They greeted us was fresh fruit in the their clean, modern lobby. Our room was large and well-appointed with comfortable, king-size beds and a great bathroom and shower. Each day, fresh fruit was delivered to our room. Our rate included breakfast which turned out to be awesome in the hotel restaurant. Of our three lodging destinations in Vietnam (Hanoi, Hue, and Saigon), this is this only hotel to which I would definitely return. If you are considering this hotel, I strongly recommend it. You will not be disappointed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Location is great, it's about 5 minutes walk to the western walking street with many shops and eateries around. The staff were very helpful and thoughtful. The food in the hotel restaurant was also very good and value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Excellent. Superior service and communication. Outstanding. Would stay again and highly recommend. Good location. I missed breakfast since I slept in late and they insisted I take some fresh fruit to go.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My friends and I booked one night to stay in Junior Twin rooms in Hue Serene Palace Hotel in May 2019.

We had a wonderful stay with good clean rooms plus yummy breakfast in the Serene Restaurant which we could order what we like from the menu which will come freshly cooked and there are 3 types of freshly squeezed juices like passion fruit , watermelon for breakfast .

The restaurant staff are so thoughtful that they give us box of freshly cut fruits to take with us when we check out of the hotel .

We also enjoyed having our lunch at the Serene Restaurant which served yummy food like the pomelo salad , lotus seed dessert : ) My friend loved the lotus seed dessert and the staff was willing to share how it was cooked.

The stay was made wonderful by the very friendly staff who are always smiling and checking whether we need anything and they are also helpful . A big thank you to all staff from the reception desk, porters, restaurant staff , housekeeping staff for everything and keep up your good work as you made every guest felt so important : )
h_title_comment: A good hotel to stay in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Had a wonderful breakfast, especially their mango, sweet. Their staff are friendly. They recommend us to take a stroll to their weekends night - walking street (5 mins walk). Live band, sitting down by the road, enjoying their music.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Hotel staff is super friendly and helpful. We especially love the restaurant staff. There is a petite lady who attend to us during breakfast. We are amazed with the breakfast selection and awesome food that we end us having dinner set there too. We love the mangoes (so sweet) and banana honey chocolate crepes for breakfast. Omelette w cheeses is nice. Room is comfortable and quiet. Will definitely stay there again.
h_title_comment: Best ever stay in Vietnam - Wonderful breakfast
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Spent 3 nights at this lovely hotel in the historic city of Hue. Great location, big comfortable rooms with A/C and all amenities. Staff is so friendly, helpful and professional. Great dining on first floor. Canâ€™t wait to go back!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We had a wonderful stay at Hue Serene Palace! The room was large with a huge comfy bed and a balcony for enjoying a drink as the sun set over the city. We found the air con to be good and definitely needed as it was very hot during our stay! Reception staff were extremely helpful with lots of information. We booked a driver to take us out to the tombs and also a car to take us to Hoi An (with stops at the lagoon, Hai Van Pass and Marble Mountains on route). Both drivers had excellent English and went out their way to ensure we were comfortable. We were staying over a weekend so the hotels location was great, close to all the bars but quiet when we were ready to call it a night. The restaurant staff were extremely friendly and even made us up a box of goodies for a snack for our onwards journey to Hoi An. We would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the area.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had a wonderful one night stay at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. We used their airport pickup service which made getting our late night ride from the airport to hotel easy and quick. The staff at Serene Palace were extremely friendly, helpful, and spoke good english. They held our bags at the hotel after checking out, so we didnâ€™t have to carry them around for the rest of the day until we caught our next train. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Breakfast had a large variety of options and was very good. Would stay here again next time weâ€™re in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed in family room at Serene palace hotel. Room was spacious, breakfast was really filling and staff was good. Only drawback was AC, it was really underpowered for that room. Even at night we were not comfortable at all. Day time we were sweating in the room.They have to put more powerful AC.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Me and my partner traveled down from Hanoi via train (13 hour over night), we arrived exhausted and wanting to crash somewhere asap, however we arrived at 9am, and check in was not until 2pm.

The team at the Hue Serene Palace hotel were incredible, the welcomed us warmly and offered a nice refreshing drink and fruits (Much needed). They managed to sort out our room within 15 minutes of arrival! The beds were comfy rooms very spacious and clean.

Location is right next to the busy streets where there is plenty of street food/shops/restaurants and things to do, whilst also being tucked away in an alleyway making it nice and quiet if you want that!

We were able to hire bikes and explore the city and the staff gave good recommendations. We also organised hiring bikes from the hotel to our next stop on da nang and the staff were great!

10/10 100%

Thank you for an amazing few nights!

(Also Iâ€™ll add that we enjoyed so much we extended our stay without hassle)
h_title_comment: Very comfy, friendly staff and perfect location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff at this hotel was very friendly and helpful. Kelly answered when I called from the airport to ask how much I should pay for my taxi and when I arrived to the hotel she took care of my check-in. Kelly took her time to go over the Hue map with me and helped to create my plan for Hue and book my tours. I told her I wanted to go to my room to think about all the options she gave me and she didnâ€™t pressure me into anything, she just told me they would be there when I was ready. The room was a good size and the balcony was a nice touch. I had an awesome view of the city. There was plenty of storage space for unpacking your bags. My only issue with the room was the hand held shower vs the shower being on the wall. The ladies in the restaurant were always pleasant for breakfast. They offered cooked to order options for breakfast and then they had a fruit and bread buffet to go with your entree. The location was great for walking around the town. I caught a taxi to the Citadel and walked back. I was glad I chose to walk back because I noticed how close the walking streets were with tons of food options. I wish I would have stayed in Hue more than two nights.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: During my tour through Asia this was the first hotel to tick all the "boxes" given in its booking information. The room was very comfortable in fact the bed was huge and I am 185cm tall. Its position is in a narrow street between two main roads giving it a lovely ambience/caricature feel about its position. The staff ( I hate that word) were just brilliant, so happy, friendly and friendly. Thanks for making my stay so enjoyable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
First, I must thank the attentive and friendly staff at Hue Serene Palace Hotel for a very memorable and enjoyable first trip to Hue City, and to Vietnam. This includes the front desk, the housekeepers, the bell boys and separate kitchen waitresses and cooks. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent but a separate business operation so it will be covered in another TripAdvisor report.

Prior to arrival, several emails were exchanged with the hotel staff to arrange for transportation from the airport located a few miles south. When I got off the plane and made my way outside the Phu Bai Airport terminal, private transportation was waiting for me as promised. Off to a good start, I had a great ride into town taking in the sights and taking photos and video clips from the front seat.

The Hue Serene Palace Hotel is located in a busy alley just a block or two from a main thoroughfare which parallels the Perfume River just to the north. I was dropped off in front of the lobby and hotel staff collected my single, handcarry bag. Upon introducing myself to the front desk, I was immediately presented with a plate of fresh, tropical fruits and a juice drink while the hotel staff got me all signed in. They did the work, while all I had to do was relax and enjoy. I noticed right away that the hotel lobby and front desk area was exceptionally clean, modern and stylish. With check in complete, I spoke with Maya (her chosen western name) for several minutes regarding plans for tours of Hue and excursions in the coming days. Maya was very cheerful and helpful in getting everything arranged. She also had a great sense of humor and spoke English very well. I can't emphasize enough how hard everyone worked to make sure I was having the best vacation stay possible.

The room looks exactly like it does in the photos, fresh, clean and exceedingly neat. Everything is up to date and the room itself affords plenty of space to move around. The bedding and linens were excellent and made for a very comfortable place to sleep after spending hours exploring the ancient city and surrounding areas. The hotel also left a fresh plate of fruit in the room every day which was a nice touch. For those who may have left their tablet or laptop at home, each room is equipped with a desktop personal computer with internet connectivity. There was also a small safe located in the room suitable for passports and important travel documents and perhaps a cell phone. The WiFi network in the building had very good speed and I didn't experience any noticeable or significant dropouts. The WiFi was easily good enough to make FaceTime calls with clear video. My room was on the sixth floor but fortunately there is an elevator. My sixth floor room was in the front of the building and with the curtains opened featured a really unique and picturesque view of the surrounding rooftops near the hotel. The room also featured a balcony which I used mostly to take photographs or listen to the sounds of the city at night.

The bathroom was really nice and well maintained, again just as it looks in the photos on the website. A glass shower enclosure with a multiple outlet water delivery, spray, rain or just faucet. The housekeeping staff did as good of a job with keeping the bathroom tidy as they did with the rest of the room.

Lets see, there was also a small refrigerator in the room as well a coffee pot with instant coffee. There was also a large flat screen TV in the room which I watched mostly to fet a feel for local Vietnam programming. The room was fully air conditioned, a necessity for the hot months, but it took a while for the smaller unit to cool the room down. The AC and power shut down once the electronic room key is removed from the wall slot. Despite the minor inconvenience, the room did cool down sufficiently. On a positive note, the noisy A/C compressor was located outside, on the balcony, so the room was very quiet.

My stay in the Hue Serene Palace Hotel was terrific and made for one of the most memorable visits anywhere. The hotel staff deserves special recognition for their awesome guest service. I am already looking forward to the next visit to Hue.
h_title_comment: Fabulous Hotel and Terrific Staff Conveniently Located Downtown
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This amazing hotel tucked away off the main street is just what we wanted on our visit to Hue. From the moment of check in we were greatly warmly and looked after - the rooms were spacious and clean and had a great view of the city. The restaurant had brilliant food and the whole trip was hugely enjoyable. Thanks to Mary and her team - would recommend, and stay again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here. Huge room, really comfortable bed, great Aircon and a big strong shower. The staff were wonderful, so friendly and very helpful. We definitely recommend this hotel. Nice bars and restaurants near as well as their own.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We loved our stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel and would highly recommend this place if your looking for a spacious bedroom and delicious food (One of the best Restaurants in town). Everyone was very helpful and made us truly feeling home .we would definetly love to come back one day.
h_title_comment: Beautiful Hotel in the city Centre of Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Itâ€™s not the hotel, although the hotel is nice, itâ€™s the staff. I would give it 10 stars for the staff alone.
The hotel is lovely, clean, very comfortable & has everything you require. If you get a room on the 7th floor it has amazing views of the city & if your up early enough you can sit back & watch the hot air balloons.
The staff are amazing, they are super friendly, helpful & willing to go above & beyond to everyone. Juliane on reception is so, so lovely, as they all are & Iâ€™d love to mention everyone by name but too many to remember. I highly recommend if your in Hue to stay here, you will not be disappointed. Best hotel weâ€™ve stayed at in Vietnam ðŸ˜€
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had a present and relaxing stay at the Serene Palace. The staff are very helpful and friendly and took care of every detail to ensure our stay hassle free and enjoyable. The food were prepared with a lot of care and passion and as a result they are extremely delicious. We like to thank every single staff at the hotel for their great efforts to delight and surprise us!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff were very friendly; they provided a lot of information regarding tours and activities to do in Hue. The room was nice and clean. Food at the restaurant is quite good. The hotel is very well located, very close to the main attracttions in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We had a lovely time staying in this hotel. The staff were very generous and the room was great. A perfect spot to explore the beautiful city of Hue. They arranged a driver to take us to Hoi An and he was great. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Hue Serene Palace Hotel is well located â€“ close enough to walk to shops and restaurants, but far enough away to be quiet and calm. The rooms are quite large, comfortable, and well-appointed. The breakfast is fantastic and the staff at reception are particularly lovely. The drivers we booked through the front desk were a hit or miss. One was quite friendly and helpful (our driver to Hoi An) while the other was not (local driver). However, this place is fantastic. I would recommend (and return) easily.
h_title_comment: Marvelous rooms in a great location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. On the night of our arrival we were escorted to our room with a lovely view of the city. The room was quite hot, but we were told it would cool down in a bit. When we returned from dinner, the air conditioner in the room was not really working. It was late and the maintenance team was not available. The bellhop for the hotel came to the room and worked tirelessly to get it working and it did improve slightly. He also brought up a fan to help keep the room cooler that night. The next day the maintenance team fixed the unit and we could sleep the night without issue. So, while initially disappointed, the service at this hotel really did stand out. Considering there was little that was under their direct control, the staff all tried very hard to make up for the shortcomings of our initial night.

We also used the laundry service offered by the hotel, which was brilliant. I had stained a shirt the previous week and tried to remove the stain myself with no luck. I had no expectation that it would be removed by the hotel laundry service. Too my surprise the shirt came back spotless! I would also add that the breakfast that came with the room each day was marvelous. Lots of options. Plenty to eat. So, high marks for that.

When we checked out of the hotel, we had been given a discount for the trouble the air conditioner (or lack of) had caused. So, bonus points for that.

Other good points: Located close to everything - we walked to the Citadel but some may find this a bit too far. Nearby restaurants and bars provide many options as well.

In closing, my only reason for a 4 instead of a 5 is that I think the hotel does need an upgrade, at least in the air conditioning. It was quite an old unit. Even when it was fixed the room remained hotter than expected. Again, this is not something the staff can fix. That will require an owner to invest in some upgrades. So, I do recommend staying here, just be aware that the coolness of your room in the 37 degree heat may be a bit less than you expected. May want to check that out first.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room was huge and spotlessly clean. We received a welcome drink and fruit in our room. All of the staff from reception, hospitality in the restaurant and the bell boys were fantastic. Maya helped us with trips, train tickets and places to see. She was so helpful. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great place and its so close to restaurants and bars. Fantastic place. Thanks!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very quiet neighborhood yet close to many restaurants and activities. Excellent staff and great breakfast options. Plenty of hot water, strong water pressure and comfortable beds. I have no reservations in recommending and would stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Right from the start the staff were great. We arrived in Hue on the overnight train and decided to see if we could check in early and it was no problem at all with no extra charge. Any request we had for the staff was taken care of with no issues. The location was also close to a lot of restaurants. We booked a DMZ tour to the Vinh Moc tunnels through the hotel and our tour guide was fantastic. We also booked a transfer to Hoi An though the hotel and though the price was good our driver wasnâ€™t the best. He seemed annoyed the whole time and kept checking his phone on the drive. Overall the services are great at the Hue Serene Palace.
h_title_comment: One of our best stays in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
- Very comfortable and clean hotel.

- Amazing location, just 5 mins walk away from all the nightlife but far away enough that is truly is serene!

- Staff were exceptional, they were so attentive and friendly. Sally is a legend.

- Taxis and transfers very useful and easy to organise through the hotel.

- Breakfast was good and lunch menu is also excellent.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This place ticks all the boxes and the staff are exceptional and speak great english. The room was fantastic and absolutely great value for money. So helpful and attentive to our every need. Clean, spacious, food at breakfast was excellent choice and central to everything. They even prepared a birthday cake for my mother on arrival as a surprise. Compliementary fruit on arrival and in the room each day... what more can you ask for. Comfortable well appointed and spotlessly clean and comfortable beds... you don't need anything more in Hue. The bathroom in our room had a spa/bath/shower combination so if you have mobility problems then maybe a room with a normal shower. Loved our stay here. I was travelling with my 73 year reasonably fit mother and we couldn't have wished for more anywhere else. Our best stay in Vietnam.
h_title_comment: Loved it ...at the Hue Serene Palace from beginning to the end
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We arrived early on the train so our room was not ready. We went to their restaurant for breakfast and it was great. After breakfast we were shown maps etc. for things to do for the day (just 1 day unfortunately as we were here just 1 night). By the time we were loaded with information our room was ready. We were treated top notch by all the staff. A really fine hotel.
h_title_comment: Top Notch Hotel with Great Staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I don't get the high scores at all. Although the room was mostly quiet it was very outdated. The sheets and towels were dirty, the floor was constantly covered in dirt. The tub/shower was a hazard to get in and out of. The breakfast was just passable. The staff only cares about TripAdvisor reviews and selling travel packages, so not at all genuine. The location was down an alley which I guess helps with the noise but is an inconvenience. I can't believe there aren't more modern more conveniently located properties in this city.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Lovely hotel in a little side street. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff were amazing and couldnâ€™t have been more friendly and helpful. Not far from the attractions. Would definitely stay again if in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great place to stay in Hue! The staff was very friendly and helpful, we were presented with a welcome drink and fresh fruit and given recommendations and an overview of the city. The staff were very accommodating and always smiling, we arranged a private car through the hotel for the day to take us to the royal tombs - it was wonderful. The rooms are spacious and clean and the beds were very comfy. We also had a wonderful balcony overlooking the city. I highly recommend this hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Great staff at the reception , one of the girl speak perfect English, good breakfirat, very clean ..excellent service , so good value for the money..we can recomend this hotel at any time, excellent location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family
