h_content_comment: All the staff at Serene Palace were great! They were all very helpful & arranged quickly & easily airport transfers, tours etc. Well done!! They kindly decorated the room for us as our honeymoon-thank you all again!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had a great stay at the Serene Palace. Food was wonderful, rooms were comfortable and clean., we rented bikes for a ride in the country, they made arrangements for a driver to Danang. Excellent hotel, highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I had grat times in Serena Hotel, it's well located in HuÃ© and the staff is very hlpful forthe excursions and the lif in the hotel. Breakfast (with a menu) is a must ! I love the terrace in the room at the last floor. Room is very clean and spacious. I can say only good things about this hotel. Don't hesitate to book the excursions directly with the wbsite and by mail, you will have all the information. I can say a special thanks to our driver from the DMZ to Hoi An, he was very kind, patient and helpful !
h_title_comment: Great hotel with very helpful staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for two nights, and were quite pleased. Staff very friendly and professional, the room was decently large and comfortable. Hotel is located right next to the animated streets, and at the same time in a small street with close to no car traffic. You can rent scooters right across the street.

Breakfast good quality, and staff has a way to make you feel welcomes and special. We would have stayed there longer if we had the opportunity.

This is clearly a top pick during our journey
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was so nice. We couldnâ€™t have asked for a better place. It was very clean, the bed was so comfortable. The food was so tasty and you get 10% off your meals for staying in their hotel. The breakfast was included and you could even order off the menu for free. Very good breakfast BTW. We loved the location of the hotel too. It isnâ€™t on a noisy busy street. So quiet and quaint on a little lane. The staff are fantastic!! Everyone and I mean everyone was so accommodating opening doors when we were coming and going, arranging bikes being delivered to the hotel for our bike riding expedition, arranging for taxis and boats rides as well. They made everything so easy for us with their willingness to help in whatever capacity we needed. Definitely will stay here again. The price was great too. Very good value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was the best hotel we stayed in in Vietnam. We were greeted with fresh fruit and watermelon juice by staff who were unfailingly cheerful and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean and the bathroom was exceptional as it had a jacuzzi bath which was great after tramping round the sights all day.The breakfasts were great and the choices were both Vietnamese and Western. There was always a plentiful supply of lovely fresh fruit. Special mention must be made of the delightful 'Sally' who chatted away with us every morning. The entire staff though were fantastic with both the man and the woman on the front desk being super helpful and arranging our boat trip on the Perfumed River. We couldn't praise this hotel highly enough because besides being efficient, the staff were fun.
h_title_comment: This hotel was very comfortable and the staff were exceptional.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Excellent value for money! Down a little side road so minimal noise from the busy roads. Staff just couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast was really good, choosing from the menu for hot food (and they encouraged us to choose more than one dish!) and a buffet with juices, fruit, yogurt and pastries. We ate there one night as well, nice meal and really good value too. Overall: excellent value and brilliant staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is a awesome find. Great location, quite with friendly staff. They offer to help arrange tours but will give advice to help you go solo. The car to Hoi An was cheaper then what I could find outside also. Julia on the front desk was sooo helpful and the food for breakfast and the dinner we had in the restaurant was great. Sally in the restaurant always has a beautiful smile.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel is located in the middle of a narrow lane and it looks run down based on its exterior. I was rather shocked when I saw the hotel after our driver had some difficulties navigating into the small lane to reach the site.
However, do not be fooled by its exterior, the room is very clean and comfortable. I am very pleased with the services provided by the staff and the big room with parquet flooring.
The hotel serves good breakfast, not buffet style, but they only cook it after you made an order, served hot and fresh. The restaurant is voted one of the best in Hue!
The hotel is just a stone throw away from the walking street where you will find many restaurants and hawker food but you need to walk around half an hour to Hue Ancient City é¡ºåŒ–çš‡åŸŽ.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This hotel staff was most welcoming & helpful, and a GREAT value! The rooms were spacious, nicely appointed,and comfortable! While the hotel was centrally located, we opted to eat at the hotelâ€™s restaurant because the food was superbly delicious! In our short stay there, we quickly developed a friendship w/ the manager Sally... a great young lady! Canâ€™t say enough about the place!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I stayed at the Serene Palace during my recent tour of Vietnam, upon arrival after a tiring train journey from Hanoi I was immediately offered fresh fruit and coffee whilst waiting to check in.
My room was spotlessly clean with a huge comfortable bed and plenty of space.
The staff here especially Mary and Julia were very kind and helpful especially with booking flights etc for my later journeys to Hoi An and Phu Quoc.
I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to come back here when I return to Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Though it is a narrow side-street the location proved to be excellent. A very short walk to restaurants and bars. The service were excellent all from our very entrance to the hotel. We got a welcome drink and some fruits while we were told about the hotel and the surroundings. Al lstaff were always polite and smiling. A good breakfast. Nice and clean rooms.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Great hotel in good location. Staff friendly and helpful.
Restaurant food consistently good. We ended up having dinner there two of three nights. Crispy pancake yummy. Staff in restaurant excellent. Interested in what you were doing, gave us extra fruit for day trips. Offer a great set meal for two very reasonably priced.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This hotel was the best place I stayed at then entire time i was in Vietnam. The staff was friendly, helpful, and genuine. They greeted me from a long train ride to an early check in, a fruit plate, and some recommendations to do in the area. The room was larger than pictured, bathroom facilities were clean and full of warm water. Location was just off the main area (within 5 minutes), so quiet but close. Upscale accommodation for mid range budget. This was a perfect place to spend my time in Hue, especially after the overnight train.
h_title_comment: Serene from the moment I walked in!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The room was spacious, clean and comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful especially Kelly, Sally and Sandra. We stayed 2 nights and had dinner at their restaurant on both nights which was great! Definitely one of the better value for money hotels we have stayed at in our travels around South East Asia.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: As soon as I booked the hotel online, I received an email from the hotel offering assistance. This level of service continued when we checked in for our 3 night stay and were offered welcome drinks, fruit and assistance with planning of trips. They arranged a taxi from the airport for $15 and a driver for our day of departure to drive us to Hoi An, stopping at several sights along the way including LÄƒng Co Bay and Marble Mountain (for $60). Our room was clean and spacious (although somewhat lacking in drawer space) and the shower room large. We stayed in a junior room. Unfortunately the WiFi was not always reliable in our room but having a PC in our room was a bonus. The location of the hotel is good, within walking distance of most of Hueâ€™s attractions. Breakfast buffet was small but with enough choice and an extensive menu of freshly cooked options including Vietnamese, European and they do a lovely banana and chocolate crepe!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Super nice staff, helped with renting scooter and bikes. Spatious room with window. Every day free complimentary fruit on the room. Great breakfast with delicious friend dumplings an banana pancakes. Super.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel was in the heart of the action,very clean and an awesome breakfast.Best value for money hotel Iâ€™ve stayed at-will be back with my family sooner than later.
The girls at the front desk were very helpful and organised all our tours and taxis at very reasonable prices
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed two nights during our trip through Vietnam. The hotel is nice and we had a spacious room. The location is very central, however it is in a side street so a bit quieter. We let the hotel arrange our airport transfer and Julia was very helpful in advising with our tours, local sightseeing and recommended a beauty parlour for my Wife to get her nails done.

Overall it was great value and I highly recommend Serene Palace Hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here with our family In a quad room. The hotel is very clean. Itâ€™s an older hotel but the amenities are amazing! Itâ€™s 5 star service!! The breakfast is delicious, the staff are very helpful and the location is close to a walking street that is blocked off Fri-Sun evenings. Perfect for little people to run around and for adults to enjoy a dinner out.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: While the Serene hotel is not the fanciest hotel, the staff are more attentive to your needs than any we have experienced in Vietnam. From the men stationed at the door to welcome you in, to the receptionist greeting you with cold juice and fruit when you arrive, they are willing an able to lend a helpful hand. The room was satisfactory, with tv, AC, and fresh towels/water/fruit daily. The breakfast contained both local favorites as well as western staples. The waiters were very friendly and attentive and even packed us to-go food on our last day. The location is on a relatively quiet side street but close enough to walk to many major sites. Itâ€™s also nearby the great weekend night market a few streets over. The streets are blocked off to cars/scooters and has a very festive atmosphere. We felt very taken care of and would recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive but quality stay while in Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We LOVED the staff at Hue Serene Palace Hotel - they went above and beyond to give us all the advice and assistance we needed during our stay and were always so friendly and helpful whenever we saw them. Some of the best customer service Iâ€™ve ever had anywhere in the world! The hotel itself is lovely with simple but stylish rooms in a great location. Breakfast was lovely, especially the huge spread of delicious fruits. Highly recommended if youâ€™re visiting Hue, and do take the staff up on their recommendation to try Hanh restaurant. Easily our best meal in Vietnam!
h_title_comment: Amazing customer service and delicious fruit in a beautiful, centrally-located hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This is a classy place for a very reasonable rate. We booked for 4 nights and stayed for a 5th because we were so comfortable. The customer service here was fantasticâ€”they quickly responded to my last minute emails requesting an airport pick-up, they welcomed us to the hotel with refreshing watermelon juice and sat down to answer our questions, they set up tours and gave us good advice and directions for places in and around Hue. They even surprised me with a birthday cake! The breakfasts were wonderful and we had a really good dinner in the restaurant as well. All the reception folks speak English, which was very helpful for us. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. Highly recommended!
h_title_comment: We loved the Serene Palace Hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene Palace, surprisingly VERY nice hotel.i did not expect such great service and facilities ! they welcome me and my driver and guide with welcome drinks and fruits !!! All staff were extremely nice and polite and ready to do all to satisfy client. They were very warm all time. Big Room is very clean and with computer .funny towel composition on bed.everything is very new. fruits and water in room ,all bath facilities. Umbrella.Good choice on breakfast. good location.
h_title_comment: Surprisingly great hotel with perfect service !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Great value hotel with super clean rooms, comfortable firm beds and great space. The staff were extremely accommodating and helpful in recommending local attractions and best options to see the city in a short amount of time. Breakfast was included and fairly good. Options consisted of eggs, crepes, fruit, cold cuts and local staples.

Overall hotel was very good for travelers looking for a clean, affordable place to stay. Easily recommendable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Nice, clean hotel with good-size rooms. Attentive staff with decent knowledge of English. Acceptable breakfast for this level of accommodation. Located on a narrow street/alley so tour buses canâ€™t enter. You must therefore walk about 5 minutes to the main street. Appx. 10 minute walk to the action. Super cheap laundromat almost next door. Several restaurants right nearby.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our family of four enjoyed our stay here. We walked to main sights and hotel booked us a taxi to collect us from the railway station as well as a driver to take us to visit nearby tombs. Breakfast was good and the staff were all really helpful. Our room was large and comfortable. Overalll good value for money.
h_title_comment: Central location to walk to the main sights
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Well situated in the old quarter, it's welcoming, and although the staff are all young, they are very professional, and courteous. Food is plentiful, and we'll presented.
First hotel I have stayed that provides a desktop computer in each room, although the internet is unreliable. (The mouse did not work and they sent a replacement up within 5 minutes.)
Each room has a pair of bathroom scales. Who needs to be reminded that weight gain is part of a good holiday!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed three nights at Hue Serene Palace hotel and found it to be great value. We asked to be moved to a room with a shower and the reception staff were very obliging and moved us to a lovely room on the top floor. The view from the balcony was fantastic! They also offered a large variety of buffet and a la carte for breakfast.The hotel is in a great spot...close to restaurants and night life but not at all noisy. Make sure you visit The Secret Lounge next door too...a great bar for quiet drinks, music and relaxing!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had two nights here - our flight was delayed so driver did not wait which was slightly annoying. Room nice for the price -which actually was very good value. We thought the breakfast was slightly unimaginative. Shower leaked badly. Staff more than made up for all this though. Julia was very helpful organising trips and recommending a local restaurant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Nice clean hotel, very clean in fact. Location also was pretty good, close to walking street and only about 30 mins to Citidel if you wanted to walk like we did. Only had one night here but definitely wish I had more. Staff was extremely helpful in all aspects. Recommend this hotel if staying in Hue. Very good value for money. Great breakfast included.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Stayed with them for 2 nights. Location was fantastic, within the tourist belt yet away from the noise. The room was spacious and the staff was hospitable and warm. May not be easy to find without GPS but once you get it, it's a breeze after that. Would recommend the place to people who want to enjoy the night life in Hue but a good quiet sleep after that.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Quiet location but only minutes from the action. Staff canâ€™t do enough for you and are really friendly. Rooms nice with air con, a safe, and are clean. Would highly recommend if you want value and quiet.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel was fantastic, we were met by Alan who ensured we knew where everything in the town was and guided us as to prices so we wouldnâ€™t be ripped off. Our room was clean, tidy and well appointed. The hotel is situated about a 5 minute walk from the main thoroughfare in Hue.
Breakfast was basic but the quality was excellent.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This hotel is conveniently located and is a short walk to the bar/restaurant area as well as the market area. It is about a half hour walk to the imperial city and main market which are located on the opposite side of the river. The room was nicely appointed clean and modern. We had a computer on the work desk. Wifi was very good. Linen and bath towels were very nice. The restaurant was great. The only thing that is better than the food here is the service. The staff at the front desk and in the restaurant is exceptional. The dinner menu is outstanding as is the food. This was great value for our money. We would not hesitate to stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I have stayed in a few Serene hotels in Vietnam and am never disappointed. I stayed in Hue for a couple nights and would choose this hotel over and over again. The location is great and easy to walk or quick taxi ride to many great food places and tourist sites. The rooms are clean, modern and very comfortable and when comparing room rates with other higher priced hotels I think value for money is excellent. The hotel staff is what really makes the hotel worth it...friendly, helpful and professional.

Highly recommend!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Upon arrival to Hue, we were greeted by the lovely hotel staff, given a cold drink, and a detailed map of what to do. Regardless of the time, whenever we walked in and out of the lobby, we were always greeted with a smile. The front desk helped us book multiple tours and always asked how our day was. We had to check out very early and the staff even offered to pack up breakfast for us so we could eat it at the airport. Our room was large, spacious, and quiet. The hotel is a short walk to the Perfume River, the night market, as well as good restaurants and bars. Excellent hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very new and comfortable, easy walking to Perfume river, park and dragon boats. Nice breakfast and extremely friendly staff. Bed was comfortable. This hotel helped us have an enjoyable stay in Hue while we toured the Citadel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Arrived at this Hotel after a long bus ride from Vinh.
Wonderful greeting from Kelly on reception. She was and is a true professional front of house member of staff.
Checkin within seconds. Kelly personally took us to our room and made us very comfortable.
Breakfast was excellent and the staff so very friendly. They could not do enough for us and really made us feel at home.
Every time we left or entered the Hotel staff waved and smiled at us.
This is a super Hotel and one which I would love to comeback to.
Kelly and the complete Hotel team need to be congratulated on the professional way in which they conducted themselves.
h_title_comment: Superb Hotel of the highest standard
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Went here a couple of times and the food is wonderful and the staff are amazingly helpful professional and also very pleasant and lovely. Off the beaten track but really is worth looking out for really funky bar right next door it makes for a wonderful evening
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: A very nice hotel for the money. Friendly staff and excellent breakfast and food options. Greeted with a huge fruit salad when I arrived. There is an elevator. Located down a small quiet alley near the action.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Hotel has very helpful staff who place a lot of effort in service. Welcome drinks and fruit were a pleasant surprise and breakfast was a small but satisfying selection of Vietnamese and Western staples. Good orientation and assistance with tours as required. This hotel is on the opposite bank of the Perfume River and away from the citadel, but close enough to the waterfront for evening strolls / tourism and main tourist area (nb. it is located in a quieter alley behind main streets, but with other hotels and restaurants adjacent to it and easy to access on foot). Excellent value with location in close proximity to great places for food.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: If you are lucky enough to stay at this property, the thing you will appreciate the most is the outstanding food. You will be tempted by the restaurant every time you enter the lobby. The service is very friendly and the location is wonderful, but the cuisine is the star attraction.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We spent 4 nights at Hue Serene Palace Hotel, and it was a great choice. The location was right in the middle of where we wanted to walk around at night. They provided information and helped us book tours of Bach Ma National Park (do it), the DMZ (not needed, but if you have the time, sure - be aware it's a lot of time on the road), a boat trip to see the major sites, and also provided a car transport from Hoi An > Hue, and dropping us off at the airport. They totally took care of us, and the front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. They all knew who we were, and asked us how our latest excursion was. The food at the restaurant was pretty good too - breakfast included is always a nice treat. We had the standard room, and it was pretty nice - a big bed, the decor was welcoming. Great stay, would definitely reccommend!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Just finished a very enjoyable 3 night stay at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. Location is fantastic, very near all the local bars and restaurants and within walking distance of Citadel. Highest TripAdvisor rated restaurant in Hue is also located in the lobby of the hotel! Really nice food for both breakfast and dinner. Staff are fantastic to deal with, always very polite and courteous, always asking about your plans and giving local advice! Mia in the restaurant area was particularly nice and provided excellent service. Would recommend and would definitely come back.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Loved the hotel, staff and restaurant. Good location, nice clean room, would stay again if I was back in the Hue. Pleasantly surprised to see a computer in the room (never seen that before) and even though the keyboard was missing the '@' character (meaning I couldn't check my e mails) and there was no audio, it was still useful. Breakfast is good and included with the price, and they give you a bowl of fruit when you check in. Nice!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Stayed two nights and had arranged pick up from airport, which went smoothly. Hotel is situated on a very narrow street/alley off the main road but location is good as walkable to the river and centre. Given a nice room on the top floor with a balcony (shame it rained and we couldnâ€™t use it!) plenty of space to open suitcases, which can sometimes be an issue in smaller rooms. Would have preferred a walk-in shower rather than the jacuzzi bath but as it was only for two nights, coped ok. Didnâ€™t experience any noise issues. Good wi-fi.
Restaurant and its staff very good and we enjoyed some nice meals and breakfasts there. Offers on various things throughout the day (we enjoyed free tomato salad with lunch).
Organised a City Tour through them to the Citadel, boat trip etc, which was good.
Note: for those with mobility issues, there is a flight of steps leading up to the hotel.
Would recommend this hotel if staying in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Hue Serene Palace Hotel was every bit as good as it appeared online and better! The service, staff and facilities were all great and the room extremely comfortable and clean. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, and made sure everything was to my liking at all times - which was very sweet! As a solo traveller, they made me feel right at home and even gave me some extra food at breakfast some mornings to keep me going for the day which I thought was just lovely. The room was bigger than I thought it would be which is always a nice surprise and a bonus, and it was kept very clean throughout my entire stay. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the beds are very soft. The price of the hotel is excellent considering what is included - breakfast every morning was delicious. There is so much to choose from and a small buffet or fruit, cereals, pastries and bread which you can help yourself to throughout the morning. I can't fault my stay here in any way and I particularly have to thank the staff for that, they were so kind and thoughtful. Will definitely be coming back here next time!!
h_title_comment: Delightful stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Just left for the airport after staying three nights at Serene Palace Hotel! Best money weâ€™ve spent so far. As other reviews show, the staff is extremely hospitable and welcoming. They really look after you best they can and make sure your stay in boyh HuÃ© and the hotel is enjoyable and comfortable, which it truly was! Nice sized lobby with a little â€pondâ€ with fish in, sophisticated restaurant with AMAZING breakfast (lots to choose from) and the rooms were beautiful! Spacious and clean, even had a computer in it!

Iâ€™ve seen some reviews saying beds were hard and/or loud but this wasnâ€™t my experience at all. I found the bed to be perfectly soft, the pillow was awesome and the AirCon was hardly audible in QuietMode. Often the shower is somewhat questionable in terms of heat and power of the jets but not here! Spacious shower with glass walls/door, very efficient and comfortable jets! Had to fiddle slightly with getting the right temperature but we did eventually! I donâ€™t know how the rooms are different but we were in 405 and have no complaints! All and all very happy with our stay! Definitely 5/5 stars, recommend anyone to stay here! Have a great day!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Itâ€™s not often we are torn on a hotel review - but we are this time. Usually itâ€™s either very good or very bad or simply indifferent. This time we are torn because the staff of the Hue Serene Palace are by far the best thing about the hotel. In fact, they make up all the good things about the hotel. They are friendly, helpful, eager to please, professional and they make a good breakfast. However, a hotel stay is a summation of many things - not just efficient bell boys and friendly staff on the front desk (hello to Alan, Maya, Kelly and Julia). The price is good in comparison to Vietnamese hotel pricing generally. There is good bang for buck. The hotel is consistently spotless, the housekeeping staff are excellent. The cleanliness is aided by the hard surfaces, tiles etc, everywhere. BUT - and I hate for there to be a but as the staff really have tried to make our stay in Hue wonderful and kudos to them for that. BUT - The most important thing for us in a hotel is the quality of sleep - defined by the comfort of the beds and the soundproofing of the property. The linens on the bed were fine - clean, white cotton, nice weight of quilt/duvet/doona - cosy with the Air Con on. However the bed bases are just hollow plywood boxes placed directly on the hard surface floor. Every move makes a loud noise. Every roll, every turn and we can only imagine how that noise transmits to the floors below. The mattresses are also hard. Not firm, not comfortable, not â€˜could be betterâ€™ - they are hard. So hard, the hotel has already added 2 mattress toppers to them and a mattress protector on top of that. Still hard, even with all the glitter. Also, itâ€™s a sad fact of life that mildew is a fact of life in Asia - but the bed in 501, closest to the door, also has a strong mildew whiff to it (but itâ€™s sitting on a wooden box, so canâ€™t ventilate so understandable). We came to this hotel because reviews said the beds were comfortable - but going forward we will discount any reviewers from anywhere in Asia as the concept is somewhat different to western travellers. Right - so thatâ€™s the first half of sleep quality - not good, in fact terrible. The second half of sleep quality is soundproofing. There isnâ€™t any. The room we were in initially had someone either repeatedly vomiting or hoicking and coughing in a death-defying manner in the room above. Our first room also had a mildewy/fausty smell which didnâ€™t clear even with the Air Con used and the very small window opened (note.... avoid the standard rooms. Often called â€˜Superiorâ€™ on the booking sites... whatever the base level room is... just donâ€™t - in particular Room 503). Right - the hoicking/vomiting/coughing...above us, repeatedly. In graphic detail. The walk to the loo - the clomping back, the scraping of furniture, the return trip, the flushing... first evening 3 times? and first morning - all over again. The hotel very kindly shifted us to another room - which was a significant upgrade and we are of course very grateful for that. It doesnâ€™t solve the major soundproofing issues in a building seemingly not built for purpose. Water can be heard running/flushing/draining most of the time. Someone in the room above us on our final night of 4 nights decided to either jump up and down on the bed - or do exercise - possibly skipping - for an hour or so in the evening and again the next morning. Like bass music, without the music. The man next door has a bad cough, the housekeeping are doing their thing, the doors slam by default and the electronic locks are dicky - thatâ€™s a tech term for beeping repeatedly and annoyingly, but only sometimes, when you open the door and hold it open for a minute or so - like when a couple are leaving a room gradually. Itâ€™s a function of the standard of guest staying here, but also of the hotel build that people allow their children to run around the common areas and play in the stairwell and squeal - and there is a very large internal stairwell so the sound travels, very well - especially when they play the running up and down and sqealing game. Thereâ€™s little to be done about all the noise and the staff seem to work so hard and be friendly to make up for the hotelâ€™s shortcomings.

Finally - can anything be done? Carpet isnâ€™t practical, but perhaps under the box base beds a thick felt mat could absorb the noise. The mattresses are probably fine for Asian guests who seem to have a cultural preference for very firm/hard. But the ones that are already mildewed or are seriously worn out with the dreaded â€˜hole in the middleâ€™ hollow feeling from extensive commercial use need to replaced and it should be done with soft mattresses - available to guests with a preference for soft/padded/comfortable. The use of regular ensemble bases found in most hotels with felt pads on the feet could be adopted along with the new mattresses. As to the rest of the soundproofing issues - a technical check of the doors for low battery levels could at least minimise the pesky beeping - on average 3 times a day/any time of the day or night (that was other people on our floor) - and thankfully only once our door decided to do it.

How to cope? As with any challenges - a sleep mask, ear plugs, a sleeping pill and, ideally a strong gin and tonic. Fine every night. But highly impractical during the day when you might want to spend some quiet time in your room after a big day out exploring all Hue has to offer. So if you like a good price, a hard mattress and sleep like the dead - crack on, this is the hotel for you. If you feel like the walking dead after multiple nights of bad sleep, this hotel might not be for you. We reiterate the staff are doing everything they can - 1000% but it was like flying long haul for 4 days strapped into the middle seat of the middle row, next to the toilets. Albeit with business class food and service and wonderful staff. A real hard product / soft product dilemma. If it werenâ€™t for the staff we would have only given 1 or at most 2 Tripadvisor bubbles - because when it comes down to it, for us, a hotel is there for sleeping - itdoesn't matter how pretty the room is, how nice the picture on the wall is or how sweet the staff are... No sleep? No happy.
h_title_comment: Three or four stars that is the question
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Our stay at the hotel were very pleasant with really good service, attentative, friendly and helpfull staff and a beautiful room.

All in all a great stay with usefull information and helpfullness to both see the city of Hue and to get to our next destination in Hoi An.
h_title_comment: Very nice stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Everything about this hotel is top class except the price tag. All staff were so warm,friendly and helpful. We had a problem with our visa and they did everything they could to help us. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable with all the amenities you could ever need, including a computer. Complimentary fruit and water in our room every day and very good breakfast with lots of choice, loved the local options but also Western items. Location is perfect, bars,restaurants e.t.c.but with the added advantage of being down a quiet street so very peaceful. The price we paid was unbelievable for the standard of service, comfort and facilities. We ate in the restaurant which is as good as anywhere in Hue. Definitely recommend, don't think of staying anywhere else, 5 stars from me.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here 2 nights perfect little hotel lovely staff breakfast clean rooms ate in the restaurant which was one of the nicest meals we had in Vietnam if you stay here you wonâ€™t be disappointed nothing to complain about
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Room large, food delicious and generous portions (including breakfast), everything and everywhere is clean.
The restaurant is inside the hotel and ready to serve food any time with a discount for the hotel guests. Free fresh fruit in the room everyday. Staff is kind, well trained and helpful. They organised the next leg of our trip to Hoi An.
When I accidentally left my shirt in the hotel room, they arranged the onward delivery to Hoi An.
h_title_comment: Excellent customer service and value for money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at Hur Serene Palace hotel for four nights and had a great experience. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well priced. The free breakfast eas great also.
But what really stood out was the great service.
Would highly reccomend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Spend there three nights and we found there the most friendly staff in Vietnam. Location was perfect and also the hotel and the room was very clean and bed was comfortable. Highly recommended, very good value of money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed for two nights. Comfortable bed, nice extras like bathrobe. Good breakfast. Staff was helpful. Provided big umbrella which was very useful for our visit to the citadel (heavy rain for a while). Highly recommended hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Great hotel, friendly helpfull staff.
We enjoyed every minute of our stay.
Preâ€™s: hotel is located across Motorvina and close to the citycentre, beautifull room, great staff, good (simple) breakfast. We are on our honeymoon and the staff made it very special for us.
Without a doubt a great hotel and we would definately recommend it!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Hue Serene Palace was a great place to stay. Location was perfect, just out of the craziness enough, but close to walk to anything out there. The staff was very helpful, between rides to/from the airport, to setting up a boat on the Perfume River, to where to eat (a few good vegetarian restaurants nearby) and where to go in town. I would definitely stay here again. I had a third floor room, with a really great view of the city. Hopefully some day I can make it back to Hue!
h_title_comment: Great location, great staff, nice place
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: the hotel choosen by travel agency was a very good choice , very friendly staff , efficient and always smiling , I recommend this hotel which is located in a very good place, close to bars , restaurants and much more
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is a great hotel in the perfect location. Walking distance to the main streets, tons of cool bars and restaurants! The room was very large, with a balcony view of the little street. Breakfast included and was very good. We headed to Hoi An from Hue and the hotel organized a private driver for us which was amazing!! He picked us up at 9am and drove us to the imperial city and waited as we toured for about 1.5 hours. We then drove to Hoi An, while making stops at Lap An Lagoon, Lang Co Beach and Marble mountain, all beautiful stops and we would have never seen any of that if we were on our own! Thank you!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed four nights at Serene Palace in Hue. It was a very comfortable (large) room with a balcony, in a quiet street. Only a few minutes walk to the Main Street ... but we only went there once for dinner and drinks. There were lots of great options close to the hotel. The highlight was the Secret Lounge Bar; when the lag line is â€œleave sh*t out thereâ€ you know youâ€™re in the right place! Maybe a bit more expensive than other bars but we really felt like locals. The Serene Palace staff were super helpful with booking tours (definitely do the DMZ through them) and organizing transfers. The included breakfast was great too. Oh, and if you meet Alan at reception, tell him Melissa and Alan from Perth say hi! :)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Every time I come back to Hue, this is where I stay. I'm never disappointed! The staff are amazing. The rooms are very comfortable and a very nice size. The breakfast has several options--both Vietnamese and western choices. The location is walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. The hotel concierge can set up any kind of tour you desire. I highly recommend this hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Perfect stay. Staff were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. Great breakfast included. I had read the rooms were basic but our city view room was really nice, with a lovely view over Hue. Definitely recommended and great value!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We booked an excursion to Hoi An and Hue with Vietnam Original Travel and this local agent chose Chic Hoi An hotel in Hoi An and Hue Serene Palace that were the best hotels during our stay in Vietnam : comfortable, warm, clean... The staff is very professional, friendly, helpful and always smiles. These hotels are well located so it is easy for us to walk around. We highly recommend these two hotels.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I was extremely impressed with the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. So many positive things to say about this hotel:
-Staff were super friendly and helpful.
-Good convenient location.
-I really appreciated the super price for laundry. $2 for 1 kg. I was also able to get my shoes washed and dried for $2 and they so desperately needed it after much rain!
-Staff arranged tours and transportation with ease. They arranged a bus for my transfer to Phong Nga after check out which was very much appreciated. The bus at 0645 is the one to take!
- Great breakfast.
- My room was nice and quiet.
- Computer in room
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We were happy with our stay and found the front desk very helpful. The food at lunch was excellent. Bathroom, room and shower nice and big. Negatives : Noisy hallways! front desk booked us on a terrible dirty bus to Phong Nha.
h_title_comment: Very nice staff and good restaurant
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed for 4 nights, staff was so welcoming and helpful. Room was spacious and clean with a great view from our 7th floor balcony. Breakfast each morning was great too. Very quiet location but close to everything.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
A great centrally located hotel with amazingly attentive staff. They helped us book train tickets, book tours and always greeted us with a smile!
It's tucked away in an alley but it adds to its charm. This was probably the nicest hotel we stayed in Vietnam that was incredibly affordable!
We are definitely going to stay here again! Thank you!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My wife and I spent a week here inDec. and both agreed that it was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. The room was large, clean and comfortable and the breakfast satisfying. But what sets this hotel apart from others are the staff. They are so pleasant and helpful beyond mere duty, the brightest is a young lady named Nien whoâ€™s infectious cheerfulness set us up for each and every day. Thank you all for a perfect visit.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We loved our stay at the Hue Serene - the location is central and convenient, the food delicious (we especially enjoyed the complimentary breakfast), and more importantly, the staff was so warm and friendly. Thank you to Mary, Thao and the rest of the staff at Hue Serene for taking care of us. We hope to come back again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Perfect staff, they help us if you need. Perfect English for communicate so it was practice. Excellent and beautiful room, calm and quiet, very good breakfast and diner. Good location. So I recommend for a romantic trip ++++ !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed there 2 nights. WiFi was working fine, breakfast was good and lots of choices, my room on the top floor had a balcony overlooking the city. Location also fine, staff had good recommendations for eating!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Stayed at this hotel for four nights and had a great stay. Friendly staff, excellent location, wifi worked great and the room was very spacious. They greeted me with juice and fruits. You can easily walk to the citadel from there.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Great location. Amazing staff. Amazing restaurant! You get to order fresh warm food from the breakfast menu, which is complimentary for all guests. That was much nicer than the standard precooked breakfast buffet at other places I stayed at.

Staff were super attentive and helpful. They prepared a breakfast box for us when we had to check out super early and just super nice in general.

The rooms were very clean and spacious and the wifi worked smoothly.

Would definitely stay here again.
h_title_comment: Best all rounder hotel I've been to
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I would recommend you to book your stay at this hotel without thinking twice. When I first passed the threshold I was welcomed heartedly by the hotel staff with a huge smile on their lips and was offered some fruits while they were processing my check in.

The hotel reception staff is very professional and extremely kind and is always smiling and will help you with whatever request you may have. I was sick during my stay and they called a doctor for me, they arranged a bus transfer to Da Nang even though I had called them quite late at night.

The hotel has its own restaurant and the employees are just amazing. They will go out of their way to make your stay as unforgettable as possible. They are also smiling all the time; they are very considerate and extremely kind indeed.

All the waitresses were outstanding, and one of them stood out even more. Her name is Selena, she seriously has a golden heart, and I can say that the restaurant is very lucky to have her, she is a gem.

One of the more kind-hearted person I have met so far during this trip. She made me feel just like home and even more. I thank you ever so much for it, youâ€™re the best :).

Now, regarding the hotel facilities; the hotel is very clean and the rooms are spacious, neat and nicely decorated, the mattress is very comfortable and so are the pillows.
The food at the restaurant is good and will certainly fill you up. The hotel also has its own spa in the Serene Shining Hotel which is a few blocks from here, there services is excellent.

I had a 45-minute massage and felt like new again. They are very professional and very kind too.

To make a long story short, you will not be disappointed.
h_title_comment: A home far from home - excellent !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Stayed here for 2-nights. Restaurant on the first floor is great (ranks among the top on TA), the burger is really worth trying after too many days of viet food. Was so pleasantly surprised by a free but tasty tomato salad served up during their happy hour. Breakfast also good - enjoyed the bun bo hue both times I had breakfast.

Room was clean and cosy, I particularly appreciated the PC provided in the room for light online surfing. Well-situated and easy to explore the town on foot from here.

Tour desk is also helpful - I booked a Hue city tour through them as well as a minibus to Danang upon checkout.
h_title_comment: Perfect respite from the heat, great food too!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed here for two nights on a tour of Vietnam. The staff were so friendly from arrival to check out - very clean and good rooms. Reasonable price and a centrally located hotel - around 25 mins walk to Imperial City and only a few mins from walking street. Check out their restaurant too - one of the best in the town.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is just amazing. Itâ€™s everything you could ask for: spacious, clean and most importantly just exceptional service (thanks Maya for your great check-in and recommendations!). Every single employee makes you feel like home. I would always stay here again!
h_title_comment: The best hotel I experienced in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Serene Palace Hue

We gave this full marks three years ago and loved it so we came back in November 2018 for four nights. A lovely hotel with exceptional staff. Guests are made to feel like one of the family. A big thank you to Maya who made us feel so welcome and made us laugh and to Sally for being Sally, you are lovely.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was by far the best service we received our entire trip. The staff was more than excellent and our room was absolutely beautiful with a great view of the city. The Hotel is located close to good restraunts and tourists sites, but provides just the right amount of privacy away from all the noisiness of the city. We highly recommend staying here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I've stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and had a great experience.

Rooms and facilities were spotless, staff was very gentle and helpful in helping you organize your stay (city tours, transports bookings...)

Excellent buffet breakfast aswell with a variety of delicious fresh fruits among other things
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Upmarket hotel at budget prices. Spacious, clean and modern rooms, professional and knowledgable staff and perfect location tucked away in a side lane. Walking distance to all major attractions, shops, restaurants and the walking streets night markets without being exposed to noise or traffic. Tour desk linked us with real veterans to guide us on a tour of the DMZ and beyond. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Best hotel during my 5 weeks in Vietnam. Great Restaurant with low price local food and free breakfast feauturing a la carde and Buffet! Location ist close to City Center and river. Rooms were so clean i couldnt even believe my eyes :)

recommended heavily!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
- Free drink and fruit on arrival! Great welcome
- Super helpful front desk. Very friendly
- Room was clean, bed comfy, nice ensuite.
- Fantastic breakfast, super tasty and great way to start the day
- Good location! Down a bit of a random road but actually 20min walk to Citadel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Totally different city to Hanoi, legacy of the war, being close to DMZ. Street touts and motorbike drivers/taxis are very aggressive and you get offered any vice you like. Glitzy and loud bars proliferate. A trip to the Bai Tan Thuan An beach was a highlight and the people out along the Perfume River riverside in the evening and the food at the night market was some of the best things I've ever eaten - try the fried shrimp balls for explosion of moisture and flavour!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The staff is full of helpful tips and will go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. A great value with comfortable bed, good bathroom, great WiFi and excellent breakfast. Walk to the citadel is approximately 15 minutes, and the main market and restaurant area is less than 10 minutes away.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Just to say all the excellent opinions here are true!! You get such a lot for a very cheap price. Best breakfast I had in Vietnam, fruits and juice to welcome you while one of the receptionist shortly explain the city for you (map included). A big thanks to Maria!! So professional and willness.
They also organised for us a driver to visit the tombs and the transport to Hoi An, many options given!
Very nice room with terrace. Located in the new area, in a small, calm street. 30 minutes walking from the old area, nice walk along the river.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Best place we stayed at during our Vietnam trip. Really cheap for what you get. The breakfast is really good, the staff are really nice and the room service was as cheap as going out for a meal in a restaurant and the food was great (200.000 dong for two starters and two main dishes!). Walkable distance (30 minutes) to the imperial city.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Such a great hotel. Staff were really friend. Well located. Everything is super clean and the rooms are gorgeous. Staff is able to help you out with all touristique questions. They provide you with maps. Great hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Clean, comfortable with great service. Hotel was in a great location. We enjoyed getting out and exploring Hue and surrounds. Staff were very friendly and food in the restaurant, especially the pomelo salad, was great. We only stayed one night, but should have stayed longer. When we left, they arranged a car with driver and guide at a great price to Hoi An. We left our passports at the hotel in our room safe. We called and they delivered our passports to our hotel in Hoi An the next day with no charge (3 hour drive), and scanned our passports and emailed them so we could check into our next hotel. For the price, it is an excellent hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Lovely hotel. Only stayed a couple of hours owing to flight cancellation but experience of the hotel was great. I emailed the hotel in advance for airport pick up and a private city tour which they organised for a good price- around 100 dollars. Very good communication.

We were picked up promptly by the driver. Had a fantastic breakfast which was table service for freshly cooked dishes.

Very comfortable rooms- amazing beds with rose petals (a nice touch).

The driver then took us on a private city tour to the palace and tombs followed by dropping us off at our next hotel in Hoi An (about a 3hr drive). Really need a couple of hours at the palace but we were short on time. The driver was very accommodating- gave us water and stopped at places along the way. Lovely guy to talk to and gave us some info in broken English along the way.

Great experience and welcoming staff. I would stay again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Calming and friendly hotel with a small koi pond facing the elevator. Staff were helpful and friendly. This was an oasis of tranquility amid the hustle of a very busy city. This was central to everywhere for seeing sights without being at the hub of either party central or tourist crowds yet everything was a walk away
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We only stayed here for one night but what a welcome! It was by pure chance that we dropped our motorbike off at motorvina 5 steps across the road and this hotel was opposite!! They greeted us with open arms friendly smiles and all the information you could ask for! A welcome tray of fruits and drinks were served to us as our booking was being processed. The rooms were magnificent for the price. Super super clean and very large too! As our stay in hue was only short we would have extended and stayed longer in the serene palace. As we were checking out the staff were incredible with their thorough knowledge of explaining everything in depth to us. They even booked our onward journey transportation for us and got us the best price for this. As we were travelling on the day of checking out, they stored our back packs and upon returning they let us have a shower to freshen up for our onward journey. We only stayed one night but the staff were so so so helpful!! This place is central but super quiet at night. Walking distance to a lot of places and a must stay for travellers! Many thanks serene palace!! 10/10!! Richard and Elsa
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here as part of a tour. A lovely hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. We had an extra bed in our room so were able to spread out which was good. Breakfast was good.Free bottle of water was great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The staff go above and beyond to be helpful. We had our backpack stole near Nhar Tran and were delayed a day. When I ran the hotel, they advised it wasnâ€™t a problem to change our check in day. I wasnâ€™t expecting this and was very grateful for this kind gesture.

Didnâ€™t realise that the hotel is associated with Shining Spa (which was amazing!) and only a 2min walk away. Location is great as it is situated near the walking street and only 10min taxi to the Citadel.

For the price, itâ€™s definitely worth it! Would not hesitate to stay here again.
h_title_comment: Awesome service and great value for money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great hotel. The staff are so nice and genuine. Greeted with a welcome drink and fruit plate. They picked us up from the train station and let us check in early after we had arrived on the overnight train from Hanoi. Staff very welcoming, especially Julia :) Great tips on how to get around, but no pressure to book through them. Booked our transport to hoi an through them which was great! Very clean rooms, comfortable beds, fast wifi and one of the best breakfasts we have had in South East Asia. Would definitely recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The staff went out of their way to find me a room when I decided to stay an extra day. The staff were always and friendly and helpful and the food delicious. The staff all took the time to talk to you and make you feel welcome. The tours they organised for me were top notch and a highlight of my trip in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: My boyfriend and I had heard that all the hotels in Vietnam are rated 5 stars on trip advisor and some are pressured to writing a 5 star review so we were dubious when looking up the serene palace hotel and itâ€™s 5 star reviews however I can honestly say this hotel deserves them all! My boyfriend and I loved our stay at serene palace hotel! Everything from the location, rooms, the breakfast & the staff were amazing! For the price this is the best value hotel weâ€™ve stayed at in south east Asia! The breakfast was a highlight and the staff were great and organised an affordable and excellent private transfer to Hoi An. I would highly recommend staying here and wouldnâ€™t hesitate to return if I come back to Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We arrived to the hotel earlier than the normal check in time, but the most welcoming staff already had the room ready for us.

The room was clean, spacious and with good comfortable bed. Bathroom and shower were also really clean. Overall I have no complaints about the room.

The staff in the hotel and hotel restaurant are awesome. Everyone greets you with big smile, and their English is also great. They gave us tips on the city and also helped us to arrange transportation to the next destination.

Thanks everyone at Hue Serene Hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
- A comfortable room and bathroom though the hotel is located in a narrow street ( our car driver said he cannot enter the street due to some problem of steep entry at the street entrance ) and we have to carry our suitcase and walk a distance in the heavy drizzle both during and after the check in.
- Staff were very good and ready to help.
- The Breakfast was also nice though the dining room was a bit small.
- Location was quite near to main city and we could walk around the near by streets.
- A balcony was also there but the view was not great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: When we arrived we get to go early to our room, which was very nice after the night train. Breakfast is also very good. Alltough the hotel recommended to take a private car and guide for the DMZ tour, we took the group one and couldn't recommend it more because it was really good and the guide was also quit good! Price for private transport to Hoi An was very competitive with good speaking English driver who knew a lot about the country and region.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We rarely give five stars but the Serene Palace earns them easily. We much enjoyed our three night stay and really don't have much more to say. A spacious and exceptionally clean room; everything worked well - hot water, WiFi; good breakfast, real fruit juices; the usual borderline smothering solicitude from the smiley Reception staff.

Perhaps the best feature is the location. You need to be close, but maybe not too close, to the buzzing bar and restaurant district centred on the junction of Vo Thi Sau and Chu Van An which is pedestrianised at the weekends. This area is packed through the evening with tourists and locals of all ages (a sort of dressed-up Vietnamese passeggiata). Unmissable. Halloween made this even more fun for us, which seems to be quite a thing here, however culturally incongruous. But the number of live bands and street acts will make you glad you are sleeping a block or two away.

A geriatric PC in the room, presumably for browsing and email, was an unusual touch and provided a nice trip down memory lane.

The Citadel is a pleasant half-hour walk away along the river past the dragon boat wharf.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The amazing staff could speak very well english. Special shout out to Mary and her colleagues :)
Great breakfast and dinner!
Everyday room service.
Cheap motorbike rental from the hotel and taxi service.
Good recommendation about the sightseeing in Hue.

Always nice smalltalk when passing the lobby or eating in the restaurant. You feel that the staff is really interested in your plans and experiences and wants to help you wherever possible.

We were lucky and had an upgrade to a suite in the top floor and the super friendly staff helped us with the booking. We accidently booked the other serene hotel in hue and they achieved the gratis cancellation of that booking for us!

Summarized above expectations and a nice memory for us. Highly recommed the place!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our stay in Hue was short, two nights and one full day. We had been traveling for 8 days and appreciated a serene experience. The staff arranged for our laundry to be washed and we loved the convenience of eating dinner in our room after a very long day of siteseeing. The food (both dinner and breakfast) is delicious. We are grateful for the care and attentiveness we received.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We landed at this hotel because of a friendâ€™s recommendation. It was beyond great! Usually we prefer to stay in smaller guesthouses or Airbnbâ€™s but decides to give it a try. From the moment we got there, we were greeted by lovely Maya. She helped us get settled which was so appreciated after a long day of travel. But what was the most special was the surprise decorating our room and bringing up a birthday cake to celebrate my husbandâ€™s birthday. Mind you, this is a hotel with many rooms, not a few like a small guest house or Airbnb, so I wasnâ€™t expecting this kind of service. It was due to Maya coordinating it all with her staff support!!! As for hotel-location great, bed very comfortable, premises clean, strong and hot shower, great breakfast-all thing we appreciate in good lodging! Thank you!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
See the title.
Great and affordable rooms, wonderful staff.

We booked a private driver through the hotel. Our driver, Mr. Minh, did a great job! He was english speaking, very kind and knowledgable and it was a joy travelling with him. Ask for him!

Breakfast is very nice too.
h_title_comment: One of the best Hotels in our three week Journey through Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Canâ€™t say enough good things about this hotel. First and foremost, the staff were incredibly helpful and polite. The room was exceptionally clean, spacious and well-appointed. Location is central and very close to all the eating areas and bars, yet tucked away on a quiet street. Plenty of choices for breakfast and it was free. Last but not least, great value for the money. Absolutely no hesitation in choosing this hotel again if we ever came back this way.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Near by Nguyen Cong Tru street that still underconstruction and dusty. The hotel is clean and the service were great with welcome drink and fruit. Everything you need in a 4 star hotel is there. Only thing was someone smoked and it flew to my room through corridor. Other than that it was a good trip.
h_title_comment: Budget hotel with full amenities setup
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Just stayed here. Such a great experience. The location is in a quiet side street, safe and full of character, it felt like you were staying in "real Hue", and the room was clean, cool and spacious. The hotel is close to the Fragrant River, the main drag, and most of the restaurants and bars. Most things are an easy walk. The staff were really amazing. When I got there i discovered that my travel agent had made the booking on the wrong date. The staff organised a room for me without fuss, and helped me to sort it out. They really were amazing, I cant thank them enough. i would definitely stay here again, I am told that there is a sister hotel of the same name in Hanoi.
h_title_comment: Such a great hotel near the river and lots of restaurants
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
From the moment we walked in we were made to feel very welcome. Everyone was really helpful and helped us with places to see, how to get around and even arranged us a great driver the next day for seeing the hai van pass. We stayed on the 7th floor and the view was amazing.

The food was good too.

Itâ€™s in a fantastic location. Near everything but down a quiet street away from the noise and lights so you can still get a good night sleep.

All in all, would highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We are very sad.... because we only had one night here and I wish we could go back! We were so very impressed with the room (imaculate), the staff (so friendly, helpful and welcoming) and the proximity (5 minute taxi or 20 mins walk to Citadel) 2 mins from bars, restaurants and clubs. Our favourite hotel in all of Vietnam so far and there's been a lot of competition. Thank you so much for our stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hue Serene Palace hotel. The accommodations were very nice, the breakfast was quite expansive and fresh, and the staff was wonderful. They helped organize several items for me and were very pleasant to work with. I have traveled widely and generally on a modest budget. This hotel offers excellent value for travelers like me. I especially want to thank Maya. She is an excellent ambassador for her hotel!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Before going to Serene Palace earlier this year I've never really had feelings about the concept of service in the context of hotels. I couldn't really tell hotels apart on the parameter and I didn't know what service should mean. I thought of hotels as short term apartment rentals and all I expected was a key to a nice room. Other than that, I would expect to be on my own. But Serene Palace helped me to understand and appreciate hospitality.

During my 3 week trip with my family, we stayed at 6 different hotels ranging from 3 star to 5 star. Serene Palace was the cheapest, but through my 3 day stay they established themselves as the service reference that other hotels must be compared against.

When we arrived by taxi, the staff immediately rushed down to pick up our luggage. They led us into the lobby, where they immediately started to do the check-in work. No waiting. They didn't make us stand up in front of the desk, but instead encouraged us to sit at a couch setup next to the reception area where another staff member immediately served us fresh fruit.

After a quick check-in, we went to our rooms. They were clean and large rooms. Fairly standard. An unusual amenity was the presence of a (dated) internet-connected PC in the room allowing for web browsing. Helpful if you haven't brought along your own iPad or laptop. The WiFi was stable and reliable. My only complaint with the room would be the acoustics. Sound ripples through the construction, so if your neighbors are noisy, you are more likely to know than in other hotels. However, considering the cost and the other pros, I feel this is forgivable.

We've all experienced workers who sends you a negative vibe. Makes you feel unwanted and feel like they are put in their job against their will. If you consider a spectrum of staff commitment with the left side meaning total indifference and the right side being obsessive staff, this hotel is leaning towards the right side, but not to the point where it becomes creepy and/or annoying. They are attentive, but respectful.

One evening we were eating in the restaurant and my aunt didn't finish her plate. There was nothing wrong with her food, but she wasn't feeling well. The waiter noticed this and politely asked. The waiter offered her complimentary ginger tea and when we got the bill, the waiter removed the charge for my aunts food (we did not ask for a discount - she just decided to give it). That tea was just what she needed. In the morning, the staff recognised my aunt, asked if she slept well and again brought her ginger tea together with her breakfast. This gesture made us feel like our visit was (very) appreciated.

Several times during our stay, Allan in the reception would greet us on the way out or into the hotel and ask if we would like ideas on what to see or where to eat. He would listen to our concerns and ideas and provide meaningful suggestions on where to go. I know that the hotel may get commission for their recommendations, but I have no problem with that when their recommendations are great. And that was the case here. When we needed taxis, the reception would get one right away. Whenever we returned from the city to the hotel, the reception would come running to greet us and open the door.

At one point, one of us forgot the pin code for the safe. We called the reception and within minutes they were there with a master key to reset the safe. No charge for that, even though it was our own fault.

During our stay, we asked Allan in the reception about transport to Hoi An and he listened to our requirements, quickly and clearly presented us with different options and weighed in with pros and cons. Ultimately, he arranged and confirmed for us to rent a big private minibus (15 seats) for a day with stops at different landmarks/tourist attractions during the trip. And this was with 2 days notice. I think we paid around 120 USD for the service, which he put on the hotel bill. IMHO, it was a comfortable and affordable transfer to Hoi An.

In summary, the staff is great and they will help you out whenever you need it - even when you don't know that you need it.

If I go back to Hue, I would be very likely to stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We only stayed here one night but wished we had more time. This is a stunningly beautiful hotel with well appointed rooms and the biggest king size bed we've ever seen. It must have been 10 feet wide! There are lovely stores in this hotel and a great buffet breakfast.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Our stay in the Serene Palace Hotel was really good and relaxing. The staff went above and beyond and did make our stay very enjoyable. The service and the breakfast were great! Our room was nice and clean. There was nothing negative except the fact that we had to pay 2% more because we wanted to pay with credit card. Itâ€™s not much and not a big problem, but it would have been nice if we would have known that beforehand.
But that didnâ€™t affect our stay in hue. Thank you again for the nice welcome and making our stay enjoyable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Had a lovely welcome with very friendly and helpfull staff. We got an upgrade to a 4-person room and loved the large space, clean room and perfect facilities. Located in a quiet alley minutes distance from the center.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Three star hotel with five star service!! The staff at Serene Palace were all warm, professional and welcoming! Julia was my go-to person, and during my one night stay, she answered questions, reserved a motorbike ride (which was awesome!) and escorted me to my room. The room itself was a generous size and extremely clean. The location of the hotel was great!! Plenty of restaurants and shopping options available. Safe area and very reasonable rates. Breakfast included.
My only issue is, the hotel description on Tripadvisor says that it's a "brand new" hotel. The hotel lobby and bathroom in the rooms didn't convey that feeling, they seemed a bit older.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Staff very polty and helpful.

Althouugh it is no clear acces, in the end the location is not a problem an you acces easilty to the tourist area.

it is in front to moto rental very useful for Hue visit, so it is like to have a parkig at the hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Big and clean room. The breakfast was very good (small buffet + menÃº with eggs, noodles, pancakes...). Convenient location.
The staff offered us tours in Hue and transportation to Hoi An by car, we didnt contract them, we visites the City walking and we went to Hoi An by motorbike
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff at this hotel are amazing! They arranged airport pickup, late checkin, two days of touring, recommendations, and overall fantastic, friendly service. Julia, at the front desk, was particularly helpful! Really enjoyed the stay and would definitely go back!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We stayed at Serene Palace Hotel for 3 nights. From the time of booking, arrival, stay and departure it was a fantastic experience. Jenny with pre-arrival communication was prompt and clear. At reception Mary and Kelly were always ready to help in planning our outings giving us information with regard to the city and doing their best to make us comfortable. In the restaurant Sally was always friendly and helpful, with breakfast and meal suggestions. We tried the set menu on the day of our arrival which was authentic and delicious. We had booked a balcony room which was very comfortable and also had a PC with internet connection in the room. The room was nice and clean, the bathroom has a bathtub and shower in one. The hotel is well located, down a narrow street and relatively quiet; restaurants and nightlife are a short distance away.
Our entire stay at Serene Palace Hotel was a great experience, all the staff were always pleasant smiling and ready to help. Would recommend this hotel and would also stay there again if the opportunity did arise.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Everything else was great. The reception and restaurant staff were brilliant and there was one girl in restaurant in particular (little jewelled necklace given by her mother) that was absolutely great. She even gave us a box of fresh fruit for the train journey to de nang. We ate dinner in the restaurant which is #no 1 in Hue and we were not disappointed. It was excellent. Do mot be put off by back street entrance, once inside, the place is great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed only one night here, but found the quality of our room brilliant for the low price we paid. Very comfortable, staff are extremely friendly, chatty and helpful (even packing us snacks for the night train we were heading to get - thank you Susy!) Highly recommend it.
h_title_comment: Very cheap, clean and friendliest staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The staff are all so friendly, the rooms clean and quiet, and the location is convenient. We were able to check in 2 hours early which was a huge bonus after having little sleep on the overnight train the previous night. Alan, in particular, spoke excellent English, sharing with us his knowledge of Vietnam and the local sights. His service and easy conversation made our trip to Hue special. The restaurant food was also very good. The set menu for two provided us with delicious local cuisine that we had not yet experienced. We will certainly be recommending this hotel to family and friends.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel is manned by great staff who go out of their way to make you feel welcome.The location is quiet yet within walking distance of the area known as the walking street area on weekend nights.
They even prepared a takeaway breakfast for us when we left early for a tour.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Wonderful little hotel, decent room size and amenities and the staff are amazingly helpful and friendly. Good location too walking distance to most places. The breakfast is pretty good too as they ensure you have had enough to eat before leaving!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment: My wife and I and another couple only had a day and night, the staff were able to assist us in making the most out of our time in Hue. The staff and service I believe make this property. The room was acceptable and very adequate but sets this property from all the others is the service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Really enjoyed our trip to hue and a lot of it had to do with the beautiful hotel and the friendly staff. As soon as we arrived off of a long 14 hour train ride the staff greeted us with a welcome drink and fruits. They were very helpful in explaining everything to see in the area as well as organizing trips and tours for us. The food here at the restaurant was amazing, and the staff were always making sure you were satisfied with your meal. The free breakfast provided was also excellent with a buffet of delicious fruits and pastries as well as allowing you to order anything off of the breakfast menu! When we had a day tour and had to leave early, the staff had already prepared a takeaway container full of breakfast for us! Could not thank the staff at this hotel anymore for making our trip so enjoyable!
