The hotel was also extremely clean and beautifully decorated as well as being located in a quiet lane that is in a great location!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Overall an excellent stay, excellent service, really good food and we would recommend.

We stayed here for two nights as part of our honeymoon. We were given an excellent welcome by Mary, given nice welcome drinks and fruit, a talk about the town and a map to get around. They had decorated our room very romantically and gave us a complimentary bottle of red dalat wine which was a really nice touch.

The room was very well equipped and the restaurant downstairs served a very good breakfast with a decent choice. On the last day we were doing an Easy Rider Tour to Hoi An. We only had a small breakfast and the staff insisted that we take a packed lunch of fruit with us so that we didn't starve. It was a very nice touch and we felt well looked after.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent a night there and it was great! Really big rooms,very clean,the beakfast was very complete and tasty and furthermore the recepcionist kelly was very helpful and nice,i would recommend it for sure
h_title_comment: Great hotel and really nice people
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel was very comfortable, and the rooms matched the pictures on line, well presented and clean, and it had a lovely fragrance to it. Was a bonus that the rooms had an option to use a computer on the wifi network.
The buffet breakfast was nice, with a great choice of food.
Staff were very friendly, and quick to respond to enquiries, very good English spoken
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Probably one of the best hotels I have had the pleasure of staying with. The reception in the lobby was professional and fast. They took time offer help if I needed it. The room was large and emaculate. It's located on a lane, so is quiter than on busy street. But still only a short walk to the river side. There was a large breakfast selection. I can't say enough about the staff at Serene Palace ! Awesome.
h_title_comment: My stay at Her Serene Palace Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We choose Hue Serene Palace Hotel to stay due to the excellent reviews on TA and weâ€™re thrilled with our stay. The hotel room was brilliant, large, very clean and the air conditioning was wonderful. The food and service at their restaurant was so good that we ate every meal there. There is a wonderful tailer nearby BOâ€™sTailer where I had a lot of clothes mad. Top tailer and way cheaper than HoiAn. I highly recommend a visit to Hue. Breakfast at this hotel was outstanding and they even packed us a takeout meal of fruit for our plane trip to Hanoi. Could not recommend mor highly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Biggest complaint was that it was extremely noisy at night with lots of traffic noise and screaming children. Not a serene experience in any sense of the word. The staff was nice. Had to get to it via a kind of sketchy alleyway.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Right when I got into the lobby, I knew I made a reservation at a right place and would have a very nice experience at this hotel. All the staffs really made me feel welcome and they kept their smiles all the time. Appreciated this, which made my stay so lovely. I dont know the name but please send my thank-you to all lobby staffs for their great jobs.

Hotel is at a quiet place so sleeping atmosphere is great, totally silent. It's quite close to walking street as well, just some steps away, so super convenient to hang out at night.

Amenities in room are well- arranged, clean and especially, bed is comfortable to help me have a great night. The special thing is that a computer is setup inroom for your super convenience, you trip will definitely love this.

Will definitely comeback and refer to friends.
h_title_comment: A great choice on my trip in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Our stay in Hue Serene Palace was great! As you walk in, the staff makes sure to make you feel welcome, take care of your luggage and lets you relax for a few minutes while they sort the room out. During that time, they brought us a plate with different kind of fruts and offered us coffee too. The staff is very helpful and goes with you over a map of Hue and its main attractions, giving their personal advice on what to do according to your stay length. The room was great, spcious and clean. The hotel restaurant, where we ate breakfast, was also great. There is a menu with different items, to which you can order as many as you want for breakfast and they are cooked instantly.

The hotel also offered us service to rent motorbikes and do the Hai Van Pass (which goes from Hue to Danang/Hoi An). The prices were really good and motorbikes were in great conditions. The person from the motorbike service comes to the hotel, goes over important info with you, gets your phone number and take your bags which are dropped at your destination in Danang/Hoi An area (all included in the price). This was the most helpful service at Hue Serene Palace.

The location of the hotel is also good, near the bar street area yet in a thin street with no loud sounds at all. The nightly price also makes this hotel excellent value, top service for a budget!

I recommend staying here 100%.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We have much enjoyed our stay at Serene Hotel in HuÃ© even if it was just for one night. We would have enjoyed one or two days more :-)
The Reception and the hospitality reserved were highly appreciated for the kindness in making us feel confortable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Hotel doesnâ€™t look fabulous from the outside but itâ€™s an excellent hotel with warm feeling service to stay for sure.

We got upgrade to deluxe room which was very nice of them. The deluxe room is spacious and has a balcony. They put us at room 702 which is at 7F(top floor). We got the chance to enjoy the view and breeze at night.
Most importantly, Iâ€™ve never been to any hotels in Vietnam that is spotless clean like this. When it comes to cleanliness I am someone hard to please. But the room, bathroom including balcony was literally spotless clean. We were quite surprised but of course highly satisfied.
Breakfast was delicious as all other reviews had mentioned. Good portion staff were all so kind and friendly. They always have smiles on.
We ate here for late lunch and they serve good food as well. It was delicious with reasonable price.
Not to mention WiFi, shower, English TV channels, they all worked well.
We were glad that we chose and stayed at serene palace hotel. It was the best hotel experience in Vietnam.

(But if you wanna rent a scooter I suggest you go to the shop right in front of the hotel, they will offer you a much better price)
h_title_comment: Donâ€™t judge it from its outside ;)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and the main reason for this was the incredible staff! Weâ€™ve been travelling for seven months and therefore stayed at a lot of hotels recently, and I have to say their professionalism, friendliness and service are next to none. Sally and Julia in particular were so kind to us, even going out of their way to ensure we had a packed breakfast before our day trip (we accidentally slept in so didnâ€™t have time to eat!), even though we reassured them we were fine. They really didnâ€™t need to do this and as they predicted, we ended up eating everything! Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable and helping us to celebrate our honeymoon too - the bottle of wine and beautiful flower display was such a lovely welcome.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I would like to say that of all the hotels we stayed in during our stay in Vietnam, that this one was the best without a shadow of a doubt, all hotels we stayed in where in the same price range.
Service here is unbelievable good.
They booked taxis for us, they booked hotels for us, they provided with great information and tips what to do around the area.
They had an outstanding breakfast with super friendly staff ( I recommend noodle soup here) and the fruits was top class.
The rooms are clean with a bathroom that has what you need.
I wish you all the best and hope the other customers have the same service as we did
h_title_comment: Recommendation for people who want to stay in hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Beautiful modern spacious rooms. It's on a busy street but you don't hear street noise. Lots of restaurants nearby. Also within walking distance to Citadel (about 20 mins).

The in-house restaurant is great! We all loved the meals we ordered.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Comfortable, clean hotel. Reception staff efficient and fluent in english. Laundry service quick and reliable. Good breakfast served by kind waitresses willing to help. Very large room spotless clean and tidy, provided with all the comforts, same for the bathroom. Silent, located in the center of the tourist quarter at walking distance of restaurants, shops, marts. Recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This place is phenomenal. It is better than some 5 star hotels we've stayed. The service from the minute you walk in to the hotel is amazing. The staff is so kind and welcoming. We were given a welcome drink and fresh fruit which was so nice. Kelly helped us to settle in to our place and was so helpful with making sure we know what to go/see throughout Hue.

The room is so spacious, modern and clean! The restaurant downstairs is very good too and all of the wait staff are just as kind. I wish we could have stayed longer.

I 100% recommend this place!
h_title_comment: Best Hotel we've stayed in Vietnam!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We only stayed one night and felt fully comfortable. The staff is very attentive and quickly deals with any request.
The rooms are spacious and the bed comfortable and clean.
It is placed in a smaller side road, which also gave us a quite night.
h_title_comment: Great Hotel to stay in hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel was in a quiet area, tucked away from the busy streets. It has a very good restaurant. Breakfast was very good too with plenty of choice. The staff were very keen to help. It's a shame we couldn't stay longer.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We spent one night at Serene and everything was perfect. The staff were very kind to us, specially one of the waitress in the restaurant. We had dinner and breafkfast at the restaurant and everything was delicious. The room was big and clean. The best experience in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Highly recommended hotel, starting with the warm treatment of the staff, clean and good quality facilities, services and tours available, and a perfect location, in a quiet street but near the center of the city. We would repeat without hesitation!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Comfortable hotel with good facilities,close to the centre. The room was nice and the breakfast good quality (and plenty of it).The staff are friendly and attentive. The WiFi connection in our room wasn't very good (especially with 2 teenage boys) and the air-conditioning could have been better.overall,good value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very comfortable, clean and large room. Excellent breakfast, the staff continue to offer you more food. Staff very helpful and friendly (the best I experienced in Vietnam). A short walk to the "Walking Street" bars and restaurants. Road access to the hotel was narrow and a section was under water after some heavy rain.Would stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Rooms are spacious, clean and appear to be recently renovated. Staff are very helpful and speak english. Close to good restaurants and shops. Excellent breakfasts. It was a very good experience. Can recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed in the Serene Palace Hotel for two nights in August, visiting Hue. The place is alright, however walking around the area of the hotel, I felt a bit overcharged. Basically you can find four star hotels with a pool in the same neighborhood.

Rooms were spacious, clean, freshly renovated. Service great. Breakfast great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We went to stay at Serene Palace Hotel for 1 night. The access to this hotel was quite narrow but near many shops. The room was clean and comfortable although the light was not so bright. Among the hotel I'd stayed in Vietnam, the staffs in this hotel were the MOST friendly and helpful ones. They gave us direction and responsed very quickly to us. We took private tour too from this hotel and the drivers were so nice and friendly too. Highly recommended hotel :)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We only had one night here, but could definitely had stayed for longer if possible. The staff is just so sweet and helpful, and they all speak English. The room were perfectly clean, nice big bed and a really wonderful shower. The staff helped us to locate the most important places to see in Hue. All in all a great experience.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for two nights and were very impressed. The hotel is down a slightly run down side street and may not give the best impression from the outside but donâ€™t be put off. We had a spacious, nicely finished room with a big bed, good size balcony and a very good bathroom. Air con worked perfectly which was crucial in Hueâ€™s hot climate. The breakfast was one of the better ones weâ€™ve had in Vietnam and the service from all staff was excellent. The hotel is located in the heart of the tourist area, so lots of choice for restaurants and bars. Itâ€™s also about 30 minutes from the citadel, and this is a perfectly doable and pleasant walk. We also took the boat tour they offered to the pagoda which was very good.
Overall this hotel represents great value for money and gives a high standard experience. We would highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stayed for 2 nights with 2 kids, big clean room with two comfy big beds and a balcony .
Great central location it a quiet alley with lots of bars and restaurants around.
Breakfast was tasty and cooked to order with a self seve buffet also.
The staff could not have been more attentive and kind, happy to assist with booking onward train tickets, requested late check out but unfortunately the hotel was full, they were able to store our luggage and we had access to the restroom to freshen up, a really great place to stay would definitely recommend and stay again in the future, thank you Serene Palace
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Staff, especially at the reception, was of great help. Hotel has a great value when you compare its cost against the conveniency you experience. Room was of good size and comfortable. They keep a big size umbrella which is good for two. You may need it given the rain showers in Vietnam. Location of hotel is in close to the bars and restaurants which is where the night life is going on.

The driver (Minh) hotel arranged for the transportation from Hue to Hoi An was very helpful and friendly. He showed all the possible sites on the way and showed the best spots for photo taking. This hotel is highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very friendly staff, clean - comfortable room, with excellent breakfast. Alan at front desk was very helpful to arrange car that took us to Citadel, Pagoda and Tomb with a friendly driver. Alan also recommended great restraunt for lunch. Highly recommend Hue Serene Hotel for a visit in Hue.
h_title_comment: Great hotel for sightseeing in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Fine location. Extremely hospitable and kind staff!! 10/10 (and there were 3 of us... so thatâ€™s 30/10 stars for this place!) Great rooms. Spacious. Very comfortable, massive beds!! Lovely restaurant & breakfast buffet.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We've just stayed here as a family of 3 for 2 nights and it really was an unexpected gem. Don't be put off by the location on first arrival whatever you do. Yes it is down an alleyway off the road, and yes it is next to a backpackers hostel and across the road from a scooter tour rental place but you will be very pleasantly surprised by the welcome you'll get and how well you will be looked after.

The small restaurant where they serve breakfast to guests and evening meals for guests and walks in, is again a little off putting but the quality of food and again the fantastic service is well worth it and a bargain. The waiting team in the restaurant couldn't do any more for you, even packing us a big bag of complimentary fruit for us as they knew we had a long day ahead.

Great hotel at a bargain price with a great service attitude. Wouldn't hesitate in going back again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed here for two nights in the suite room. It's very good value for money with a nice big room & everything that you need in a hotel. The complementary wine & fruit was a nice touch. The service was great, very helpful and pleasant which seems to be a rarity in Vietnam. The breakfast is of good standard. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant which was also very good. This place seems to genuinely care about their guests which is why it's so highly rated. Some other larger hotels could learn a thing or two from you, thank you for a good experience.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is nicely placed in a side alley. The hotel staff were welcoming and had arranged the tours which we'd requested in advance. The rooms are very nice and spacious. Breakfast was fresh and the waiting staff very efficient. We ate in the restaurant one evening and the food was nice, good value and large portions! We enjoyed our stay and would recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I stayed in Serene Palace Hue for 5 nights back in may. I booked direct and all questions I had were answered fast and polite from Miss Jenny Linh. Unlike other Hotels in Hue they offer fair rates for a transfer from Da Nang Airport. On arrival I was checked in, in a hurry. Nice after a 24 hours trip from Europe. My room on the fifth floor had a nice view with a balcony.
The room is large and spotless clean. You get fresh fruit every day. A nice typical asien hard double bed with quality bed linen. What makes this Hotel special is the staff. Everybody kind and smiling, always willing to help you with no matter what.
I especially enjoyed the advices from Mr. Daniel from the reception who gave me many and always good tips for restaurants. And a very special thanks to Mr. Tu Le, one of the bellboys, who 2 times made private trips on motorbike with me.
Breakfast is very nice with western and Asian options.
They offer a wide range of excursions which are reasonable priced.
The Hotel is situated in a small side street close to the walking area. Small bars and restaurants close to the Hotel.
Thanks for a good stay. You made my stay in Hue perfect.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Living during times when people make it a point to register their displeasure, I felt compelled to express my appreciation, despite the fact that this stay was almost 2 months ago.
My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time in Hue, especially because of the outstanding accommodations and service from Serene. The front desk, restaurant staff, and housekeeping were very helpful and friendly. I look forward to returning to Hue, and staying at Serene again.
I have indicated all this on my Agoda review as well.
h_title_comment: Late review, but in the end I felt responsible to say what I thought.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We really enjoyed our short stay in Hue (1 night). Serene Palace Hotel was an excellent choice for us as it is situated in a super location and out of all of the hotels we stayed in in Vietnam, Serene Palace had definitely the nicest rooms.

The bedding was excellent, clean and comfortable. The room was spacious and the bathroom was equipped with a relaxing power shower.

The staff were very friendly and organized a trip on the Perfume River for us.

All in all we were very happy with our stay there and would recommend it to our friends who plan to visit Vietnam in the future.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stayed for 2 nights.
Great value for money, good breakfast included. Great location too just a short walk from the nightlife. Staff are very friendly, couldn't do enough for us and gave lots of information.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: On arrival, we were greeted with welcome drink and a plate of fresh fruit (5 kinds of fruit). A staff was so nice and knowledgeable to do the introduction and led us to the room. The hotel was so generous to upgrade our room from superior to deluxe. Thanks for that! The room was spacious, tidy and very clean. It's so comfortable! The breakfast was delicious. You could select anything from the menu and the ordered food was immediately cooked/prepared, so it's very fresh. Other than the chosen food, there's also a buffet table that you can take. Though the hotel was located in a lane, the staff helped to take our luggage to the Open Bus on the next day when we left. Their service was excellent! I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who will come to Hue. You must not be disappointed!
h_title_comment: A very good hotel with excellent service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel was extremely nice inside and comfortable. The staff were so lovely and went above and beyond what we asked of them. They went out of their way to organise a trip for us, on a tight budget, with awkward dates and timings to make sure it worked for us! The room was amazing and very clean, breakfast was really good too with cooked options as well as the buffet included in the price. If Iâ€™m ever in Hanoi again this is where iâ€™ll Be staying!

Would recommend to anyone, I traveled previously alone through Vietnam and paid almost the same price for a hostel. The rest away from the madness of the beautiful city is much needed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed one night. Pleasant room with space. Staff friendly. Alan extremely helpful and knowledgeable He gave good advice on local area Good location. Caring staff even noticed it was my birthday and presented me with a birthday cake.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Hue Serene Palace Hotel is your standard build Vietnamese hotel. We stayed in a 2 double bedroom and it provided sufficient room for our family over the 3 days in Hue. I got out at Hue airport and paid about 160K VND for a taxi to the airport. Make sure you have your addresses handed as driverâ€™s may not know English well.

Whilst arriving at the hotel you feel it is off the main street and away from the action. Most of the action in this area hots up at night time. Thereâ€™s currently stormwater and sewerage piping being re done so part of the street is blocked off.

When we arrived we were greeted by friendly hotel staff, welcome fruits and drinks which was really appreciated. Toiletries are basic and the hotel bathroom is respectable.

Infrastructure wise they have the standard local plugs which can fit Australian 2 pin chargers or Thailand, Taiwan or Indonesian electrical points. It wonâ€™t fit HK, Malaysia or Singapore chargers. Bottled water is provided for each person and thereâ€™s a computer in the room with chairs to sit at.

We had another double bedroom for 2 people and that was a very ample and spacious size.

In all the hotel was kept clean and worth staying at because of the location. I liked how it was not located on the walking street because once the roads are closed, you canâ€™t drive in and out by taxi. So if you arrive or depart during the walking street time, itâ€™s a struggle.

The only problem is sound proofing between rooms is poor and rowdy neighbours blasting a TV can mean less sleep or interrupted early mornings

Right now, the Hue Night Market isnâ€™t really functioning and just a mere couple of stalls. Whatâ€™s great is the hotel is adjacent to the Walking Street market in Vo Thi Sau, from Friday night 6pm -10pm and repeated over Saturday and Sunday. So having not been to Hue before, it was a nice surprise that we were so close to the action and the atmosphere. Thereâ€™s plenty of restaurants and small stalls to buy food from and the street sellers had food that was edible for western tummies.

I also arranged a DMZ tour with the hotel and they arranged a tour guide who was a local from the area to the Vinh Moc tunnels for $100USD. Because the guide was a local who survived the war it was well worth it and more enjoyable experience. Passing the Ben Hai river was also The only thing I would completely by pass is the

I had arranged a city tour separately with another company for $50USD. I thought that was a good deal and they arranged my transfer to Da Nang, which including a stop at the super scenic Lap An lagoon and Lagoon Restaurant before the Hai Van Pass, was a good deal.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We were overwhelmed with the excellent customer service and value for money, especially for a 3 star property. Everyone at reception, the restaurant, our driver (Tung), were attentive from beginning to end. Have to mention gorgeous Julia at reception who was brilliant , but not at all pushy, when recommending Hue attractions , and booked us on citadel and tomb visits/ river cruise. She was very informative and honest - thank you Julia! We were a family of 2 adults, 2 tweens, stayed 2 nights, we all fit well into one room, very spacious and clean modern. Breakfast was included where we could order anything off an extensive menu, the kids ordered eggs plus crepes! Due to its high ranking in trip advisor reviews, we also ate tried one lunch and one dinner in the restaurant, great local and western dishes. One evening, our daughter didn't feel well and couldn't eat her meal, the next day Sally from the restaurant advised we would only be charged half price plus she gave us a big pack of "feel better" fresh fruit. How lovely and unexpected ! You cannot go wrong staying here, we felt very well looked after , it's such an inexpensive hotel, plus only a short walk to restaurants and facilities. It made our first visit to Hue very memorable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Location, comfort, value, and customer service are all excellent at Serene Palace. Tucked away down a quiet lane, this little gem offers a lovely complimentary breakfast and the staff will be willing to assist you with anything you need. Great value for money!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was a great place to stay! The service was very good, but the breakfast and restaurant was excellent. Itâ€™s very central and the staff have good recommendations with directions on how to get there. Would definitely recommend this place to stay in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Friendly staff and a really nice room to stay in. We only stayed here one night but the staff made us feel right at home. Clean room and hotel. Room service and breakfast was really nice also. Would recommend a stay here for anyone visiting Hue..
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was a great hotel. The room was very comfortable and clean, and had a good view. The front desk staff were immensely helpful anytime we asked for assistance, such as booking a scooter tour, helping us book train tickets/other onward travel, recommending restaurants, etc. The hotel has strong WiFi and lots of hot water. The breakfast each morning was delicious and had numerous options, both from a buffet and from a menu. The hotelâ€™s location is perfect, within walking distance of lots of restaurants, shops, etc. The location is especially great on weekend nights when roads in the area are closed to cars and you can walk around to enjoy the street life without worrying about chaotic traffic. The hotel is only a 30 minute walk to the Citadel. For longer-term travelers, an added benefit is that there is a place just down the street that will do laundry; we gave them a whole bag and it cost less than $2 (US).
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great stay in Hue. We had an excellent view from the top floor. The room and service were really good. It was quite central and the restaurant has good food. The breakfast was good too. There is a motorcycle shop out front, so don't be surprised if there are scooters and bikes blocking the small road at times. One end of the street was also blocked off for construction so you have to get out the other side.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My family originally planned to stay in Danang City, but Hue was more charming and stayed 2 nights in this hotel.
It was a good choice. hue was a good city. The location of the hotel was also quiet and the rooms were neat. The staff laughed and gave us a smile. I want to visit Hue and hotel again.

h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very accommodating staff, large rooms close to everything breakfast good. I believe the restaurant is also good for lunch & dinner though there is so many choices available in the area. When we were leaving the gave us a travel pack of fruit very nice touch.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We only stayed 1 night at Serena Palace hotel on our way South along the coast of Vietnam. We found the hoetl to be excellent shape. The staff Lien and Tien were lovely and very knowlegeable. Staying at the hotel earns you a 10% discount at Restaurant and the room were clean and morden. Of all the hotel we have stayed at in Vietnam so far this was the most value for the money for sure. I would return.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This is by far the best hotel we have stayed in while in Asia. Especially considering the price. The rooms are really nice and clean. The staff especially Maya at reception are incredible and also the spa in the sister hotel was outstanding. It also has the best Vietnamese Pho we had in Vietnam. I can't recommend this place enough
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at 3 different hotels in 3 cities on our trip and stayed at Serene Palace Hotel in Hue. This was the best hotel in our trip - friendly and helpful staff, good tours / drives at reasonable prices available, spacious clean room, and descent breakfast (with good fresh fruit). Their customer service prior to arrival via e-mail was also very good. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I have a chance to visit Hue and recommend anyone who is going there.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This is a good hotel with very nice staffs, the room is new and clean. Good location and quiet.The breakfast is good with many fruits and juices,I really like the mango juice :).We will stay here if we come back to Hue
h_title_comment: Good place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
The location in an alley is pleasant in reducing street noise (traffic, vendors), and probably also in reducing smog ! There is a store next door to rent motorcycles ! The alley is wide enough for cars and minibuses, but not for full-sized buses.

The staff took down birth dates and gave my son a surprise Happy Birthday cake, with candles, in the hotel restaurant, and dining guests joined in with a hearty rendition of the Happy Birthday song, following a procession of waiters and waitresses ! (but you must show up in the restaurant during your Birthday to get that treatment, because the hotel hadn't notify us beforehand !)

Hotel staff is pleasant and honest. We've never lost anything in our rooms despite stocking them with gifts (some of which are valuable) !

The staffs we were in contact with the most have text-messaged us after we had left and became our friends, that we later entrusted with taking care of our next groups of friends and family members visiting Hue. Whenever we couldn't find a taxi, they offered to drive us in their motorcycles or in the hotel car, without any charge (needless to say, we showed them our appreciation later with gifts !)

Those extra-friendly staffs are Thyy Phan, Mary Truong, Kelly Le and Julia Huynh
h_title_comment: My extended family and my friends have enjoyed several stays in this hotel within the last 12 months
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The hotel is located in a small alley, but easy to navigate with walking distance to the riverside or the bar location. Room is clean, comfortable. Superior room is equipped with bathtub (no stand shower). Breakfast is ok, not something outstanding. Overall it is valuable
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Mary and the Serene Team made my stay awfully enjoyable and everything
after that worked out smoothly. Tucked away in a side street everything is in easy reach in Hue from the hotel and there is no street noise around. I booked a trip with them and that worked out perfectly. The breakfast was mega good.

So: Thank you all very much. I miss my time in Hue!
In German: Tausend Dank an Mary und das Team. Immer wieder gerne.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment: Though the hotel is located in a small alley n looks unimpressive from the outside, the rooms were in excellent conditions (clean, spacious, new and comfortable). The front desk staff (in particular Alan) speaks very good english and gave great advice. Breakfast was good. Nothing we can complain about this hotel. Will stay here again if ever visit Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Stayed here two nights. After walking 400m along an unpaved road with heavy cases we received a very warm welcome. While being checked in we were given a welcome drink and fruit. We were also upgraded to a superior city view room. Nice large room with balcony and a bathroom with all you needed. There was complimentary tea coffee water and fruit each day. The room also had a computer and seating area. Breakfast was a mixture of self service and waiter service. A good selection on the menu. On leaving a taxi was arranged for our return. All the staff were helpful and friendly. I would recommend staying there and would stay if I return to Hue.
Not too far from shops or Perfume River. And taxis will come to outside the hotel. We were unfortunate to be dropped off a coach at the wrong end of the road.
Three days after leaving I received an e-mail from the office Manager Mary saying some items had been found in our room by housekeeping. A photo of the items was included in the e-mail and asked us if these were ours. (I think the Â£50 note was the reason she thought the items were ours.) I confirmed the items did belong to us and that I wondered if these could be sent to us in the post. After several e-mails between us and I was told the items were too valuable to post, so I made arrangements to collect them. On arrival I was welcomed and the items returned. I was also given a drink as it was so hot. After thanking Mary and her staff for their honesty I left. So despite what you may read on this site about the honesty of this hotel's staff from my experience I can assure you they are HONEST. The Â£50 note would have been worth a lot of VND to them.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The hotel service staff receptionists were all super friendly and helpful. In particular, a very nice lady called Kelly. They arranged for transport from Hue to Danang for us.
Breakfast was really good and the service ladies were so friendly and always chatted with us. The only minus point is that the massage place was at another building which was under going construction. The massage was really good though. The food at the restaurant was also reasonably priced and very good. Though their pamphlet has to be updated, the Green Bean restaurant at the sister hotel isn't open anymore.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We only stayed one night here and wished it was longer. Lovely hotel, we rented a scooter for $8US and spent the day scootering around the temples and pagodas. It was wet but it didn't dampen our fun! It's a decent walk to the palace from the hotel, but doable. Lots of little restaurants and bars within a close distance. You could easily spend a couple of nights here. Staff were lovely and very knowledgeable, room was clean and relatively quiet, shower was good. I would stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We only stayed here one night but really loved the hotel! We travelled from Hoi An to Hue and the hotel arranged for a car to come and pick us up, we stopped at marble mountains, hai van pass and a lagoon which were all lovely, I think it cost around $58 USD.

We were greeted with welcome drinks and given a map to landmarks/restaurants of Hue. Our hotel room was upgraded free of charge to a large family room. It was spacious, clean and the staff extremely helpful.

The hotel restaurant is rated number 1 on trip advisor so we decided to have food in the hotel. The room service is the same price as eating in the restaurant so we just ordered it to the room and it was delicious and very reasonably priced.

We had a lovely breakfast there too, the food is made to order so really fresh and tasty, great selection! You can have eggs your way, Vietnamese or pancakes/crepes all fresh.

Definitley recommend a stay here!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel was excellent, all the staff were helpful and were very friendly and welcoming and knowledgeable about the area and what tourists would wish. They recommended tours but also took into account our wishes and noted things that would save us money. When the restaurant staff noted my daughter was not so well abd had left our meak early, they provided some extra food that she could eat later -thanks to the restaurant stafff, who then asked after her the following day. The receptionists Tien and Lien provided very helpful information in the booking of tours or guvibg directions and greeted us by name each day.
In addition, the place was very clean, tidy, lots of hot water, service was excellent, all staff we met spoke english which was a help for us in Vietnam, breakfast was buffet plus hot options(crepes/noodles) included. Price good for all of the above. We would stay again and highly recommend.
h_title_comment: Serene Palace Hotel service was excellent
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Really lovely hotel, very clean and in a brilliant location. Within walking distance from a lot of attractions. The staff here are really friendly and full of lots of great advice about the area, what to do as well as the rest of Vietnam and travelling around. They offer tours and recommendations. In particular Catherine and Julia were very helpful and friendly, gave us lots of advice, very personable, they remember youâ€™re names and ask how youâ€™re trip is going, a really nice touch. Would highly recommend staying here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Very welcoming, greeted us with cold drink and fresh fruit when we arrived, quick and efficient Regards to checking in.
The staff especially Alan, was very polite and helpful regards to where to visit, food and other services around the hotel.
Great location, very clean, quite, very friendly staff, yummy breakfast, just fantastic service all around.
I will be recommending to all my family and friends.
I'll see you again when we return next time to Vietnam Hue.
Nina & Chris.
h_title_comment: 5star hotel with 5star service for very low price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I picked this hotel based on location, beds and price. The restaurant was good and we had the fixed price meal the first night as we were beat from travel. Also liked the breakfast which included fresh omelets and great coffee. Staff was very helpful and friendly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We were only here for a couple of nights but so please with our choice of hotel. It was within walking distance of everything we wanted to visit and the staff gave us plenty of suggestions for tours and were very helpful with arranging our onward travel by train to Da Nang. Our room was very clean and comfortable and excellent breakfast. Good choice!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:

All the staff were very nice and kind. I get a lot of information from this hotel.
They were really care about me and helped me everything I want to do.
And this hotel has lot of options for tour program so I highly recommend you to choose this hotel without booking any kind of tours.
They will help your trip as you want!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Me and My friend Got here after a bike Tour and just wanted to relax. Luckily they had a superior room for only around 500k VND with Nice beds, tv and a/c. The receptionist even helped us to a room with to double beds instead of one, without charging us any further. The best place in hue for relaxing ans getting good service!
h_title_comment: You get a lot for the Price
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Excellent staff, super friendly and helpful, always willing to go the extra mile. Breakfast is great with lots of choices, and the restaurant stellar overall. Room was spacious, bright, super comfy beds and very well maintained. Highly recommend. Thank you for a great stay!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: My wife and i stayed here overnight. The staff are so welcoming and the restaurant is fantastic. When we were heading out for a day trip. Restaurant staff farewelled us with a box of fresh fruit salad for our trip. There is now a new cement road to the hotel. Rooms are excellent as well.
h_title_comment: Fantastic Place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel seemingly from outside looks pretty standard, however itâ€™s anything but!
We were greeted warmly with welcome drinks and fruit and Mary and her team.
The rooms were beautiful and the staff were so kind and helpful!!
They organised for us to travel from Hue to Hoi An on motorcycle with easy rider which was great. Our tour guide Chinh was INCREDIBLE!! I canâ€™t recommend doing this enough...donâ€™t be scared!!
Possibly the best hotel we stayed in for the whole of our trip!!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: On April 25, 2018 my wife and I checked into this hotel for 2 nights accompanied by two other couples. On arrival we found that the entire single lane street had been dug up and was a horrible mud pit! Our driver would not take his car down the street and we had to get the hotel porters to carry our luggage 50 metres to the hotel while we traipsed through the mud to the hotel lobby. Not a good start. On 27 April we checked out at 9.30 am and forgot to retrieve our Australian passports, credit cards, cash and my wife's diamond ring from our room number 402 safe. While we sat in the downstairs lobby waiting for our driver to arrive, the cleaners advised Mary, the desk manager that the safe was still locked. She despatched the bellboy with the master key. He entered the room alone at 9.54 am (before we departed at 10.00 am) and unlocked the safe. Around midday we realised we had forgotten to retrieve our passports etc. and phoned the hotel. Mary, the desk manager told us on that phone call that the safe was empty when opened by the bellboy so we returned to the hotel to file police reports etc. We now believe that the bellboy was telling the truth. In fact we strongly suspect that the theft was orchestrated by the hotel desk manager, Alan Tran who welcomed us on April 25. I was the only Caucasian present in our group of 6 and Alan was emphatic that my Asian wife and I occupy room 402. Room 402 shared a balcony on the 4th floor with room 401 where our Malaysian friends were placed. Alan also explained that Hue was very safe and that it was safe to walk around and safe to lock our valuables in the room safes. Room 402 had NO INSTRUCTIONS for setting the room safe combination so I had to ask Alan Tran to come up to the room to show me how to set the combination. My wife saw him looking under my arm pit as I set my combination and locked my money belt with passport inside the safe. Alan then remained in the room chatting with me for about 5 more minutes. He told me he was early 30's and earned US$200 per month as did his wife. They have 2 young children. According to him, a home in Hue costs US$30,000 to $40,000 and he has no chance of ever owning his own home. I spoke of Samsung's huge investments in Vietnam and he complained bitterly that they were just raping his country and sending all the profits back to Korea. He seemed to be a very bitter young man. As he left, he said he would be off work the following day but would be on the desk the next morning when we checked out. That night I opened the safe and locked up my wife's money pouch containing her passport and valuables. At the time of making my police statement, I thought I had opened the safe the next day but in fact I was upset, confused and wrong in that part of my police statement. I only opened the safe once and that was when I put my wife's pouch in the safe. The next day we were all out till mid afternoon when I returned alone for a rest. After a while I noticed the room was quite hot even though the air conditioner was turned on. I looked behind the curtains and saw that the balcony door was wide open. I thought nothing of this and closed and locked it but did mention this to my wife when she returned a few hours later. The balcony is shared with the adjoining room 401 where our friends were staying but is on the 4th floor facing the street. You would need to be spider man to climb onto it! The morning we checked out, Alan Tran was NOT working. He had phoned in and changed his shift to the evening, citing "family matters". Note that a CCTV camera is recording every entry to our room 24/7. We think that Alan may have passed the safe combination to one of the 4 cleaners who work as a team cleaning the rooms together. This cleaner then unlocked our balcony door on the morning of April 26 then moved with the cleaning team to the adjoining room number 401 and went out alone to clean their balcony, quickly entering our room 402 through the unlocked balcony door, opening the safe and stealing its contents then returning unseen to room 401, deliberately leaving the balcony door wide open to make it look like an outside job. This would have avoided the CCTV camera looking at the entry to room 402. A stolen Australian passport can be sold for a large sum on the black market. If it was Alan, then he got his house. I hope his children will be proud of him. When the police attended on 27th April, the desk manager Mary, accompanied by the hotel manager, acted as our interpreter both with the police in the room and then at the office of the immigration police. They both seemed very keen for us to leave town, telling us that it we would have to stay till late the next week to get a stamped and signed copy of the police report itemising our lost valuables (cash, credit cards and jewellery). The immigration police officer got angry with us and thumped the table with his hand when we tried to write the word "stolen" on our statement. He slapped a new form down in front of my wife and then in front of me and insisted through Mary, the hotel interpreter that we write the word "lost" when referring to our passports. We felt quite intimidated by him and he then left the office at 4.45 pm and we were told there was no one available to stamp and sign our statements about "losing" our passports. We knew by then that we needed these signed and stamped statements to be able to obtain an exit visa to leave Vietnam. We chose to leave Hue and drive back to Da Nang when Mary assured us that she would get the statements stamped and signed the next day. In fact Mary sent photos of the signed and stamped statements via whatsapp to us that evening after we arrived in Da Nang, claiming that she found another immigration office opened to sign them. The Serene Palace Hotel then sent the originals to us in Da Nang by private car the next morning at their expense. We felt that we had been manipulated into leaving Hue and that the hotel management wanted to get rid of us as soon as possible. We have never received official police copies of our report itemising the stolen valuables but did managed to take photos of the statements we wrote for the investigating police whilst seated in room 402. All up, it took 12 more days before we could leave Vietnam. We had to obtain travel documents from Vietnam Immigration to allow us to fly to Ho Chi Minh where we applied for emergency passports from the Australian Consulate, exit visas from Vietnam immigration and entry visas back to Malaysia where we had left our Australian house keys and other items in our holiday apartment in Kuala Lumpur. Furthermore I became very ill in Ho Chi Minh and was briefly hospitalised, losing 4 kg of weight by the time I recovered in time to fly out. All up, our 2 night stay at Serene Palace Hotel managed to turn our 6 day holiday into an 18 day nightmare.
h_title_comment: Beware. There Are Thieves In This Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Don't be put off by the street (really an alley): yes, it's muddy and in terrible condition, but Serene Palace is simply an oasis! (And, apparently, the street is due to be repaired).

I don't have enough superlatives to describe this hotel!! It is immaculate, and very welcoming. They have a full bank of smiling staff to help you with anything you might need, and each and every one of them is very kind, service-oriented and speaks English very well.
Sarah, Sallie, Jack and the rest of the staff were so wonderful.

The hotel happens to be just around the corner from the prime bar and restaurant area, where they close off 5 streets to traffic every evening (a welcome reprieve from the scooters!!), and you can wander and people watch for hours.
However, despite being so close to this boisterous area, it was utterly without noise from both inside and outside the hotel, something that I only experienced here. It is also within easy walking distance from the Citadel.

After being greeted with lemonade and fresh fruit upon arrival, in the room I found real rose petals on my bed, a fridge that worked well, cable TV, a computer (!), a coffee pot and fresh fruit, a counter in the bathroom to put toiletries on (rare in Vietnam), an umbrella on the back of the door (very thoughtful!) and, for the first time, READING lights!!

There is only one thing that I would change: brighter ceiling lights in the room would be welcome.
That said, I would never consider staying anywhere else when I return to Hue. This was the best hotel I stayed in in Vietnam.
Thank you so much, folks!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: I have stayed here for 2 nights for leisure , the location of the hotel is very good , short walk to the restaurants n bars . The only set back is not easily accessible by van currently due to frequent flood n the small little lane infront hotel is under construction. I must give some credits to Ms Jenny for giving my group a wonderful stay at the hotel . The food in the restaurant is very nice and the pricing is pretty reasonable. The service staff by the name of Sally is very warm n cheerful and very attentive . I would definitely back to stay here again if I ever return to Hue some days .
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Very good 3-star hotel in good location with exceptionally good service staff at the Reception ( e.g. Mary. Jenny Linh etc) and Restaurant (Sally etc) . About an 8-min walk to Perfume Riverfront, where one can take the boat service and enjoy the walk along the riverfront . Free fruit plate in room daily.

Special Hue Traditional Dinner at their restaurant for 2 pax at attractive price. Close to many restaurants if guests want to eat outside. Very good breakfast- combination of buffet menu and also individually ordered dishes like Pho, several options for eggs. Eight types of local fruits provided at breakfast.

Free pick up service from Hue Phu Bai Airport is much appreciated.

The Reception staff provides good information on tours available and also a map of Hue City for those who want to explore on their own.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Only stayed here one night but it was the best night we have had!! Will go back for more... great room and comfy bed, best breakfasts we have had! Such helpful friendly staff.. believe me I've travelled extensively before using tripadvisor and this hotel is A1. Thanks to all the staff here x
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed for two nights at the Hue Serene Palace. Originally we booked the Superior Room which is nicely and with a look for details decorated and with e.g. a computer useful equipped (especially during longer travels). However, the hotel has per floor one room (the Superior Room, Room Nr. 3) in the middle of the floor and those rooms only have windows to the hallway. From the pictures it is not clear, that the Superior Room has no real window and especially room 303 is due to the windows to the hallway (which is all the way to the dining room two floors down open) still quite noisy.

At our first night they had no other rooms free but at the next morning we explained once again the situation (no real window and really noisy) to the restaurant manager Sally and she ensured that we would get another room. With Sallys help we got for our second night the Deluxe Room without additional charge, which was really nice and also quiet. But in order to have a nice stay during both nights it would have been better if the hotel would have written us, that the Superior Room is not a quiet room (for what we precisely asked in our booking).

We could therefore recommend not to book the Superior Room but rather the Junior or Deluxe Room (at least if you want a window). The rooms with the number 1, 2, 4 and 5 are at the end of the floor and with a window and only the rooms number 3 are in the middle.

Before we booked we were a little bit worried about the comments regarding to try to sell tours to guest. In our case the ladies at the reception told us about the tours only once and when we told them, that we want to do it by ourselves it was no problem and we weren't asked again. Beside this the service at the reception is nice, and especially Sally is (as already mentioned) highly motivated and incredible friendly.

On arrival we got not only a fresh juice as welcome drinks but also a tasty fruit salad. The restaurant is in general really nice, we had the best fresh springs rolls all over Vietnam, wonderful vegan vegetable Pho and a great breakfast. On the buffet they have various fresh juices, bread, sweets etc. In addition you can order lots of things such as pancakes, eggs, soups etc.

Service 8/10
Location 8/10
Breakfast 9/10
Cleanliness 10/10
Room/Facilities 9/10
Price-Value 9/10 ($ 29)
h_title_comment: A great stay as long as you do not take the Superior Room
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff and restaurant make this hotel worth a second look. The rooms are average and clean. The fresh fruit each day is a nice touch. The location is average, but itâ€™s not hard to get to main roads to hail a taxi or moto or to walk and explore this fascinating city. The desk staff is very helpful arranging for tours and cars and guides, as well as calling ahead to other restaurants for reservations.
h_title_comment: Safe, clean and affordable base to explore region
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Recently had a three night stay in this lovely small hotel. The staff were very accommodating and friendly and all was great with the hotel, the location was great and close to all major attractions. The breakfast was very good and well prepared and presented. The service was top class and the rooms were very clean and well presented with all the amenities that you require.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We were a bit unsure upon arrival as the lane in front of the hotel was part mud and part concrete. Apparently, it has been under repair for about a year.
Also, when we first visited the walking street area (a five minute walk away), we wished our hotel had been here.
However, the noise and the crowds on the walking street got louder and larger as the evening wore on. Lots of fun but we were thankful to return to our peaceful and serene hotel.
The staff at the hotel was exceptional! The breakfasts were good and plentiful and the room was clean. A bit of noise from the hallway when other guests checked in but overall, a very good choice for a hotel in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I stayed at Serene in April as solo traveller. Very nice staff, good and clean hotel close to the river. When I was there some works were beeing at the street so was a bit dusty and cars could not drive to the hotels door but there was the nice staff to help to carry the lugagge at the coner of the street. Nice and clean rooms with a top staff . The restaurant had good choice of breakfast and nice choose for dinner.
I would come back at Serene no doubt about it.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Any stay where you feel welcomed by the staff is a good one. The staff here are exceptionally attentive and friendly. The added bonus of an extensive breakfast available from 7-10am and comfortable beds makes this hotel well worth your consideration.

The room we stayed in (deluxe twin room with city view on the 4th floor, there are 7 floors from memory) was good. Shower and bathroom were great.

Daily complimentary fruit and water is provided in the room, which is a nice touch. The hotel is located roughly 8 minutes walking to the active restaurant and cafÃ© district. This area becomes a walking-only area on weekends.

The restaurant is pretty good outside of the complimentary breakfast and is useful if you need to eat lunch and kill some time between checkout (12pm midday) and leaving for your next destination.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: First impression as you wonder down a dark street with a porter trying to carry your heavy bag or drag it on the ground when it becomes too heavy - why did I book this hotel? Right now the street the hotel is on is 'under construction' I truly don't believe this construction will end in a long time. You are left to walk through mud every time you want to leave the hotel as no cars are allowed to drive down this laneway. And I am not talking a few steps, the street is quite long. Besides the location the staff were very friendly and the room comfortable. You order breakfast from the menu rather than buffet which is a good idea. Unfortunately the location is so bad I would not consider staying here if I knew about this situation.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Really, everything was as it should be in all hotels. Perfect service, clean rooms, good location, friendly and capable staff, good breakfast and a great restaurant. Just book it, you won't find a better place to stay in Hue for that money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Despite the road works outside the hotel (there is no noise issue from the road work) we enjoyed our stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel. The staff are engaging, ready for a chat and very personable. The staff are a highlight of staying at Hue Serene Palace Hotel. We booked a Deluxe Double room which was comfortable and roomy. The only problem we had was working out how the taps in the shower coordinated (hot/cold/on/off). A guide to use the taps would have been helpful. Reception did send someone up to our room to help us out, but even he had trouble working the taps out. The breakfasts choices were good. We were very happy with Hue Serene Palace Hotel and would consider staying there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was an excellent value hotel with super helpful (if rather busy) staff. We booked a car and driver (Phuc) via the hotel to drive us from Hoi An to Hue which was an excellent idea. Our driver was lovely. He drove safely, the car was high quality and he took us to all the places we wanted to visit (marble mountain, Hai Van pass, Lang Co beach and the lagoon) as well as stopping at a fishing village. We had the same driver the next day to visit 3 of the emperors tombs. The hotel manager advised us to go in the morning as the majority of the tour buses do the Citadel in the morning and the tombs in the afternoon. He was so right! The first tomb was so peaceful and then it got more and more busy! The manager also booked a private dragon boat trip along the Perfume river down to the Thien Mu pagoda which was well worth a 30 min stop. The boat waited for us and then dropped us off at the Citadel on the way back. Given we only had 1 clear day in Hue that was about the right length for a boat trip and made a nice break in between pagodas and temples! Just be aware however that the boats are usually ran by a family and this is their livelihood, so while on board they will try to sell you some souvenirs and stuff, so take some small notes with you. We ate at the hotel both nights and the food was delicious, especially the banana flower salad and the set menu. No wonder it comes highly recommended on trip Advisor! The restaurant staff couldn't be more helpful or friendly either.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Best thing about this hotel were the friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff. We were welcomed with a cool drink and some fruit, and able to check in early which was definitely needed after a night on the train from Hanoi! The room was spacious with AC and good tv channels. The shower was hot and powerful enough but dated. The laundry service was great value at $2 per kg and back same day. Breakfast was pretty good with a good choice. The hotel restaurant is highly rated for dinner although we didnâ€™t try it. Only other downside is the roadworks outside the front, not the hotelâ€™s fault but became extremely muddy when it rained! Overall really pleased with the hotel and would recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The first impression might fool you, because there is some construction going on in the small alley where the hotel is located. The staff mailed me beforehand to warn me of this, that was very nice of them. They also asked our approximate time of arrival so they could make sure everything was ready for us. Nice gesture!
Check-in was very smooth. They gave us a welcome drink and someone from the staff sat down with us to go over the basic hotel information, surroundings, things to do and see in Hue etc. They also arranged a tour for us which turned out to be awesome.
The room was very big and clean. Good shower, free fruit and water every day, there even was a computer in the room that we could use (but I didn't since I brought my own laptop).
Breakfast was very nice and plentiful. They have a small buffet with fruit, juices and bread. And you can also order warm things from their menu: eggs, toast, pancakes, dumplings, ...

When we left we had to catch the train at the train station. They called a taxi for us but because the taxi couldn't reach the hotel through the small alley that's under construction, one of the bell boys even carried both of our bags to the street!

In conclusion, a very nice hotel tucked away in a small alley, but with some of the nicest people we met on our trip in Vietnam! I totally recommend this hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Despite maintenance happening in the lane right outside the hotel, the staff all did what they could to make it up to us. The hotel was beautifully cleaned and kept in tip top shape. The rooms were lovely and the beds comfortable. We appreciated the complimentary fruit and water every day we were there and loved that breakfast was onsite. Nothing was too difficult for the hotel to sort out if we needed anything and even though it is tucked away in a wee lane, it is still very centrally located. A real hidden gem despite initial misgivings when our driver dropped us off.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This hotel was lovely. The rooms were spacious and had comfy beds. The breakfast was chosen from a menu rather than a buffet which we preferred. The staff were so helpful and polite - special shout out to Mary who helped to organise our transport to Hoi An. If we come back to Hue this will be our first choice of hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a larger trip around Vietnam. I will say I had initial misgivings about the place being dropped at the top of the alleyway it's situated on, as there was fairly extensive work ongoing to pave the alley and other work going on, but once we got to the hotel everything was fine.

The hotel overall was clean and well presented. Beds were comfortable and the rooms were very clean. Breakfast which was included was varied and really good. I opted for the garlic and egg fried rice both mornings, and there were other cold and hot items to help yourself to.

The standout for the hotel is the staff, they're all so helpful and friendly, and everyone we spoke to spoke great English.

Location wise it's a short walk to the river and about a 35 min walk to the citadel.

Based on the staff and the low cost of the rooms, I'd definitely recommend if you're stopping over in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Tucked down a lane in the tourist block of Hue, this is a spacious and well appointed hotel. The best part of staying here though is the care and attention given by the young, informed staff. Nothing is too difficult for them and they will recommend and book itineraryâ€™s to suit your time and needs. Breakfast is a varied and has an expansive range of options with delicious fruit salad and yoghurt. The restaurant attached has some of the best food we tried in Hue, but I will review that separately. Highly recommended
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed 2 nights in the hotel and it was a perfect stay. There is wonderfull staff and we booked all the city of Hue tours (The Imperial City, the Emperors Tombs and boat trip on the river) through the hotel desk who was very efficient (special thanks to Jenny (Linh) for the organization skills). We communicate by e-mail and it was perfectly organized with a 7-seat car (we have 3 kids) and a guide. We had a Family Room on the 2nd floor with an extra bed. The room was clean and quiet and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast was really good with a nice choice: all kind of eggs, fresh fruits and juices, pastries and coffee. The restaurant in the hotel is also very good for lunch or dinner. We recommend this great hotel with lovely people.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The hotel offered clean, spacious, comfortable rooms. The picture you see on this website appears to be the room we had...haha There was a spacious, clean bathroom. They offered some complimentary fruit and water each day. The free breakfast was fantastic! Choice of pho, eggs, bread, fresh fruit, juice, coffee, deli meats and more. I would definitely stay here again if I ever find myself back in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Nice clean comfort rooms, spotless bathroom with a rain shower in a shower cubicle, a fantastic resturant, reasonably priced, generous portions, an excellent buffet beakfast served on the ground floor, very polite and helpful staff with an experience tour desk and english speaking staff.
h_title_comment: Nice hidden place in an alley
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Was at this Hotel in April 2018. I was on a solo trip and wanted to check out the Imperial City. Based on reviews on Trip Advisor, found this hotel.

The location was great. It was close the the night life with 5 minute walk. It is a little hard to find as it is down a narrow alleyway. Absolutely safe, as you walk down the alleyway there are other hotels, hostel and restaurants and tour guide shops. The location offers a quiet and calm atmosphere and a day or so of exploring the city and sights.

The staff was extremely helpful and very nice. Rooms are clean. The bed was very comfortable. There was complimentary water inside the room. The bathroom was very clean. Hot water was not an issue. There was a free wifi. They had in-house laundry service. There was also a mini fridge and a room safe.

The breakfast was included and different options. Vietnamese and Western Style. I had both styles while I was there.

This hotel is just great. Would stay again.

FYI - there was construction on the front of the hotel. They are putting in some water pipes underneath street. However, no issue with noise.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The hotel is nice and its staff very helpful during my short stay. I took a room without view, which is good for a single night (I would have chosen a better room otherwise). The breakfast is great as the lunch I had there - the restaurant is excellent. The street outside is under construction/renovation, so the area looks a bit muddy and dirty - hopefully will look great afterwards.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Peaceful just like the name of the hotel suggests... Serene!. Tucked deep in an alley, the hotel offers a tranquil atmosphere away from the hustle-bustle of Hue. Service staff is very friendly and helpful. They will go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Breakfast is the morning is made to order and not the buffet style.
The hotel is of walking distance to the Perfume River and lots of restaurants.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very nice, large rooms that are comfortable and well decorated. Had a computer available to use in the room which was a nice added convenience. We had a private patio with a fantastic view of the city. Would highly recommend to anyone in Hue. Staff was very helpful and accommodating.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We have recently stayed here for 2 nights and was faultless.
The staff were wonderful and friendly, everywhere was modern, clean and tidy and the breakfast was great.
Everything is walking distance from the hotel and it is down a little quiet road.
I would certainly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The 1st thing when you checked in, the front desk staff genuinely make you very welcome. Had a welcome drink & fruits. They handle everything very professionally & also show you your room personally. They even provide you a map of the place of interest of the city & they also guide you if you have any queries.

You also booked tours & train tickets from them. Basically they trip handled all your needs. The restaurant staff also did a wonderful job. They make sure you really enjoy your meals.

The hotel is also clean & very well maintained.

Lastly I should say that the service went beyond excellence. Thank you for the wonderful stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for one night. The staff speak good English, and are very welcoming ( Especially Mary at reception and Amy in the restaurant).
The room was comfortable and clean.
Recommend eating at the hotel restaurant. We had a delicious lunch.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We and our daughter had two large, very well appointed rooms which were excellent value for money. Staff were very friendly and welcoming and always most helpful. The dining room, though modest, always provided first class food at all times. At present, there is considerable redevelopment in the street where the hotel is located but this is only a temporary, minor hindrance. We were very taken by the appearance of many of the older residences in the street which conveyed an interesting view of the earlier culture of the city.
h_title_comment: Excellent small boutique hotel in quiet street close to the Perfume River
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We had an absolutely lovely stay here. The hotel is very well located in a nice neighborhood in a central part of Hue. It was easy to walk everywhere and cabs were easily available to more distant locations. Most importantly, the staff were fantastic. Everyone doted on us and our kids. The breakfast had lots of great options, local dishes and plenty of wonderful fruit.
h_title_comment: Lovely stay here and perfect location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Stayed here with my wife and 8 year old daughter after getting the sleeper train from Hanoi. Great location (would recommend a taxi from the station rather than walking and didnâ€™t see any rickshaws at the station). Our room was lovely with a great shower and a PC if you wanted to search anything. This was the only hotel that we ate an evening meal in and it was really tasty. The restaurant has really high reviews on trip advisor and I can see why as itâ€™s nice and well priced. The only slight downside was the road outside the hotel was being dug up - only a temporary thing and the hotel made us fully aware before arriving. It didnâ€™t impact on us as work was only during the day whilst we were out. Staff really helpful throughout our stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and had a lovely welcome with fruit and drinks as well as a run through of the map and things to do in Hue.
We arrived early so left our luggage all day until the room was ready. When we came back they had left swans and rose petals on the bed as well as a bottle of complimentary wine. The room was modern, well appointed with a large bath and clean but we had a very close up view of a wall out of the window. The only down point to the room was that i was kept awake by a buzzing air con unit outside the window from next door.
The breakfast was a little disappointing as it was a little sparse - fruit, bread and ham for the buffet or eggs and bacon to order.
The hotel is in an excellent location, very near to the area that has the roads cordoned off for the evening on a Friday and Saturday night. There is a very good range of bars and restaurants in the area.
h_title_comment: Lovely hotel in a great location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: One of the finest Hotel I have stayed in Vietnam. The room is huge and stylish furbished and clean as in an hospital and there was a big selection for breakfast. The staff is really friendly and ready to help you
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We loved our stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel. The staff were very friendly, professional and helpful. The rooms were clean and beds comfortable. The hotel provides a delicious, plentiful breakfast. We were happy we had dinner at the restaurant in the hotel our last night, as the food was delicious and discounted, because were were staying there. Selena, our hostess, was delightful and spoke excellent English, as did a number of the hotel staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The room is quite nice with the old style of Hue. However it looks not really clean. We found the insect on the mattress and ask housekeeping to change it directly
The staff is quite helpful and help us book the transportation come back to Danang. Thanks
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: One of the best hotels I've stayed at in Vietnam, all the staff are lovely and keen for a chat. Lots of roadworks happening outside so first impressions may be a bit rough but please don't let that deter you. Rooms were great, beds were comfy, balcony has amazing views of the city on one side or the river on the other. Special mention to Julia who gave us one of the best welcomes I've ever had at a hotel.
h_title_comment: Fantastic staff, excellent stay, highly recommend
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This is a lovely hotel. The rooms were beautifully appointed with drinks and fruit provided and lovely bathrooms. The food at breakfast was plentiful and well-cooked. The staff were friendly and really helpful. On arrival we had welcome drinks and fruit and the reception staff explained about the city attractions.
I highly recommend the hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Once past the roadworks and on entering the hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised by the standard of the reception area, and even more so by the quality of the room reserved for us. The staff, particularly kelly and Jenny, were very efficient and helpful. Breakfast comprised lots of western and Vietnamese food of good quality. Overall, a very good value for money
h_title_comment: Current Roadworks and mess outside the hotel not at all representative of the high standard of accommodation and staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Really nice hotel in the middle of Hue. Close to the towns best massage clinic. The hotel and restaurant is really nice and the staff is super helpful and friendly! My wife and I spent three nights here on holiday and the staff helped us with tips and recommendations for our stay in Hue. Would like to come back here!
h_title_comment: Went here based on TripAdvisor, and it really paid of!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
