h_content_comment: Great hotel! The people is nice and friendly, the restaurant is so good also. Totally recomended, it is the best choice you can do. The room was big and everything was clean. It takes 15 minutes go walking from the hotel to the downtown.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: the hotel is in small valley but it is not quite in the evening. the staff is friendly and helpful. breakfast is good but the restaurant is not the best one we have in hue. they offer the motobike with a reasonable price. I think it has a great value for the cost.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Perfect attention to details. Loss my phone in the train station in Da Nang and the staff helped to find it and arranged to bring it to Hue within a day! Perfect location, great to be served with a la carte menu at breakfast. There was a minor problem with water pressure in the shower in our top floor room but it was so trivial that I forgot to mention it to reception. Definitely recommend it!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at the Hue Serene Palace for only one night but everything was great. The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed and the staff were friendly and accommodating. I would certainly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This hotel is situated down a small street off a main road so did not have much issue with street noise. The rooms were reasonable and the hotel provides an off menu breakfast as opposed to a buffet. However you are able to order as much and as many items as your heart desires.

Ideally located for trips to Imperial City and excellent at organising taxi and boats for tombs and pagoda.

Don't go passed the restaurant as this is highly rated and highly recommended.

Cannot praise the customer service as 4 hours prior to my scheduled flight an ATM decided to "swallow" my cash card. At 6 pm at night I was pretty resigned to days of trying to get a reissue. The desk staff took control and spoke to local bank branch staff on the phone and within 2 hours my card was returned by the bank staff personally with significant apology.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We really enjoyed the food here, did not expect it to be as good as it was. It's part of a hotel, but we did not feel like we were sitting in a hotel dining area. Staff were very friendly and made great cocktails. I would definitely come here again. Very clean inside
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is so lovely. Air con super, easy access to walk to town and night market, breakfast perfect with as much adult want freshly made for you to order plus toast/ fresh fruit/ juices and lively Vietnamese coffee hot or iced! Couldn't work out shower temperature but 39 degrees outside so tepid was welcome! Even got a sewing pack so could fix a dress!! Laundry service if you need. Welcome drink and fresh fruit on arrival. Definitely recommend
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Good points:
1. The staff are friendly and helpful.
2. The restaurant of the hotel is good. The breakfast gets a wide range of choices. The hotel guest get 10% discount on lunch and dinner where their restaurant is the #1 restaurant on tripadvisor with a reasonable price.
3. The room is big enough and with a balcony.
4. They get a computer for the room.
5. Reasonable priced.

Bad points:
1. There are not enough sockets in the room.
2. The hotel is located in a narrow lane which is not easy to find, but it's okay as most of the taxi drivers know the way to the hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it was comfortable. Upon arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful. We arrived early evening and the staff arranged a tour for us the next day.
The room had 2 queen size beds, and our kids shared one. Unfortunately the bathroom had only been half cleaned but once we told reception they fixed it straight away.
Breakfast was ok, although we only had breakfast in the restaurant we are a little surprised it is rated #1 restaurant in Hue. We recommend that you venture out, there are many delicious restaurants out and about. We had pizza at Zucca, yum and Vietnamese food at the ancient town on the river.
Overall a comfortable 3 star hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: For the price you pay this is an excellent hotel. The staff were great from the minuet we walked in. Provided us with fruit and juice and let us check in early, which was greatly appreciated because we had taken the night train for Hanoi. The room was clean and modern and the wifi and AC worked great. The staff provided us with a lot of helpful information on what to see and the best way to get around. Would definitely recommend Hue Serene Palace.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
- always staff on hand to help - they would go out of their way to help us if we needed. One member of staff even spotted us on the street having communication problems when trying to hire bicycles and came out to help us
- everyone so friendly, especially the brilliant breakfast staff who lightened up every morning
- room was a good size with a huge balcony, bed very comfortable
- excellent value for money

- only minor negative is that our bathroom was a little tired and could do with upgrading
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Do not be mislead by this hotel is allocated in a small road.
Compared to its price it is really good.
The staff is very helpful and the rooms are really good.
Compared to other hotels visited around Vietnam of the same price class, then this is much better.
If ever I come to Hue again, I will for sure chose this hotel
h_title_comment: Excellent hotel - a class of its own
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: My Partner and I stayed here for 3 nights as apart of our tour, the rooms are spacious and welcoming. Breakfast was beautiful, the best we have had anywhere in Vietnam!!. Staff are very kind and even looked after our luggage whilst we went out all day after we checked out.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was extremely good value for money. It was really nice and super cheap. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good and the room was very nice and all clean. We were only there for one night but I'd definitely recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed in this hotel's sister establishments in both Hanoi and Hoi An (also rated at 3 stars) and this was definitely the worst of the three. That's not to say it was bad, just a bit of a let down after the other two. We stayed our first night in a family room, at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor, but there was too much noise from both the karaoke bar next door and from the street. The hotel kindly moved us into two separate rooms on the 6th floor for no extra charge, so top marks for this. The rooms were fine, although the air conditioning in one really struggled to keep the room cool (it was noticeably hotter than the other room, despite being the same size).

Breakfast was ok (but again not as good as the other hotels in this chain) and we didn't mind the location in the narrow laneway - we never felt unsafe and it was pretty well located in the main part of town. We had a bit of a bad end to our stay when the hotel advised us that we'd only need to leave 1.5 hours before our flight and then booked the car for 7pm instead of 7am - we just made our flight. Decent enough hotel for the price, but make sure you ask for a room on a higher floor and towards the back if you're a light sleeper.
h_title_comment: Good 3 star hotel, but not perfect
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We just spent a couple of nights here on our honeymoon. The hotel is clean, comfortable, has all the mod cons and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Their restaurant has really good food and service. It's really close to all the action and a short walk to the river. Definitely worth a stay if you're visiting Hue.

Martin.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel is really above average in every way except for the location ! Ironically, it was the write-up on the location that got me attracted to this hotel. However, in reality, it is located at a very, very small and rather dingy looking alley, pretty far to walk to quite a number of the city's attractions without a guide along side.

Location aside, this is a more than pleasant hotel. The staff are very helpful and would personally bring you to the room to make sure everything is okay. The rooms are well proportioned, beds are very comfortable and overall, very clean. The family room that we booked even had a complimentary desktop computer for usage during our stay.

Breakfast is a combination of simple buffet and preset menu.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We only stayed one night but were very impressed with this hotel. It was clean and comfortable. The rooms were huge and breakfast amazing as you order off a menu. Upon arrival we received a fruit platter and drink. Staff were extremely helpful. Well worth staying if in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was the highlight accommodation on our trip from Hanoi through to Saigon, outdoing even the resort accommodation we had in Hoi An. The service was excellent, room was large, impeccably clean and comfortable. The restaurant on-site (Serene Cuisine) has top class food and outstanding service - prompt, caring and friendly. As mentioned by others, the location down a narrow laneway deceptively hides this jewel of Hue. A wonderful experience.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Had a very good two-night stay at this hotel. Used their extremely inexpensive laundry services and they did a perfect job. Very comfortable, large room complete with personal computer and a balcony. Decent breakfast and good evening meal in the hotel restaurant. This hotel is like an oasis away from the busy streets of Hue. The walk up and down a dark, narrow alley at night to get to and from the hotel might not be for everybody but we had no problem doing it and in no way felt threatened. It made the experience more authentically Vietnamese.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Excellent hotel. Clean.Good value for money. Staff very helpful.Spacious rooms. Down a quiet street which was fine and only short walk to bar street.
Would definitely stay here again.
Breakfast really good. Didn't eat at restaurant at other times although I gather the food is good.We didn't want to eat there cause no atmosphere compared with restaurants in tourist area.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Hard to fault this place with friendly staff ready to help in any way . The rooms were a pleasant surprise and our sons were thrilled to be in such luxury. I like the completely separate ensuite bathrooms that have thick doors. I like the design of the hotel and quiet is placed as a priority. They have special sound proofing and the whole place spells luxury above profit. The restaurant staff were a delight and couldn't be more happy to serve. The food was endless and of top quality with the best fruits, pancakes and egg dishes. I would certainly go again. Deborah Coulthard
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Arrived at the hotel with friends to be greeted by the wonderful and friendly staff. This gem in a narrow alley way is a little haven after a long day and travel. Unlike other hotels, the buffet is amazing and far exceeded our expectations. I was rather badly burnt one day and the staff went out of their way to ensure I was well and gave me directions to a little shop to buy an inexpensive shirt. One of the best hotels I've stayed in in a long time.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I and my family stayed for 2 nights at this hotel on my 2nd wedding anniversary occasion and the decoration for my room was so lovely. It's clean , new and beautiful.
Buffet was amazing, so delicious and fresh.
I love all the staffs here. They are so kind, polite, helpful and friendly. The girls named Jenny, Mary, Scarlet, Julia at the FO are super!
I am satisfied with the service here and definitely come back again.
Highly recommend this hotel to other people.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed for 2 nights here in June on the fifth floor. The rooms were just as shown in the hotel website, spacious clean with the complimentary computer with Internet access. The shower had good water pressure. The beds and pillows are good too. They have a good selection of fruits at breakfast. The breakfast menu is a good start for the day with local as well as bacon sausage egg (cooked to order). do try the fried rice which is fragrant and not oily.
A value for money stay. .
h_title_comment: Hidden Gem in a Narrow Alley
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: A wonderful boutique hotel in a beautiful location close to everything we wanted to see. The staff were incredible as was the food. I really couldn't fault anything about our stay and would recommend this as a great base to see the wonderful town of Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is about 5 minutes from the local restaurants and just the other side of the bridge from the citadel. The staff are very friendly and will quite happily help woth anything you need including booking trips (we didn't book any as was only a night stop over). The rooms are clean and the beds are really comfy! Would reccomend this if your after a comfortable night after staying in hostels!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We absolutely loved this hotel. Everyone, from the reception staff to the porters to the waitresses at breakfast were lovely and welcoming. We were upgraded for free to a city view room as well (not sure why!) and it was lovely. The bathroom was spotless and the room was so comfortable. We actually had a bath for the first time in months, which was such a luxury. Breakfast was great too, you can have as much as you like on the menu. I would definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here only for one night but found everything really pleasant. Even more so because they upgraded our room on arrival! The staff are friendly and eager to help. The hotel is down a narrow lane that is dimly lit at night however we were assured it was safe and experienced no trouble at all
h_title_comment: Very good and a reasonable price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for one night before doing the Hai Van Pass. Staff were so friendly. The room was a good rate for what we got. They upgraded us to one with a balcony too! Ate in a restaurant around the corner as wanted to see the area but the hotel restaurant food has great reviews.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is central - walking distance to the large market, and close to the river. The room is spacious, with air conditioning and kettle and computer with free wifi access. The staff greeted us on arrival with a glass of cold lemonade, a cool clothe and a plate of fruit (even before we checked in).
h_title_comment: Quiet oasis in the hot humid Hue town centre
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Don't be put off by the location of this charming hotel, which is down an alley. We were welcomed with a room upgrade, and friendly staff. The buffet brekky was enjoyable, and the staff were knowledgable and happy to assist with booking tours. They booked us a personal Perfume River cruise on a dragon boat to Thien Mu Pagoda at $10 USD per person, which was quite a bit cheaper than buying tickets from the Marina. Would recommend this hotel, the staff were very helpful and friendly and the location is great - 10 minute walk to Perfume River.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We, 10 people, came visiting Hue in the hottest month of the year. Fortunately we stayed at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel where we could find the coolness from a well air conditioned rooms and wonderful staffs. We are greeted with lot of fruits and water. The bathrooms are clean. The rooms have computer with wifi. The guests can stand on the balcony to look at the street below. The outstanding service of their staffs should be the standard for the traveling industry in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed for 02 nights here.
The pluses included:
1. Efficient staff who speak English well.
2. A clean and well-kept room with a PC.
3. Adequate breakfast with friendly waitresses.
4. Internet was fast and consistent.
5. Good restaurant with fair prices and loads of choices.
But the staff can appear as pushy at times esp when recommending activities (though they were never aggressive) Politeness seemed rather forced than natural at times unlike the waitresses in the restaurant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment: I have stayed here for 2 nights with my friends in 2 rooms. The bell boy who took care of our luggage is great and definitely has some customer service mind. The rest of receptionist staff is ok except one lady when we were checking in she is folding both arms across her chest and sit down while talking to the guests, look not very friendly and professional. We want a late check out because of out late flight and took quite long time for them to handle that too. As a hotelier I couldnt see why that can be a problem. F&B staffs are great. We have Breakfast here and that is good with absolutely delicious fried rice, the way they run it is very effective in the size of the hotel particularly. Room is fine, big and clean with adequate amenities in room. A/C is very good. Very nice bed with soft as cloud pillow. Overall a good hotel but reconsider if you have a late flight or want a late check out.
h_title_comment: Good hotel overall, not so good reception services
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 2 nights and were really glad we did!
The staff were so lovely and helpful, always smiling when they saw us! We got a really warm welcome from
Them when we arrived, even though it was late and they arranged for a taxi to pick us up at the train station!
We are at the restaurant and agin the staff were so friendly!
The room was just what we needed, great air con, amazing bathroom and there was even a computer in there!
The wifi was very good and we couldn't fault the rooms facilities at all!
They arranged a boat trip and a car trip for us and let us pay a bit extra for a late check out which was more than reasonable!
They recommended restaurants for us and always asked about our day!
We did not mention it to the staff, but it was my birthday during our stay! They had noticed in my passport and put out flowers and a cake on the bed for when we got back to the room! Way more than I would expect, it made my day! I really would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Hue, it's a great location and the hotel is great, but the staff really stood out as being brilliant!!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I had a great 2 night stay here. The service was friendly and helpful. The rooms were huge with king bed, personal computer, and modern fixtures. The hotel also happens to have #1 TA rated restaurant in the lobby which was nice. Good value for your money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Pro: Room with a balcony looking over the neighbourhood which had lots of good local restaurants

Con: Overwhelming number of staff who were not particularly well informed other than about the activities they wanted to sell you.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This is a very good quality budget hotel with excellent service and a great restaurant. It's a 10 minute walk from the riverside and 10 minutes by taxi to the citadel.

We stayed in a "serene" room which was extremely spacious and nicely decorated and which had a balcony on the 7th floor with great views over the town. The bathroom was a bit utilitarian compared to the room decor but not a big deal considering the price. The room was actually a lot nicer than I expected for the price so no problem. It was also well kitted out - king size bed, chairs and table in room and chairs on balcony, safe, computer, mini bar, TV etc. There was nothing lacking.

The staff couldn't do enough for us and were extremely helpful. They went out of their way to help with some belongings we forgot at the hotel, putting it on a bus to Hoi An where we were staying for us to collect - all free of charge. Great service!

The hotel restaurant is ranked No 1 on Tripadvisor. We ate there a couple of times and the food was pretty good. You can also get room service. Breakfast was fruit and bread self-service and a large selection of cooked items to order from the menu.

Another plus is laundry at $2 per kilo which is a bit more than outside (which is understandable) but significantly less than the per item charges at most hotels.

My husband had a massage at their sister hotel and said it was the best and the cheapest he had in Vietnam!

Overall an excellent choice, and really good value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We arrived by taxi from the train station and someone immediately came out and got our bags. We were welcomed with a cold watermelon juice and plate of fruit while reception got us checked in. They took us to our room on the 6th floor where we discovered they had upgraded us. A very nice gesture. Our room was large, and very nice. A big screen tv on the wall in front of the bed. A desk with a computer. Two chairs if you don't won't to lounge in bed. A safe. Fridge. Table/place to put one of our backpacks. Robes, flip flops, hair dryer, even a big umbrella. Bed really comfy though the pillows were a bit hard (but no big deal, truly the least of any problems). Staff amazing. Restaurant good. Value for the money excellent. Location pretty good. The only complaint is that if you want to sleep in, when kids start yelling in the hallway, even it it's at a lower level, it echos throughout the floors, it's an open stairwell. This is common. That's why I travel with ear plugs. It wasn't to bad. But I did go out and ask them to quiet down.
h_title_comment: Comfortable Hotel. Excellent Staff. Great Value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was an excellent hotel. We had gotten lost trying to locate the hotel, but once we found it, it was worth looking for! its a little gem! We got a complimentary upgrade, and the room and bathroom were excellent. the hotel oragnised us the tour and the taxi to Hoi An. The staff are friendly and they even ensured my wife's birthday was catered for! I will recommend this hotel in a heart beat
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Two single beds - haven't slept in a single bed for years! Usually hotels have two queen beds in a twin room not two single beds. We had a balcony and they kindly brought up two chairs when we requested seating. The hotel is in a narrow back lane and this made it interesting seeing more of the life of the locals.

Staff told us about a fantastic local restaurant serving the Hue specialty of barbecue pork and broken rice. we went there several times. Also had the green beans with garlic - delicious and cheap food. It's called Thanh Na Restaurant - in the next street parallel to the hotel.
The hotel's included breakfast was fine too and their wifi is secure and reliable. At short notice they organised for a very good and careful driver to take us to the Thien Mu Pagoda and the Khai Dinh and Minh Mang tombs for an afternoon - it was fascinating to see the different styles of each tomb and then wonderful to get back into the airconditioned car between sorties. We had taken a taxi from the hotel to see the Citadel in the morning. You can do it easily by yourself and don't need a guide as there's plenty of information once you get in there and it's really worthwhile to visit. Resist the cyclo drivers at the entrance - all they can do is take you round the outside for an hour (they charge an hour minimum) which is pointless.
h_title_comment: Friendly and helpful staff. Nice Vietnamese food at dinner and good breakfasts
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Thank you Hue Serene hotel. Your staff, hotel facilities, location and price, made our stay most enjoyable. Staff were eager and cooperative, facilities of the hotel Ka key nothing (perhaps except a pool), the location was unbeatable and the price!! Amazing quality for the $.
Thank you once again and we can't recommend the Hue Serene Hotel enough. Excellent value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed for 2 nights at the Serene Palace and were very satisfied by the quality of accommodation and service from the staff. The room was a good size with nice fittings, free fruit and computer. The bathroom at first glance was of a high spec however on closer inspection some of the finishes were a little shabby, however for the price paid this can be easily overlooked and didn't detract from our stay.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. Special mention must go to Sally and Kate in the restaurant who went above and beyond.

Breakfast was excellent, lots of gorgeous fresh fruit and crusty bread. You can also have as much as you want from the menu.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had a great stay at Serene Palace. It is well located although down a back laneway. The breakfast was great, all freshly prepared to order. The staff are super friendly, nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely stay here again.
h_title_comment: Great hotel with friendly, helpful staff.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed 2 days at Serene Palace Hotel and the hotel was one of the reason that we didn't want to go out so much. The hotel is clean and tidy, good services, friendly staffs, fresh environment and comfortable room. Just stayed in the room and we could satisfy with our choice. We can feel the hospitality and conscientious from the staffs. They helped our trip was more memorable and romantic. Best choice in Hue city. Absolutely come back the hotel next time.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This place really deserves 5 stars for the quality and cleanliness of the rooms and offering a 5 star room at backpackers price. Breakfast was good.

We didn't much like the location, we also found the balcony unfurnished and unusable.
The restaurant lacked atmosphere. The food was OK and reasonably priced. We never found a good restaurant in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stay there one night with family on the way back home. The stay was excellent with welcomw drink, good food menu. Room was spacious and clean. Staff was helpful, services was great...definitely my choice when back to town.
h_title_comment: Great stay, clean and quiet room, great services
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Our family of 5 spent one night at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel in May 2016. It is a bit tricky to find as it is down a small street but you will be impressed with the quality of the service. The staff were very helpful in arranging our transport from Hoi An to Hue and booking a tour of the Thien Mu Pagoda, Royal Citadel and tombs. All of the staff spoke English quite well. When we arrived, we were welcomed with a drink and fruit. The wait staff, especially Kate, were amazing at both dinner and breakfast. It is worthwhile to point out that the hotel's restaurant, Serene Cuisine, is the top-rated restaurant in Hue. It is not much for appearances but the food is very delicious. For dinner, we enjoyed the set menu which included pomelo salad, banh beo, crispy rolls, bun bo Hue and skewers. To top everything off, the hotel held our luggage after check-out before we caught our evening flight to Hanoi. The only negative comments I have are in regards to the room size (a bit on the small side) and the bathroom seemed a bit dated (very minor). We would definitely return again in the future.
h_title_comment: Fantastic Hotel at a Great Price!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Excellent hotel, great location and free wifi. We were provided a room on the top floor (Level 8) with a balcony, great size, clean and plenty of hot water. Staff were lovely, happy to answer all our questions about Hue, and the restaurant downstairs was brilliant, food was fresh and not expensive, recommend trying the local Hue specialties. No doubt will be back here again.
h_title_comment: Great place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We arrived on foot from the bus stop (bus from Hoi An to Hanoi). It's on a small alley that makes it complicated to find at first. The place is super clean, we had a huge bed, a very quiet room and the staff was really helpfull with everything ee asked them for. Breakfast was really good with a lot of fresh juices and fruits. I will certainly go back.
h_title_comment: Great place and very helpfull staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Friendly English speaking staff. The rooms were large and clean. The restaurant and spa were nice. We booked a late pick-up from thr train station with no problems. I was very happy with this hotel and would stay here again.
h_title_comment: Nice hotel at a good price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed here for two nights in a Deluxe Cityview room. Finding the place was a little difficult as it is down a very small side street, but When we arrived staff were friendly and helpful, providing us with a welcome drink and fresh fruit while we checked in. The room was great, big, clean, well decorated with a fantastic view over Hue. Staff were always outstanding, and the food in the restaurant downstairs was excellent and we received a 10% discount (restaurant reviewed separately). The hotel is quiet but very close to the riverfront and its bars and restaurants, and a 20 minute/half an hour stroll to the Citadel. We would definitely stay here again if we were in Hue, and would recommend to anyone looking for a good value hotel in a great location.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The rooms are immaculate and the bed was wonderfully comfortable. Not fancy but met our needs perfectly. Staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant was nice for breakfast --lots of good fruit and I decided the vegetarian noodle soup makes a great breakfast--but the coffee was weak and not very good. Dinner at the restaurant was fine, but definitely did not deserve the top rating in Hue--in fact it was the worst of the 4 restaurants we tried in Hue.
h_title_comment: Clean and quiet with very helpful staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The highly competent staff and the clean, comfortable and modern accommodation have allowed us to enjoy some of the best of Hue in our short time. Congrats and thankyou to all the staff in the hotel and high quality restaurant, well done.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Amazing hotel, large room with very comfortable bed.
Flat screen and movie channels and large bathroom.
Even had a computer in the room

Buffet breakfast was very good as was dinner in the restaurant.

Staff were excellent. Very good service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We stayed 2 nights and this would be the best hotel I've stayed in with regards to the friendliness of all the staff. We ate our dinners in the restaurant and were treated very specially while enjoying delicious food. Thanks to Sarah, Sally and Nhi for their excellent service in the restaurant during breakfast and dinner. On arrival we were given fresh fruit juice and fresh fruit and when we were personally shown to our room there was more complimentary fruit waiting along with water and tea and coffee. The front desk arranged for a car to take us to the kings tombs and the Japanese bridge. We were collected from the hotel and could of been returned to the hotel but wanted to be dropped at a different location. This cost US $40. When we were collected by the car after check out to go to the airport, the receptionist and 2 door attendants stood out the front and waved us good bye and the dining staff were in the background also waving. The 2 young door attendants always greeted us with a warm smile.
We highly recommend this hotel from the exceptional service we received.
Thank you to all of the staff for an enjoyable stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for 2 nights and our room was great. Had 2 double beds which were incredibly comfy, a desktop computer, tv and a good clean bathroom with a big shower. The staff were helpful and breakfast was nice. We used the airport transfer to pick us up when we arrived in Hue and we also had help to organise a private car to take us from Hue to Hoi An. Very pleased with this place and would definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: After a pleasant stay at the hotel with a great service, the hotel made a mistake bringing our luggage to another hotel. The manager interfered immediately solving it in a hurry and to full satisfaction. Indeed a service out of the ordinary.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My partner and I both really enjoyed our stay here. The staff are friendly and helpful giving good advice and tips on what to do. They helped with phone calls and booking a taxi to the airport for a reasonable price. The breakfast is good and they're happy to give you seconds if you want it. The hotel is clean and tidy with a welcome drink and fruit plate on arrival. The room was spacious and clean and was services everyday. It's in a good location too as its not too far to walk into town with plenty of places en route to eat and drink. The citadel is across the river from here and is about 30 minutes walking but it's a pleasant walk and worth it. Lots of shops and stalls to have a look at nearby as well. If I came back to Hue I would be happy to stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Shortly after booking the stay we received an email from the hotel offering to arrange a taxi ride from the train station for $4. This may have been slightly higher than the market rate, but it was worth not having to try to figure out transportation on arrival.

We arrived early, so the room was not ready yet, but during our 30 minute wait the staff brought us a delicious fruit plate and gave us a quick run-down on what to do around the city. We decided to hire a car for the afternoon to go to the citadel, the tombs, and the pagoda ($40).

The staff then showed us to our room which they had upgraded from Superior to City View at no extra charge. The room was very nice with faux-wood floors, clean bedding, and complimentary fruit and water. The air conditioner worked great, and the hot water was searing hot--so be careful about just jumping into the shower! The room had a view over the entire city.

After the tour, we decided to eat dinner at the hotel's restaurant. Again, the staff was extremely professional and helpful the entire time, and dinner was somewhat expensive ($20 for 2 people) but delicious. The included breakfast the next morning was also delicious with exotic fresh fruit and both western and local hot dishes.

As far as negatives go, there were only a few: this hotel is somewhat hidden away in a back alley and is not in the middle of everything. The prices are slightly higher than most of the rest of the area (but they make up for the higher prices with outstanding service). This is another hotel that requires you to turn off electricity to your room while you're away and let your room get hot and humid (though this is standard practice in Vietnamese hotels, changing that one feature would make any room worth at least a few dollars a night more).

Overall, this hotel is wonderful and I would stay here again.
h_title_comment: Friendly and Professional Hidden Gem in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was a very pleasant experience. We booked the hotel pick up from Hoi An and our driver was very nice, stopping at various points during the drive to let us take pictures and telling us the history behind each place. Our room was very spacious and clean. The breakfast was great and we even ate at the restaurant for dinner once as it is rated as the top restaurant in Hue. The food was nice and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Good location, great staff and service - would definitely stay there again.
h_title_comment: Pleasant stay with very nice staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Very friendly staff, good food and location is handy. Would stay here again. Dont be put off by the fact it is down a sidestreet. Room was very large and comfortable. No complaints and very good value for money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Sorry we only had 1 night in Hue....this hotel was lovely..we were greeted on arrival with lovely fruit & a drink.....staff were excellent ....thanks for the lovely stay ....at reception, Mary recommended the Forbidden palace , we loved that!!! It could take hours and is a must see!! ...we would recommend the serene palace to anyone....great place stay longer in Hue if you can!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: They helped us plan a wonderful tour around Hue to see the sights. The room that we booked was perfect and the beds were super comfortable. I definitely recommend anyone visit in Hue to stay here. The service and professionalism of the hotel was really impressive.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I arrived very early in the morning at 7, the staff was very helpful and already checked me in even though I could not yet use the room. So, I went for some coffee and when I came back at 9 everything was prepared and my luggage brought up to the room. I also received an upgrade for the room because there was a mistake with the booking. In some rooms they have PC working stations which I found quite useful. Breakfast is delicious as well as the other food they prepare for lunch and dinner.
Further the staff booked my bus ticket to Hoi An and made my appointment at the spa which worked out very well. I can only recommend this place to everyone who will visit Hue.
h_title_comment: Excellent hotel, would deserve rather 4 than 3 stars
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: My husband and I spent 4 days here and were pleased with our stay. The staff were courteous and helpful, sadly during our stay I became ill and they were very quick to offer to contact their doctor on call instead of me having to go to hospital. The doctor arrived within 20 minutes and was very professional and got me sorted out. Rooms are nice and spacious and our room had a nice balcony with 2 chairs and a table. The rooms each have a PC which is handy even though the computer could be a little slow at times but it was convenient having that in the room. Breakfast was very nice and we also ate one supper in the restaurant the the food was wonderful. The hotel is in a great location, about a 5 minute walk to the river and numerous restaurants, coffee shops and cafes. If we ever go back to Hue again I'd be very happy to stay here again.
h_title_comment: Nice hotel in a good location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I love to stay here, mainly because of the great staff. We love the restaurant, Sally the manager does such a wonderful job, all the girls work well together which really comes across to us, as everyone is happy, friendly and give wonderful service. Nothing is too much trouble for them. Julia on reception was very helpful and kind, made our stay here very pleasant. Food is great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Very clean and nice hotel with fantastic staff. There is a good restaurant on site. Breakfast was the best we have had in Vietnam (comparing with the three other places we have stayed at). Rooms were spacious and very clean.

When we checked out the bill was presented to us in USD which was a bit odd and we would have preferred to have it in the local currency. The staff tried to talk us out of getting a Taxi to one of the tombs saying that it might be difficult getting one back to town. It turned out it was no problem. We just agreed on a time to be picked up and another Taxi was there waiting for us. The previous day the Taxi just waited for us while we visites the tomb. We only saw one Tomb per day since we had an infant with us and using a Mai Linh Taxi instead of the hotel car service turned out to be 30% cheaper.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Stayed four nights and used it as a base to explore Hue. Staff were exceptional 24/7. Went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed at any time. Breakfast a highlight for at least one of us!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had the best stay in this hotel, during our trip in vietnam. The staff was so amazing friendly and helpful. Also the breakfast was more than great - various fresh fruits and good coffee.

The room was very clean and gorgeous.
I will come back for sure to this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Outstanding customer service and good value of money. comfortable room was big & clean. We had our breakfast and lunch at the hotel restaurant, the food taste delicious and variety of choices.
It is hard to find something wrong about Serene Palace Hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This is a great hotel to stay in, cannot recommend enough, for the price we pay. The two of us requested twin beds ad hoc and got upgraded to a family suite. Staff is always friendly, especially the morning breakfast staff. Breakfast has free selection of Pho, fried rice, bacon and eggs and you can order as much as you like off menu, on top of buffet spread. We had a dinner there and wanted to go again. The receptionists helped us organise a taxi that brought us to diff remainimg places on e second day after we had a day of tour. Thank you for everything.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Another great stay, nothing fancy but nothing missing, close enough to the Imperial Palace (10 min by taxi) and to the city center (10 min walking) but in a quiet secluded small side street. Rooms are nice and clean, newly refurbished it looked. Very nice staff, very helpful with booking a trip to see the tombs, organizing taxis and our onward trip.

The restaurant is very good, we probably had some of our best food in our entire 15 day trip there. (we arrived at 12pm and the rooms were not ready so we went there for lunch and decided to have dinner there on the second day which we hardly every do, normally always go out to experience the city).
h_title_comment: Great little hotel, good restaurant as well
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Stayed for 5 nights in April 2016 as a couple

Pros:
- Outstanding Customer Service
- Great Value for Money
- Large, Clean, Comfortable Rooms
- Excellent WiFi

Cons:
- Location can be off-putting at first
- Single elevator can mean long waits (it's only 7 floors or so, stairs aren't a big issue)

It's very hard to find something wrong with the Serene Palace. From the moment we booked the staff was working hard to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. When we first booked, a hotel staff member emailed us within a few minutes to see if there was anything they could do to make our stay more enjoyable, and to arrange transportation.
We arranged an airport pickup, and the driver was there with a sign and a clean modern car.

The saying "don't judge a book by it's cover" is perhaps never more applicable than when arriving at the Hue Serene Palace. We were a bit skeptical as the driver pulled into a small narrow alleyway. But fear not, to our surprise the entrance was clean and modern and we were greeted by 2 bellboys. The hotel staff then asked us to sit down and arranged our check-in while more staff brought us cold juice and fruit. Check-in was quick and efficient and we were soon brought to our room.

Rooms: The rooms are huge, even by western standards. The rooms have a large comfortable bed, seating area, ours even had a small balcony perfect to enjoy a coffee on after a long day of exploring. The AC worked well and quickly cooled down the rooms. Shower had high pressure and hot water. The wifi worked very well. The TV worked great and had a selection of western channels. The one oddity was that the rooms utilize an actual key (something I haven't seen in awhile in a hotel), instead of keycards. It isn't a problem at all, just an observation. The rooms were quiet and we never heard other guests. Rooms were cleaned daily by an incredibly kind and responsive housekeeping staff. The rooms also had a computer, which was handy to write emails back home and for checking out tours and attractions. The rooms are nearly apartment sized, and come with nearly everything you could need.

Breakfast: While I have separately reviewed the restaurant (we ate there many times) the included breakfast is really good. Service is impeccable and the staff is incredible responsive. They have typical western as well as Vietnamese options. There are also smoothie and other beverage options. It isn't a buffet style but instead a menu, and the staff want to make sure you're full and satisfied. There were numerous bread and fruit options.

Location and Property: As other reviewers have mentioned the hotel is located in an alley, which is off-putting at first. However, once you explore a little you realize the alley is only about 100 meters long, and is quite busy. The alley is also fairly well lit, and we never felt unsafe. The property itself is well-maintained and clean. The only issue I had was with the elevator, there is only 1 and at peak times (in the AM) it can be busy. That being said the hotel is only 7 floors, so it isn't the biggest pain to climb the stairs, but if you've got mobility issues it could be a problem.

The hotel is centrally located. The backpackers/bar district is about 5 minutes away on foot. The Citadel is about a 10 minute drive (35 minute walk). There is a night market about 15 minutes away on foot that sells souvenirs and has a few restaurants. Location is very central for exploring everything Hue has to offer.

Staff: The staff here are the real standout. Everyone was genuinely concerned that we enjoyed every aspect of our stay. The staff was among the kindest people we met in Vietnam. Jenny and Sally were both amazing and went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed our time. Staff all spoke great English, and seemed genuinely interested in our enjoyment and also what we thought of Vietnam and Hue. They took pride in their hotel and their jobs, and this translated into a fantastic experience. The staff here provided better service than any I've ever had.

Conclusion: Don't let the alley way affect your decision, this is a fantastic choice and truly deserving of a 5 star rating. Amazing value for money.

Room and Hotel Tips:
- If you're planning on doing laundry while visiting Vietnam I'd suggest getting it done here. The cost was very reasonable (2USD per kilo) and they did a great job, they did not damage, lose, or shrink any of my clothes.
- We organized multiple excursions through the hotel and were satisfied with each one. We did the following:
- Private car to the beach (Beach Bar) (US $28)
- Private car to Minh Manh and Khai Dinh tomb, and the pagoda (US $32)
- Private car to Hoi An (US $60)
- While other agencies will offer tours for a lower price, we weren't sure if they would be trustworthy or if the cars would be modern or shared. We stuck with the hotel and we always had modern safe cars and the drivers were quite punctual. I'd highly recommend booking transport with the hotel.
- Leave the bulky key with the front desk
h_title_comment: Look no further, you SHOULD stay here
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is located in a small alley but well worth looking for. The staff were wonderful making sure all was well for us, very helpful. The room was a city deluxe view, big and very clean. We used the laundry service and got our clothes the following day. Definitely recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was definitely a great find. It's in a back street so road noise is minimal. Staff were welcoming and helpful. Were given a welcoming drink and registration at a dining room table. They expedited our room preparation which was great. Would stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed here for 2 nights. The location and rooms are great, restaurant is very good, and overall great value for what we were paying. I would recommend this place for tourists in Hue. There is a motorbike rental just opposite the restaurant, which makes it very convenient for conveyance within Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed in a serene room which has a generous balcony and has good views over the city of Hue.
The room was very clean and spacious as was the bathroom, and the bed was huge.
The staff here were extremely friendly and certainly took an interest in their gusts, especially the restaurant staff who made my wife herbal teas when she had taken ill.
The restaurant breakfast has a small buffet for cereals, breads and fruits with an a la carte menu aswell. We had dinner here one night as well which was excellent value for money.
We would certainly stay here again if we were to return to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed for two nights to tour the palaces. Paid a little extra more for the nicer room. The room was on the top floor. It was clean and had a great view of the city. The staff was very helpful and spoke English. Very comfy beds.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
After arriving at a hotel we booked and did not get what we paid for
We needed urgent help
This hotel made such a plan to get us in
Staff very friend rooms were clean and spacious
Lovely view of the river, very relaxing too lying in bed listening to a storm out side
I will recommend to ppl
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our stay at the Serene Palace Hotel began with our welcoming flowers and decorations on the bed to celebrate our Anniversary. Lovely friendly management staff. A very clean and quiet hotel with great views over Hue. The restaurant served some delicious food.
h_title_comment: A lovely place to stay ---down a very narrow alley.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I brought my Group to this hotel and everyone was very pleased. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Great Views, very nice showers, wonderful food and a very nice and helpful staff. I couldn't have enjoyed it more. I'd highly recommend this place.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment:
During a two-week backpacking journey from northern Vietnam to central, Hue Serene Palace was probably the best value and our favorite hotel.

Honestly, as our cab pulled into the tiny alley that the hotel is located on, we were a bit skeptical. Even upon entering the lobby, which was empty at the time of our arrival, we were a bit hesitant. But from the moment we sat down, we were sold.

We were greeted with juice and fruit and told our room would be ready shortly. During that time one of the receptionists (whose English was great), provided us with a map of Hue and showed us what we could do in a day.

We stayed one night in a twin room. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The beds were comfortable and clean, the bathroom was clean and spacious, and there was a desktop computer hooked up to the internet for use. We noticed that the tv in our room was also equipped with Chromecast, which was pretty awesome. We were able to hook up our music to the tv and relax.

The hotel is only a 10-minute cab ride from the Hue train station, a 30-minute walk from the Imperial City, maybe 10-15 minutes from the night market/river, and very near the bar street.

The restaurant downstairs at the hotel is also excellent and very well-priced. Breakfast was included in our room fee. The breakfast menu includes both local and Western options. I had the crepes, which weren't bad and my friend had the chicken pho, which was pretty good. There is also a fruit buffet. We opted to also eat at the restaurant for dinner and were very pleasantly surprised. Hotel patrons get a 10% discount at the restaurant.

Overall, I would definitely recommend Hue Serene Palace. The price for what you get makes it an incredible deal.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
When sitting in a transfer and you drive up a narrow alley that looks like it's leading to a dodgy zone- don't be afraid! You're led to a lovely hotel with bell boys and staff at your every disposal.
They were kind, courteous. Fruit and juice upon arrival, and quick to prepare our room when they'd learnt we had been on an overnight train. Sat down to explain your options and guides. Took all luggage to our room.
Restaurant on site is helpful- especially when a thunder storm blows through town. Food is hearty and tasty.
Our private tour organised by the hotel (40usd pp) was good- although suffice to say if you're a larger person you will potentially be insulted.
I spent a good 30 mins over the 6hr tour being insulted by the guide. Telling me that it's not healthy to be fat, I should be vegetarian, I cannot be married as no man wants me if I'm fat.
Now little does she know, (even though I tried to explain ) that 80% of diet is vegetarian and I exercise all the time. Later in the tour when she looks tired and bored- she asked if I was tired, that I may drop dead! After explaining that I work a very physical 12-14hr day in London every day- she shut up and kept her thoughts to herself.
The information and lunch was very helpful, and I did enjoy it. Just not the additional comments. Just beware.
h_title_comment: Don't misjudge as you drive up
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
My friend and I did a two week tour of north and central Vietnam, and the Hue Serene Palace was our favorite hotel. The rooms were spacious, clean, quiet, and comfortable. The beds were amazing.

We noticed that the hotel restaurant was also listed as one of the top restaurants in Hue by Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed.

Everyone who worked at the hotel was attentive, polite, nice, and accommodating. The staff made us feel at home from the moment we arrived to the moment we left.

The only (very minor) drawback I can think of is that the hotel is located in a somewhat narrow alleyway. The hotel itself is large and spacious, so don't be off put by the alleyway.

In addition to being the best hotel on our two Vietnam trip, it was also among the least expensive. Would totally recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We spent just one night at this lovely hotel and I can say without reservation that it is the best value accommodation and food we enjoyed thus far in SEA.

Everything about the hotel was perfect for our needs. The staff are all excellent, very helpful and nothing is too much trouble for them.

Unhesitatingly I would book to stay here again and would highly recommend to any prospective traveller looking for great value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Down a side street you will be surprised when you enter this nicely renovated hotel with a fabulous restaurant. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and quiet. They also have a computer in the room with free Wi Fi, a real bonus. Did a great job of arranging our tour and transfer to Hoi An in a private car and at a very reasonable price. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating and always had a smile on their face. Would definitely recommend this hotel as a place to stay and eat in Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed at Hue Serene Palace for one night. Huge and comfortable room, modern hotel, good location and excellent service. The staff was very helpful and organised a car to Hoi An for us. The restaurant has great food! We had 5 different delicious Vietnamese dishes.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The room was clean, spacious and comfortable with 2 double beds. It had a desktop computer with internet connection which was a big plus. Bathroom was clean and well stocked. AC worked well. Service was excellent. Very nice, polite, helpful and smiling staff.

The breakfast is complimentary but not in buffet style. One must order items from set menu. Omelette and PHO soup were particularly good.

The only small drawback, if it can be called so, I suppose is the hotel is situated on a narrow ally and does not offer any great view.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: a really nice hotel, good location, very large and comfortable room for a small price! the hotel organised several tours for us to see the sights which were good. they let us store our luggage and even let us take showers before we went on our night train in the evening. we very much enjoyed our stay, they really went the extra mile.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We absolutely loved this place. Great location, awesome room, clean and tidy with all the amenities. Breakfast was to die for, unreal. Location is very good too, in a quiet alley but still central. Staff were awesome, always smiling and very helpful. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Friendly and helpful staff who helps to arrange our trip in details way before our arrival, including booking of restaurant and spa.
Rooms are large and clean.
Had dinner at their restaurant on the G/F. Outstanding!
Maybe a bit difficult to find the hotel if you are arriving late as it is located in a narrow street.
Overall speaking, we enjoyed our stay a lot!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great hotel with very friendly and helpful staff, in particular Mary at the front desk. We were welcomed with lovely fresh fruit juice and fruit plate and they had are room ready even though we were arriving early in the morning from the overnight train. Lovely big room and comfortable bed. We had a meal at the restaurant, as we had seen on TA it is number 1 restaurant in Hue. Beautiful meal and staff so friendly. They also arranged a last minute tour for us to the tombs with their driver.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Hue serene place is a fairly good hotel that is close to the main area,15 min walk and has everything that you want except a pool.Breakfast is by picking some thing off the menu and also has self serve area inc coffee, fruit and toast etc.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
In short - Perfect hotel in all aspects: location, service, breakfast, restaurant. Whatever help we needed, we just had to ask and they helped us immediately. With this hotel you will definitely make the best choice!

We will definitely come back again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Very nice hotel, position down the lane, quirky, but once inside brilliant. Once again staff very attentive and our rooms on the top floor were well equiped the own pc, not necessary as free Wi-Fi was adequate. Good views on a clear day, ours was misty. Very central and close to most places. Citadel via Taxi $2 and well worth the visit, lots of history. Hotel well placed for backpacker priced restaurants, so good food and cheap!
Rooms very well equipped with all you need. Recommended
h_title_comment: Value for Money (when you find it)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Nice hotel down a lane (which taxis can get down) approx 100 metres from a main road. However do not let this put you off. The rooms are nice. The restaurant food is very good especially the set menu. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was our best accommodation in a city in Asia within seven month. The hotel is in a very small road and its mostly quiet. The staff is outstanding. Everybody is so nice, friendly and welcoming. It really feels like being someone special. They are all so considerate and helpful. They showed us all important sites on a map and explained prices and routes. They also booked a very good tour to Bach ma national park for us and scooters and bicycles when we asked for it. The rooms are spacious and well kept and cleaned. The beds are comfortable. The breakfast is like paradise. There are allways eight different kinds of fruits and three kinds of fresh juices. All the other asian and western dishes you can choose from a menu and it will be prepared freshly. You can eat and drink as much as you like. Also the dinner was very good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The only time I had a similar quality of service was in Thailand in a 5 star resort. This is a 2 star and he cost is 24$ per night. Amazing people!
Great room, great breakfast, good location. There is noting to say apart from if you go to Hue stay there, you won't regret it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This stay started with a warm welcome in the lobby including free drink and fresh fruit plate.Clean room, great price and value. Fantastic food in the Hotel restaurant. Breakfast a la carte + good selection of juice and fruits from the buffet. We had a balcony too but without table or chair. Free fruit and cooffe/tea in the room on the first day.
We are sad that we had to leave after only one night. We told the staff we are leaving via sleeper train overnight the wished us a good and safe journey and have surprised us with a lovely food bag for our journey. The staff is a highlight in this Hotel and was always helpful and communicative, we even got free ginger tea due our cold/sickness. We are happy that we decided to go here an would totally recommend everyone to stay there.
h_title_comment: Search no more - you have found your hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Greeted by a warm welcome from the staff and a welcome drink. Quickly checked in to our big modern room. Clean bathroom. Provided with a detailed map of the city and an explanation of the best way to get to the citadel and surrounding tombs and pagodas. Staff at the front desk were super helpful in giving us recommendations on hotels to stay at in Hanoi and recommendations on Halong Bay cruises. They also helped us book our bus tickets to Hanoi. Big selection of breakfast items. The hotel restaurant is ranked number 1 on TripAdvisor for places to eat in Hue and is definitely worth a visit.

Great stay!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent one night in this hotel, our room was very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful and kind. They took care of a daytrip for us and we could use all the facilitites on our last day after check-out since we left later in the day. The breakfast was good, not as extensive as some other hotels but good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent one night the hotel like the restaurant was a lovely hotel we had a spacious clean comfortable room close to the river we found a great local market crossing to the other side of the river we found a few good things to bring home. Staff were exceptionally helpful & friendly even when we were having breakfast they would ask if we were enjoying our stay found this hotel very welcoming.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
- good breakfast (rather than the buffet that can sometimes be chaotic here you order from the menu and the friendly staff deliver to you - except the fruits and toast which you pick yourself)
- good location in walking distance from Citadel area
- staff helpful to arrange transport (we used private car to visit the attractions and hotel arranged at reasonable rates)
- large room, plenty of space, good wifi
h_title_comment: Good value, large room - friendly and helpful staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
One of the best hotels we've ever been to. We got fresh fruits and a welcome drink when we arrived.
The room was absolutly clean, very big and very good furnished.

Our feedback:
Great service.
Big,comfortable and very clean rooms! Awesome breakfast!!! And really friendly staff!
It was a great stay,We will definitly come back.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very friendly, English speaking staff. Hotel set in a quiet side street, but very close to restaurants and the river. Spacious room and bathroom, very clean. Excellent in-room wifi connection. No-smoking enforced throughout the hotel premises. Good breakfast selection. Helpful with transportation arrangements and familiarizing you with the city points of interest etc. Even though a 3 star hotel I'd say it classifies as a 5 star in that category. I'd stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is located in a quiet little street, and is in close walking distance(a couple of minutes) to lots of restaurants and the river. The citadel is about an easy 30 minute walk.The rooms are large, very clean with good bathrooms and are very good value for money. We had a room on the top floor with a large balcony looking across the whole town for only $US50 including breakfast.The hotel can arrange a good car transfer service to and from Da Nang or Hoi An .Recommended for a stay in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Great hotel - we stayed on the 7th floor and and had a room with a balcony - it was lovely - the view over Hue wasnt as scenic as some of our hotel views - but lovely to wake up to all the same and feel the sun on you!!
The room had everything we needed and the bed was extremely comfy!!
There was a jet bath, but we never used it - the bathroom was nice and spacious.
The hotel was down a small side street, which was very dark when coming home late, but we didn't feel unsafe at any point. In regards to location - it was a short walk from the bridge to go over to the citadel - perfect.
If we ever return to Hue we would definitely stay at this hotel again.
h_title_comment: Great stay in a lovely hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Spent a night in Serene Palace as part of our 2 week Vietnam odyssey.

Really nice hotel and well situated for the local eateries. It was the only hotel we had during our stay in Vietnam with a balcony so it was really great to sit out after a long day of tours and watch the sun go down over a couple of drinks.

We also dined at their restaurant which was really good and would recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Difficult to find as down a small alleyway - the trip advisor location is incorrect. Ask people for directions, the sign to go in is very small. The restaurant is set within a hotel and well presented, clean and well lit. Staff were very polite and spoke good English. We ordered the set menu, 4 courses for 279,000vnd for 2 people. Food was ok, we have travelled for a week and eaten better at local restaurants. It seems this was targeted at western guests. However good value for money none the less. We also got 10% discount!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Hue Serene Palace. The staff here provide excellent service.

We stayed with them during our honeymoon - they went above and beyond, organising drivers, providing flowers and cake on arrival. They really make our stay in Hue a fantastic experience.

Additionally, the hotel, particularly the staff service, represents serious value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Booked directly with hotel. We had scheduled airport pickup and that went smoothly. We stayed 3 nights in room 702. Room was spacious with a nice balcony. Breakfast was nice. They had a fruit bar and then you ordered off of the menu. We were leaving by train on our last day to our next destination and they presented us with a bag of fruit for our journey. This was a great value!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Again - and I feel like I'm becoming a broken record here - the staff at this hotel, like in the rest of Vietnam, were amazing. Great help for arranging travel to the sites in Hue, friendly and spoke English with ease.

The room itself had a comfortable, large bed with two duvets for the night-time blanket fighters out there, although it needed a little bit of touching up to be considered as stellar as the staff.

Great location for walking to Citadel (about 30 mins) and good if you want to have drinks with backpackers, as the backpacker district is a short walk away. And the food downstairs was awesome.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed 2 nights. Excellent ,Really Friendly ,Helpful Staff. Throughout the hotel. from doorman to housekeeping ,restaurant to front desk. Especially Scarlette. THANK YOU ALL VERY MUCH NITA AND LIBBY XX
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Good size modern rooms. Very friendly staff can arrange any tours and are helpful. Down a small local alley, but quiet and only a short walk to main street of town. Breakfast is free and good. For quality of rooms, location, and value this is a good choice.
h_title_comment: Good modern rooms and good value
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We were really surprised by this hotel as the approach through the narrow allies was a little inauspicious, but very Vietnam. The hotel was a lovely surprise with spacious clean rooms and very helpful and welcoming staff.There was a laptop in the room and a little balcony.Breakfast was pretty good, again the staff were lovely.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Excellent, helpful staff. Welcome drink on arrival..
Good breakfast, clean and quiet room. They arranged taxi pick up at train station, taxi to airport and driver to take us to temples.
You couldn't ask for more.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I've there for 2 nights, from the start, i was welcomed by bellman, receptionist and check in time is quickly. Dont have buffet but it has set menu and you can order what you want without limit. Room is clean and spacious. Have a computer in your room but it's slow. By the way the room rate is reasonable for such this service!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
A lovely small hotel in Hue, within easy walking distance to lots of restaurants and bars.
We had booked a pick up from the airport and was very glad to see our driver on arrival at the airport.
When we drove into the alley where the hotel is my husband was slightly concerned asking where have you booked! But it was all good, staff where excellent, rooms clean and a good size - we had booked a city view which also had a balcony.
A bit of noise from guests locking and unlocking their rooms, hubby commented it sounded like locking cell doors in a prison, but that was a slight over exaggeration.
We booked a trip through the hotel, boat out to the pagoda and private car out to 2 tombs which cost us USD45, probably could have got cheaper elsewhere but with only 2 days in the city it was easy to arrange. The car was a new 4x4 which was very comfortable on a very hot day.
We ate at the restaurant which is number 1 in Hue on TripAdvisor and I can understand why.
I used the spa at the sister hotel 5 minutes away which was also extremely good.
I would highly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stopped here for 4 nights while visiting Hue.
The hotel is well situated - a little walk to all the main restaurants and river, but close enough for it to only be a 5 minute walk!
There are lots of coffee shops around, and some street food places to try.

The staff were fine, no problems. My wife was ill during our stay and they promptly called their doctor on call, who arrived and sorted everything out quickly and professionally.

Breakfast was fine, we also ate at the restaurant as it is the number one restaurant in Hue and it was very good!

There was also a PC in our room, but it was very slow and had some issues...

All in all, I would stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My husband and I spent two nights at the Serene Palace Hotel and had a wonderful stay. From the very start, we were greeted warmly by the staff and given a lovely tray of drinks and fruit upon our arrival. Our room, the least expensive available, was spacious, very attractive and clean, with a large bathroom -- with a tub! -- and all of the amenities. It was quiet and comfortable. The restaurant served delicious food (we had two breakfasts and a dinner there). The staff was absolutely terrific. They helped put together a tour for us with drivers and guides which was went perfectly, provided us with Vietnamese newspapers to bring home for our daughter's design project, arranged a transfer to the airport, stored our luggage while we were out for the day and offered us showers after we had checked out of our room before we left for the airport. Everyone -- the front desk staff, the doormen, the waitresses -- were so friendly and welcoming that it felt less like a hotel and more like we were their personal and valued guests. All of this for such a low price that we thought there had been a mistake! I highly recommend this gem which is tucked into a quiet street in the midst of an area with great restaurants and the waterfront.
h_title_comment: Great hotel for a very reasonable price
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
You arrive down a little alley and wonder if you made the right choice, but as soon as your step through the front door you realise you have. Tremendous staff who will help with anything. I like the way they will organise restaurant reservations and trips without giving you the hard sell. Large well furnished rooms which are kept very clean. The restaurant serves a good breakfast and quality food in the evening. Forgot to mention the price - such good value for money.
Tip - try to get an upper floor so you can sit on your balcony and have a drink with a better view.
h_title_comment: Another good choice on our tour.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Excellent well run Hotel. Don't be put off by narrow side street approach. Its in a quiet location close to shops, restaurants and only a short walk from the DMZ bar great place to spend an eve large screen and TV for sports, pool table and great food
The room was nice and big clean and good storage for your clothes. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly who ever you met nothing was to much trouble for any of them, and always with a smile.I went on a private tour of the DMZ organised by them an exellent and great value full day out. Tours of city can be done through the hotel to your needs. Breakfasts were exellent as were the eve meals which were excellent value for money. Definitely return.

.
h_title_comment: Another stop on my journey south
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We only stayed two nights and would have liked to have stayed longer. We had a superior room which was large and very comfortable. The hotel was very clean and the staff were super friendly and courteous. The hotel is centrally located within easy walking distance of the river and main area. Breakfast is included and was very good with a variety of food choices. I would stay here again when we come back to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Huge, clean and bright room. Vey helpful staff, nice located in a silent side alley, good breakfast and even good massage at there nearby sister hotel. Many good places to go out nearby for all kinds of food.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Location of hotel is little inside main road. Rooms are big n elegantly laid out. Reception also very well serviced. Breakfast was good n sumptuous. Travel counter inside hotel. Bathrooms also adequate size n good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed 3 nights at Hue Serene Palace. The staff were very nice - professional and helpful. The room was nice enough. Our room faced the street/alley - which one night was a little noisy with the Karoke Bar next door but it was not outlandishly noisy. The breakfast in the morning was via menu plus a fruit and fresh bread buffet. There were lots of choices. There were three of us and the hot water almost lasted for the third shower depending on how long the first two were in the shower. The WiFi worked well. Good value for money hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: With regret we only stayed 1 night ,but this was the best resort on or 15 tour ,the staff are the best in Vietnam . From the time we checked in until we left nothing was too much trouble ,room service ,extra pillows ,directions ,make sure you add this place to four must do list
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I stayed here for 2 nights. Check in is quick. My room is on highest floor which is 705. Hotel dont have buffet for breakfast but it has a menu and not limited so you can order what you want. Staff here is very nice and helpful. They have a tour desk in the lobby so will give you any information if you need.
Highly recommend Serene palace.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Great little hotel off the beaten path. Staff are wonderful, rooms are clean and nicely decorated. Kudos to the staff working in the restaurant and compliments to the chef! Best food in Hue in my opinion! We highly recommend staying in this boutique hotel.
h_triptype: NA
